story:
Le projet

Notre  projet d’exposition mettra en avant plan notre travail à titre de finissants du programme Techniques de métiers d’art offert par le Cégep Limoilou  en partenariat avec la Maison des métiers d’art de Québec, l’École de joaillerie de Québec, l’Institut québécois d’ébénisterie ainsi que l’École nationale de lutherie. En effet, après cette formation technique de 3 ans, nous obtiendrons en mai 2018 notre diplôme d’études collégiales.

L’exposition se déroulera du 30 mai au 10 juin 2018 dans la nouvelle salle d'exposition de l'entreprise Madolaine, partenaire de l’événement. Elle mettra en valeur des œuvres utilitaires ou d’expression, des œuvres uniques et de série que nous avons créées, nous, les  finissants des disciplines suivantes : Céramique, Construction textile, Joaillerie, Lutherie - guitare, Ébénisterie artisanale et Sculpture. Cet évènement d’importance placera à l’avant-scène notre talent, notre créativité et notre leadership. Cette première expérience professionnelle nous offrira un rayonnement significatif pour le lancement de notre carrière.

Nous avons besoin de vous!

Nous avons mis en place plusieurs activités de financement afin de combler les besoins financiers pour la réalisation de cet évènement d'envergure. Avec votre aide ainsi que celle de commanditaires et de partenaires, nous espérons amasser  10 000 $ pour notre projet. Jusqu'à maintenant, nous avons récolté plus de 5 000 $ grâce au soutien, en autre, de l'AGEECL. 

Vous êtes sans le sou, mais souhaitez nous aider?

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez nous offrir votre soutien en faisant circuler notre projet dans vos réseaux.

story:
About the artist

Hello! I'm Elitsa Ganeva, Bulgaria-based multidisciplinary artist who works in the fields of video installation, text, photography and painting. I'm raising funds to bring my most recent art installation 'Calyptra' to Nakanojo Biennale in Japan.

It was not until last summer that I got the courage to show publicly my very first video installation at the Water Tower Art Festival in Sofia, Bulgaria. The project won the award for Artistic Debut and a few months later was selected for presentation at the Nakanojo Biennale in Japan.

Exactly five years after my first photography exhibition in my hometown of Veliko Tarnovo, I was honored to have a project of mine noticed and praised by esteemed Japanese artists and curators. Accidental as this may sound, it does not have anything to do with chance, in my opinion. And I will tell you why.

Inspiration & Idea

The idea for ‘Calyptra’ was to a large extent brought about by my fascination with intricate drawings from old botanical books dating back to the 19th century and people’s approach to visualizing plant life at the time. Gradually, of particular interest to me became mosses due to their rootless agility that enables them to cover acres of land and all the stories tangled in and hidden underneath the golden green webs. While trying to reveal clues to how a story unfolds, I discovered the mesmerizing shape of Sphagnum – a very popular type of moss. Its cellular structure, the tiny body with a remarkable water capacity, the survival abilities, the talent of purifying the air and detecting pollution equally drew my attention. I even went to the Liverpool World Museum and took a close look at their moss collection for further insights. One by one the pieces began to fall into place.  

The more I learnt about mosses, the more I realized how many of the answers we are looking for are often beneath us in the form of a smooth green carpet or lengthy fibers pointing in new directions.

Inspired to illuminate my discoveries, I set out to recreate the structure of the moss plant as a screen and project onto it a video of a human figure going in circles as means of interpreting every new beginning and the cycle of life. A cycle that is never ending just as the search for the meaning of life - curious, doubtful, furious, rootless, imprisoned, and then again - free, connected, absorbing, detecting the poisonous occurrences - inside and out. Moss plants are tiny but wise - they are like expressions of Nature’s higher conscience. What is one mistake we often make? Failing to notice what is going on in our own inner universes. Mosses do notice! Those ancient beings are planting so many ideas and answers for us to explore. 

'Calyptra' at NAKANOJO BIENNALE (Japan)

When I got the invitation for Nakanojo Biennale, I began to research mosses that are common in Japan only to find out an impressive variety and be further impressed by the fact that there is even a line about moss in the country’s national anthem. When I created 'Calyptra' I had no clue that one day it might take me as far as Japan. Today it feels like the installation was meant to be shown there.

However, in order to properly display all facets of the installation, I need to transport the screen. It is heavy and a little bit off the standards, so it will be hard and expensive to bring it with me on the plane. By now the project is entirely self-funded but I will need your help to raise funds for the transportation costs and packaging. I will use the services of a european logistics company. The money will also help me buy train and bus tickets. Your help is essential to make this journey possible!

Especially for the installation in Japan I will create and edit the video with new footage of Japanese moss. Also in the works is a plan to turn the shooting process into a workshop with Japanese students who will assist me and also take photographs. Their work will be included in the newly produced video. I am even more inspired to delve into the subject along with children showing them the structure of the plant through my video installation. I hope that this project will draw the attention of people from different backgrounds (artists, students, teachers, scientists) to the idea of exploring nature in an artistic way, in art galleries as well as at schools and other non-traditional venues.

I am planning to donate all the photographs and videos, created on site to the schools of Nakanojo and also to my science consultant Jessica Budke of University of Tennessee, Knoxville, USA. She kindly shared with me a lot of valuable information about mosses that I am very grateful for!

THANKS

I am also very grateful to Christo Harlov who helped me with the technical production of Calyptra in 2016.

The music is also very important part of my installation - the beautiful composition 'Spy from the Void' is created by the Italian band Der Zirkus Brennt. I'm thankful to Dario Mambro who helped me find the perfect sound for the original video, projected on 'Calyptra'.

Big thanks to Todor V. Todorov who also helped me with the technical part and created the lovely animation for the video of the campaign! Your talent inspires me!

Shout out to Mariana Sabeva and Mihail Minchev - you are the best text editing squad in the universe! Thank you!

WHY your HELP is Important

Become part of my dream! Your support will do more than just help me transport my art installation, it will give me HOPE that I am on the right path, doing what I love and creating something of value to people. Not just for me but for a world, in which we reinforce our connection with nature and channel freely our fascination with its marvels through art. Just like I do while overcoming my fears and doubts.

'Calyptra' is about common ground 
we are all made of cells 
we are consistent
we absorb
we connect 
we Are connected
we Are One

Elitsa Ganeva Official Site

Elitsa Ganeva Official Facebook page

Nakanojo Biennale

story:
The Octopussy is a medium size mutant vehicle that will explore the depths of space and time. A radically illuminated octopus/cat hybrid creature, the Octopussy, will perch atop a Geo Metro decorated to appear as a rock in the interstellar ocean.

Description: The Octopussy has ears and nose like a cat, eyes and tentacles like an octopus. The entire structure is covered in white projection grade spandex and internally illuminated by strips of multicolor LEDs connected to a sound reactive controller.  This gives the Octopussy the ability to change color and pattern on the fly, much like her octopus brethren.  Lighting up the night sky, she will bring joy and wonder to all who lay eyes upon her. In addition, the car is painted to appear as a rock in the ocean and has interior blue rope lighting and large plush seating (3-6 people, depending on how snuggly they want to get).  This underwater lounge comes complete with a treasure chest!  The Octopussy is the largest of her kind at approx. 11’ tall x 14’ wide x 17’ long!

Although she is a mutant vehicle, due to land restrictions, the Octopussy will be a stationary art piece for her debut at Apogaea in Bailey, CO on June 10, 2015.  But she will be fully mobile and tentacling about at Element 11 in Stargazer Ranch, UT on July 8, 2015.

Background:  This large-scale project has been underway since August 2014 and will take roughly $2450 to come to life. We have already made some great headway towards this goal by hosting a concert fundraiser in October 2014 where we raise $670. Since then, we have been busy building the base structure and are currently stalled due to lack of funding. We applied for two rounds of Apogaea art grants and despite our grant applications being rated highly with many positive comments, we did not receive funding. Although we are disheartened, we are not deterred!  Anything worth doing does not come easily and we have been presented with a great opportunity to think outside the box and be more creative with our resources. As part of this, we have been crowd sourcing to find materials that can be repurposed for our project. Thankfully we have a very supportive community that has already provided many opportunities that we did not know were available.

In addition to crowd sourcing for materials, we are planning to have another concert fundraiser mid-spring which will hopefully bring us closer to our goal. Fortunately, Kitty and the entire Octopussy team have plenty of experience fundraising for large theme camps. Kitty has played a leadership role in 6 different Apogaea/Burning Man theme camps that were 40-80 people.  The majority of these theme camps had large-scale art projects like the Octopussy.  Last year, one of the projects was the Crystal Gardens, which raised $2566 through Indiegogo!  ( https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/crystal-gard...)

The Crystal Garden project was a major inspiration for the Octopussy! It provided the general idea of using metal conduit structure wrapped in white spandex internally illuminated with light strips!  For the Crystal Gardens, Kitty assisted with multiple aspects of fundraising and was in charge of fulfilling handcrafted perks to 52 supporters!  In addition, she has 4 years of experience volunteer managing a Denver sound production company, which has provided many opportunities orchestrating concert fundraisers.  We already applied for the third Apogaea art grant round, but the maximum we could be awarded for this art grant is $600.  We also applied for an Element 11 art grant to fund transportation to bring the Octopussy to Element 11.  Even if we are awarded these art grants, we still need additional funds to make this project happen! 

How you can help:  The Octopussy team is working very hard to bring this project to life and pursuing all possible funding opportunities including: submitting Apogaea/Element 11 art grants, putting up a donation booth at the Apogaea art fair, and planning additional concert fundraisers.  However, even with all these sources combined, we will need additional funds beyond that to complete this project. This is where we need your help!  This Indiegogo campaign is the last piece needed to complete this fundraising puzzle.

With your support, the Octopussy could be swimming the interstellar ocean near you soon! 

Why you should support the Octopussy:  By supporting this Indiegogo fundraiser, you are bringing immense joy not only to the Octopussy team, but also to many people in the greater Colorado area!  Being big and beautifully bright, the Octopussy is eye candy for everyone in her vicinity.  The Octopussy is one of only a handful of art cars that resides in the Colorado burning community.  So a big, bright, beautiful art car is a wonderful art installation that will delight many burners year after year!  Once completed, the Octopussy team intends on bringing her out as much as possible to share this art with thousands of people!  To all the regional burning man events that they possibly can for the next few years!  In addition, we will also bring her to the First Friday Art Walk in Denver during the summer/fall and to Artocade, an art car parade in Trinidad, CO.  The impact of a large, colorful art piece such as this has the potential to go viral on the internet, delighting people all over the globe!

This project has been a long-term dream in the making.  The Geo Metro base of this art car was previously another art car, the Dubmarine, which was built in 2012 by Kitty and another member of the Octopussy team.  That project was so much fun to work on, so when this vehicle went up for sale, Kitty jumped at the opportunity to snatch it up!  Her deep passion for art, music, cats, and octopi is all coming to fruition at once!  And now, with your help, she has the opportunity to morph this into the project of her dreams!!!

Spread the word:  More important than anything else, you can support the Octopussy by telling everyone you know about this art project!  The more people we can reach, the easier it will be to make her come to life!  Please take a moment to share this page to all your friends, family, facebook, twitter, or preferred social media!  Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Thank you so much for your help!

Perks:  As a big thank you for your support, the Octopussy has some nifty thank you gifts!  She is very crafty, so these unique perks are handcrafted by the Octopussy herself!  As a beautiful creature, she is eager to send headshots to all her supporters!  These will come in the form of stickers and postcards.  For a daily reminder of her magnificence, the Octopussy will send you a tentacle refrigerator magnet!  For those who like to wear cool SWAG, she has tentacle earrings and laser cut pendants!  Art lovers are in luck because the Octopussy will custom make tentacle paintings in your favorite colors.  And for the diehard tentacle enthusiasts, there are tentacle dream catchers! 

Where your funds go:  All funds from this Indiegogo will be going towards the creation of the Octopussy and will not be going towards sound or transportation of the project to events.  Every penny raised will go towards this project, regardless if we reach our Indiegogo financial goal.  Our goal is to complete the Octopussy by Apogaea in June, but we will not stop until she is finished!  If for whatever reason she doesn’t make it to Apogaea, we’ll bring her to Element 11.  In the very unlikely situation that we are unable to bring the Octopussy to either of these events, we will keep working on her and debut this art piece in September 2015 at Artocade.  We are determined to bring the Octopussy to life and will continue fundraising and crowd-sourcing materials until the project is completed.   

We are searching everywhere for cheap/donated items and have ‘Needed Materials’ listed below.  We will keep this list updated here and on facebook (www.facebook.com/tentaclesforall).

Below is a breakdown of the materials needed and their subsequent cost:

Description

Cost

Wood (Plywood & 6ft 4x4)

$50.00

Metal Conduit (400ft)

$175.00

PVC & Fittings (100ft)

$100.00

Hardware (Nuts, Blots, Washers, Screws, Zip-Ties, etc....)

$200.00

Octopussy Lights (LED Strips and Sound Reactive Controller)

$400.00

Generator (2000W)

$575.00

Paint for Exterior Decoration

$125.00

Tools (Conduit Bender & Drill Bits)

$75.00

Interior Decoration (Cushions, Fabric, Rope Light)

$275.00

Geo Maintenance (Tires, Brakes, Shocks & Headlights)

$475.00

Total

$2,450.00


Octopussy Needed Materials List

·  Qty 4 - Large Cushions
·  Fish shaped pillows - fish/underwater themed fabric, batting/stuffing
·  Blue/green blanket for interior to cover cushions 
·  100 feet of 1.5” PVC
·  Qty 11 - 1.5" PVC T Fitting ·  Qty 6 - 2" PVC Y Fittings
·  Qty 2 - 1.5" 3 Way Elbow Fitting
·  Qty 2 - 1.5" PVC Cross Fitting
·  Qty 2 - 1.5" PVC 45 Degree Elbow Fitting
·  Qty 12 - L Brackets
·  Qty  100 - Jumbo 175lbs Zip-Ties
·  80' of 3/4” of Metal Conduit
·  Qty 2 - Brown duct tape
·  1 Yard - Black Canvas for Eyes
·  White spandex
·  Quilt Batting for Padding for the Tips of the Tentacles
·  Pool noodles for Padding for the Tips of the Tentacles
·  2 Gallons of Brown Exterior Acrylic Latex paint
·  1 Gallon Exterior Acrylic Latex Paint – Blue, Red, White, Green, Pink (for coral/sea life on car exterior)
·  25' Extension cord
·  6 plus surge protector
·  2000 watt generator (free/cheap/discounted)


If you’re in the Denver area and are interested in helping out, we are in need of:

-  General Car Maintenance
-  Metal Conduit Bending
-  Good/Advanced Sewers
-  Experience with large scale structures/Art Cars
-  Re-conditioning speakers
-  HVAC
-  People that are generally handy and would like to get involved


NITTY GRITTY DETAILS FOR THOSE INTERESTED IN PROJECT LOGISTICS: 

The Geo Metro will have two plywood boards in a cross pattern bolted to the roof that will provide a sturdy and flat surface to anchor the Octopussy. In the center of Octopussy board, attached to the plywood with metal L brackets, we will build a small wooden crate that will house Two JBL JRX100 active monitors and a 2000W generator. The monitors and generator will attach to the wooden crate using ratchet straps and bungees to prevent any movement. In addition, the car will be painted to appear as a rock in the ocean and will have interior blue rope lighting around all safe entry points into the car. All doors and the back hatch have been removed as well as all seats besides the driver seat. In order to provide comfortable seating for all occupants, large plush cushions will line the rear (formally the back seat and trunk) and the passenger seat will provide storage for an emergency kit (basic first aid kit, tarps, ratchet straps and bungees, a bullhorn, and a fire extinguisher), occupants bags, and will house a small mixer that will provide sound to the two monitors that are encapsulated in the head.

The Octopussy has ears and nose like a cat, eyes and tentacles like an octopus. The entire structure will be covered in white projection grade spandex and will be internally illuminated by strips of multicolor 5050 SMD LEDs giving the Octopussy ability to change color on the fly. In addition to being sound reactive, IR remotes will provide the ability to control the color and pattern of the lights in real time. We will attach lights to the structure of the Octopussy with zip-ties in order to illuminate the entirety of the interior. The tentacles of the Octopussy will be made of 3/4” metal conduit that will be bent to shape and will connect to metal conduit cubes that are bolted directly on all four corners to the plywood roof of the Geo. The tips of the tentacles will be padded with either pool noodles or quilt batting depending on the width of the tentacle. In addition, each tentacle will also be internally illuminated for safety and splendor. The head of the Octopussy will be made primarily of PVC and will have a wooden 4x4 in the center for support. The wooden 4x4 mounted in the center of roof with metal L brackets and braced on the sides by the two monitors. If needed, we will add bracing on the front and back of the 4x4 to provide more support. The base of the head attaches to a PVC collar, which will then attach to the metal conduit cubes with jumbo 175lbs zip-ties. The ears and nose of the head will be made from PVC and will attach to the main structure of the head to provide more stability. In order to give the illusion of an octopus eye, the eyes will be made of black fabric stitched to the white projection grade spandex cover with giant googly eye pupils.

Every hybrid creature needs a fuel source and the Octopussy is no different. In addition to being fueled by beautiful smiles and dancing feet, the lights and sound will be powered by a 2000W gas generator that is housed inside the Octopussy's head.  Since the Octopussy is entirely covered in spandex, proper ventilation of the head is a must and will be provided by a professional HVAC technician.

these sources combined, we will need additional funds beyond that to complete
this project. This is where we need your help! 
This Indiegogo campaign is the last piece needed to complete this
fundraising puzzle.
With your support, the Octopussy could be swimming the
interstellar ocean near you soon!  
Why you should support the Octopussy:  By supporting this Indiegogo
fundraiser, you are bringing immense joy not only to the Octopussy team, but
also to many people in the greater Colorado area!  Being big and beautifully bright, the
Octopussy is eye candy for everyone in her vicinity.  The Octopussy is one of only a handful of art
cars that resides in the Colorado burning community.  So a big, bright, beautiful art car is a
wonderful art installation that will delight many burners year after year!  Once completed, the Octopussy team intends on
bringing her out as much as possible to share this art with thousands of
people!  To all the regional burning man
events that they possibly can for the next few years!  In addition, we will also bring her to the
First Friday Art Walk in Denver during the summer/fall and to Artocade, an art car parade in Trinidad, CO.  The impact of a large, colorful art piece
such as this has the potential to go viral on the internet, delighting people
all over the globe! 
This project has been a long-term dream
in the making.  The Geo Metro base of
this art car was previously another art car, the Dubmarine, which was built in
2012 by Kitty and another member of the Octopussy team.  That project was so much fun to work on, so
when this vehicle went up for sale, Kitty jumped at the opportunity to snatch
it up!  Her deep passion for art, music,
cats, and octopi is all coming to fruition at once!  And now, with your help, she has the
opportunity to morph this into the project of her dreams!!!
Spread the word:  More
important than anything else, you can support the Octopussy by telling everyone
you know about this art project!  The
more people we can reach, the easier it will be to make her come to life!  Please take a moment to share this page to
all your friends, family, facebook, twitter, or preferred social media!  Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Thank you so much for your help!
Perks:  As
a big thank you for your support, the Octopussy has some nifty thank you
gifts!  She is very crafty, so these
unique perks are handcrafted by the Octopussy herself!  As a beautiful creature, she is eager to send
headshots to all her supporters!  These will
come in the form of stickers and postcards. 
For a daily reminder of her magnificence, the Octopussy will send
you a tentacle refrigerator magnet!  For
those who like to wear cool SWAG, she has tentacle earrings and laser cut
pendants!  Art lovers are in luck because
the Octopussy will custom make tentacle paintings in your favorite colors.  And for the diehard tentacle enthusiasts,
there are tentacle dream catchers!  
Where your funds go:  All funds from this Indiegogo will be going towards the
creation of the Octopussy and will not be going towards sound or transportation
of the project to events.  Every penny
raised will go towards this project, regardless if we reach our Indiegogo financial goal.  Our goal is to complete the Octopussy by
Apogaea in June, but we will not stop until she is finished!  If for whatever reason she doesn’t make it to
Apogaea, we’ll bring her to Element 11. 
In the very unlikely situation that we are unable to bring the Octopussy
to either of these events, we will keep working on her and debut this art piece
in September 2015 at Artocade.  We are
determined to bring the Octopussy to life and will continue fundraising and
crowd-sourcing materials until the project is completed.   
We
are searching everywhere for cheap/donated items and have ‘Needed Materials’
listed below.  We will keep this list
updated here and on facebook (www.facebook.com/tentaclesforall). 
Below is a breakdown of the materials
needed and their subsequent cost:




Description


Cost




Wood (Plywood & 6ft 4x4)


$50.00




Metal Conduit (400ft)


$175.00




PVC & Fittings (100ft)


$100.00




Hardware (Nuts, Blots, Washers,
  Screws, Zip-Ties, etc....)


$200.00




Octopussy Lights (LED Strips
  and Sound Reactive Controller)


$400.00




Generator (2000W)


$575.00




Paint for Exterior Decoration


$125.00




Tools (Conduit Bender &
  Drill Bits)


$75.00




Interior Decoration (Cushions,
  Fabric, Rope Light)


$275.00




Geo Maintenance (Tires, Brakes,
  Shocks & Headlights)


$475.00










Total


$2,450.00





Octopussy Needed Materials List
· 
Qty 4 - Large Cushions · 
Fish shaped pillows - fish/underwater themed fabric, batting/stuffing· 
Blue/green blanket for interior to cover cushions · 
100 feet of 1.5” PVC· 
Qty 11 - 1.5" PVC T Fitting · 
Qty 6 - 2" PVC Y Fittings· 
Qty 2 - 1.5" 3 Way Elbow Fitting· 
Qty 2 - 1.5" PVC Cross Fitting· 
Qty 2 - 1.5" PVC 45 Degree Elbow Fitting· 
Qty 12 - L Brackets· 
Qty  100 - Jumbo 175lbs Zip-Ties·  80' of 3/4” of Metal Conduit· 
Qty 2 - Brown duct tape· 
1 Yard - Black Canvas for Eyes· 
White spandex· 
Quilt Batting for Padding for the Tips of the Tentacles· 
Pool noodles for Padding for the Tips of the Tentacles· 
2 Gallons of Brown Exterior Acrylic Latex paint· 
1 Gallon Exterior Acrylic Latex Paint – Blue, Red, White, Green, Pink
(for coral/sea life on car exterior)· 
25' Extension cord· 
6 plus surge protector· 
2000 watt generator (free/cheap/discounted)
If
you’re in the Denver area and are interested in helping out, we are in need of:-  General Car Maintenance-  Metal Conduit Bending-  Good/Advanced Sewers-  Experience with large scale
structures/Art Cars-  Re-conditioning speakers-  HVAC-  People that are generally handy and
would like to get involved
NITTY GRITTY DETAILS FOR THOSE
INTERESTED IN PROJECT LOGISTICS:  
The
Geo Metro will have two plywood boards in a cross pattern bolted to the roof
that will provide a sturdy and flat surface to anchor the Octopussy. In the
center of Octopussy board, attached to the plywood with metal L brackets, we
will build a small wooden crate that will house Two JBL JRX100 active monitors
and a 2000W generator. The monitors and generator will attach to the wooden
crate using ratchet straps and bungees to prevent any movement. In addition,
the car will be painted to appear as a rock in the ocean and will have interior
blue rope lighting around all safe entry points into the car. All doors and the
back hatch have been removed as well as all seats besides the driver seat. In
order to provide comfortable seating for all occupants, large plush cushions
will line the rear (formally the back seat and trunk) and the passenger seat
will provide storage for an emergency kit (basic first aid kit, tarps, ratchet
straps and bungees, a bullhorn, and a fire extinguisher), occupants bags, and
will house a small mixer that will provide sound to the two monitors that are
encapsulated in the head.
The
Octopussy has ears and nose like a cat, eyes and tentacles like an octopus. The
entire structure will be covered in white projection grade spandex and will be
internally illuminated by strips of multicolor 5050 SMD LEDs giving the
Octopussy ability to change color on the fly. In addition to being sound
reactive, IR remotes will provide the ability to control the color and pattern
of the lights in real time. We will attach lights to the structure of the
Octopussy with zip-ties in order to illuminate the entirety of the interior.
The tentacles of the Octopussy will be made of 3/4” metal conduit that will be bent
to shape and will connect to metal conduit cubes that are bolted directly on
all four corners to the plywood roof of the Geo. The tips of the tentacles will
be padded with either pool noodles or quilt batting depending on the width of
the tentacle. In addition, each tentacle will also be internally illuminated for
safety and splendor. The head of the Octopussy will be made primarily of PVC
and will have a wooden 4x4 in the center for support. The wooden 4x4 mounted in
the center of roof with metal L brackets and braced on the sides by the two monitors.
If needed, we will add bracing on the front and back of the 4x4 to provide more
support. The base of the head attaches to a PVC collar, which will then attach
to the metal conduit cubes with jumbo 175lbs zip-ties. The ears and nose of the
head will be made from PVC and will attach to the main structure of the head to
provide more stability. In order to give the illusion of an octopus eye, the
eyes will be made of black fabric stitched to the white projection grade
spandex cover with giant googly eye pupils.
Every hybrid creature needs a fuel source and
the Octopussy is no different. In addition to being fueled by beautiful smiles
and dancing feet, the lights and sound will be powered by a 2000W gas generator
that is housed inside the Octopussy's head. 
Since the Octopussy is entirely covered in spandex, proper ventilation
of the head is a must and will be provided by a professional HVAC technician.

story:
Short Summary

The Tree of Changes is an interactive sculpture and real-time data-visualization portrait of people's cumulative thoughts, wishes, and feelings. 

We are excited to be exhibiting the tree at the Market Street Prototyping Festival in San Francisco from April 9-11, 2015. 

The Tree of Changes draws inspiration from the Japanese wish tree and I Ching. It offers a public participatory experience for self expression and immersive reflection.

From a distance, the installation appears as a sculptural tree. Upon further investigation, the tree comes alive with swarming colors and animations through the trunk and branches in subtle and elegant patterns. Recorded voices, transformed and restructured, call from the canopy to create a mesmerizing soundscape.

Interactivity

The Tree of Change's shifting nebulae of audiovisual activity invites passersby to approach its trunk and speak wishes into the tree. The tree analyzes sentiments and speech in real-time and visualizes each wish by illuminating the tree as the wish travels to its destination.The Tree of Changes becomes more vibrant and alive with light and ambient sound throughout the day as wishes are aggregated through the canopy. 

Why help?

It's time for changes: in people's lives and in the world. 

Completing this tree will enable people to express their hopes and wishes for change. Every person interacting with the tree will have the opportunity to express their individual wish, and at the same time, experience their community's wishes. 

Every hour, all the recorded wishes will play back at fast pace in a whirlwind of light and sound to acknowledge and celebrate all the individual and collective wishes for change.

With your help, and sufficient funding, we will be able to build in additional functionality to the tree. We would like to allow people to interact remotely by texting or tweeting their wishes that would generate a word cloud in real time on the web.

The Team

Yael Braha: Artist (Original concept, Design [tree], 3D modeling, metal fabrication, electronics, producer)
Vlad Spears: Interactivity, Audio & LED programming 
Adam Bernstein: Design (base, wishes), engineering, LED, Electronics
Ding Dong: Fabrication, Electronics & guidance
JoeJoe Martin: LED, Electronics & guidance 
John (Parts) Taylor: LED, Electronics & guidance 
Aïcha Doucoure: UX Design
Natasha Nicolai: Research, wood fabrication
Matthew Goss: Sentiment Analysis, Machine Learning
Desmond Shea: Electronics, Audio
David Piller: Fabrication, Ring Master, assistant metal fabrication
Sam Wysocki: Fabrication, Productivity Master
Sugar Ray Ray Riggins: Seamstress
Chach Sikes: Additional Programming
Eugene Huang: Video
Lincoln Smith: Video & Edit 
Additional help: Ryan McDonnell, Remy Pieron, Jefferson Fellows, Cat Murphy-Bevan, Thomas Small
Thank you: Liz Judkins, Peef, Hoss Ward, Michael Christian
Special Thanks: Autodesk, City of San Francisco, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, Global Fund for Women, KQED

What We Need

We need your help to bring the Tree of Changes to life! We have received a $2000 stipend from the festival (which has already been spent for various test materials, supplies, equipment, and a portion of the metal) but there's plenty more to be bought. Here's a breakdown how your contribution will be used:

  • $1,200 LED strips and LED pucks
  • $1,200 fabric and tree skin
  • $800 metal rods
  • $500 metal sheet & CNC
  • $300 electronics & speakers
  • $300 wooden base
  • $300 truck rental
  • $200 misc expendables (tubing, MIG wire, gas tank, 3D filament)
  • $200 rigging equipment
    =$5,000

Additional contributions beyond the $5,000 will be utilized as such:

  • $500 food for 16 wonderful crew members who are all volunteering their time!
  • $1,000 Enabling people to text or tweet their wishes to the Tree remotely
  • $1,000 Creating a custom algorithm that analyzes the wishes, generates a word cloud, and posts it in real time on the web.
  • $1,000 Mac mini

Here are other ways that you can help:

  • Have a 12+ft. truck? We could use some help transporting the tree to the festival!
  • Have some goodie good food or gift cards? We could feed our wonderful 16-person crew who are all volunteering their time!
  • We need 8 pairs of computer speakers!
  • Have a Mac mini around and don't use it? We will!

Thank you for your support!

story:
Dear Friends, Eldertians, those once a part of this community, those yet to be, the adopted vagabonds, passersby, the lost, the found, and, well, everyone:

I've been casually freezing time from this wacky, (once) isolated kingdom since 2005 and I wanted to start a more serious documentation of a handful of Eldert's characters. So I embarked on recruiting my friends and neighbors to take off their clothes for a few photographic portraits while we still look good, and are still able to get away with a bit of public nudity here in our beloved hood. 

Those photos, carefully and collaboratively selected, are now available in full color and high quality for your endless viewing pleasure in calendar form! 

Initial proceeds will all go towards a project to benefit the entire Eldert community. The exact project is to be decided by everyone who participated in making this calendar. The more you all buy, the less the per-unit cost will be,  and the greater the percentage available will be to put into a community project. So think about buying them for friends and family members!

I started this thing about three and a half years ago now, and it's been a great artistic outlet and community interaction. I really appreciate the time, effort and patience of everyone who helped out and everyone who wants to share this project with me. You'll recognize the faces (and perhaps other parts) if you've been here a bit, and if not, you can just bask in the shapeliness of these nude strangers from 345 Eldert.

So, here we are, I hope you enjoy it.

Love always, 

Christiana

All profits from calendar sales (after printing and shipping costs) will go towards a TBD project to benefit our entire 345 Eldert community (will be decided by project participants)  up to $1000.

Beyond $1000, profits from calendar sales will be distributed as follows: 3% each to the models involved, 20% to the photographer*, and 20% to said community project. This will include profits from calendars only - additional money generated from perks offered by community members will all go directly to the community project.

*trying a new home-brewed business model:

 -all participating members remain active parts of the project and continue to get paid throughout any success

-great for no budget projects that would love to give back 

-with the intention to help all the generous artists involved eventually have their own budgets

story:
Hello!

We are Bob Cattarall and Chloe Ashley, and we are currently graduate artists in residence at AirSpace Gallery, Stoke-on-Trent. As part of our residency scheme, we have been offered the amazing opportunity to each have our first solo shows with AirSpace in January 2014. We both want to put on brilliant shows, not only to help each of our careers, but also to raise the profile of Stoke’s art scene! However brilliant shows don’t come cheap, and we need your help to make each show a glorious success.

We need as much as you can give to create professional and dynamics shows, however anything would be fab (even a penny)! Each contribution will seriously help with the costing of marketing, the creation of publications, the purchase of materials, and everything else that goes into producing an exhibition. With every pledge you will receive some wonderful handmade pieces, with even the opportunity to own original works from each artist. You will also be invited to each of our exhibition private views in January, where you will be able to drink a copious amount of FREE wine!

                     

(Above) - Example of some of the perks you could receive, please check out the gallery for further info!

Please spread the word about our campaign and if you have any questions, feel free to pop into AirSpace Gallery (wed-fri) or drop us an email.

Thank You!

Chloe and Bob

About

Chloe Ashley- Situated within the West Midlands, Chloe Ashley is a fine art practitioner specialising within archaic and alternative photographic techniques. Her interests revolve around the notion of the uncanny within the domestic, which is investigated through photographic distortion to discover the jarring from the mundane. In pursuing distortion through photography, a vast range of alternative processes have featured within the practice, though her current focus on sculptural manipulation of the print has become increasingly present within the work.

http://chloe-ashley.tumblr.com/

chloeashley193@gmail.com

Bob Catterall -  Based upon his science fiction narratives, Bob Catterall produces conceptual sculptures and installations that reflect his keen interest in the form and function of space, underpinned with social, political and environmental themes. Inspired by locality and current affairs, his narratives become the blue prints that draft architectural models, which juxtapose clean, minimalist exteriors against dirty, cluttered interiors. His current practice developed in Stoke-on-Trent, where once busy ceramics factories now lay derelict, their once gleaming windows shattered like the futures of the employees left to struggle through the industrial recession. Now, as Bob comes to the end of his residency there is a new threat looming on the horizon of Stoke-on-Trent, that of the hydraulic gas industry and with it the potential for history to repeat at the cost of the city's residents. 

www.facebook.com/bobcatterallartist


bobcatterall@ymail.com

AirSpace Gallery- AirSpace Gallery is a collaborative, artist led project in Stoke-on-Trent, providing professional development opportunities, studio and exhibiting space and support for artists. Through a dynamic and evolving programme of exhibitions, events and activities AirSpace Gallery brings critical, high quality contemporary art to the region and provides opportunities for a broad range of artists.

Since Opening; the gallery has worked with a number of internationally acclaimed artists including; Martin Creed, Doug Fishbone, Charlie Danby, David Blandy, Peter Finnmore, Johanna Hällsten, Alex Frost, Littlewhitehead, Rinat Kolter, Adam James, Nicklas Goldbach, AndersonMacgee. Richard T. Walker, Ryan Gander, Mariele Neudecker, Marcus Coates, Annika Ström, Heather and Ivan Morison, Alan Currall, Paul Rooney, Shaun Doyle and Mally Mallinson, Harminder Singh Judge and Hetain Patel. 

AirSpace Gallery has an ongoing series of projects, which are developed through open submissions and invited artists. This makes for an exciting and vibrant mix of artwork and events.

http://www.airspacegallery.org/2007/

mail@airspacegallery.org

story:
Painting A New Refugee Home by Nurban Art Project

The Nurban Art Project is an organization that has been founded by Julian Vogel, Marco Wegfahrt and Guy Palumbo with the goal of getting as many murals put up in the city of Nürnberg as possible in both the public and private sector.  This is our very first project. 

About two weeks ago, we were informed that there is an office building being converted to house refugees here on Witschelstr. 73 in Nürnberg, and we were asked to donate our time and make this new home for the incoming refugees welcoming and a bit more beautiful.  We happily accepted. 

This project is incredibly important to us because most if not all of the people who will be living in this building have come from incredibly difficult situations in war-torn regions and in many cases have sacrificed all that they have to make the long journey to Europe and land here in Germany.  We want to make sure that we can do our part to make them feel welcome here and also feel like they are moving into a real home after all they have been through.

The artists working on this project will be Julian Vogel and Cris Krieger, both long time mural artists based in Nürnberg, and Guy Palumbo, who will be contributing his first piece of this scale.  Julian and Guy have already gotten started because the scaffolding on the north side of the building is only there for a limited time and Julian will be heading off soon to Baghdad to do his part to make some walls more beautiful over there.  Cris will be painting the west side during the third and fourth weeks of November. The fourth, a collaboration piece, will be done when Julian is back from Iraq, over the course of the last week of November and the first week of December.

What We Need & What You Get

So in order to do these four murals, we need €850 to cover the costs of all the materials for 4 large pieces, 3 of which will be 4 x 9 meters (approx. 13 x 30 feet), and 1 mural that is 2.5 x 9 meters (8 x 30 feet).  It is a respectable amount of real estate to be covered, and we are going to need a lot of paint.  You can see how we are planing to approach the building in the image of the plan which is both at the top of this page and the gallery. Don't let the orange fool you! This is just a sketch, there will be plenty of color on those walls.

While we have some pretty nice perks, you will also be getting is the ability to see exactly what is being done with your money.  We know there are many campaigns that you could give your money to, but with this one you will have four very large murals that you will be able to see online and in person if you ever come to Nürnberg. 

The Impact

This is an office building that has been converted into an apartment building, and it is not in a residential area.  It is surrounded by car dealerships, mechanics and a furniture store.  Getting these paintings up will make this place feel like a home, and that does a lot for the spirits after a long, hard journey to start a new life.

If you want to get an idea of current neighborhood and why there needs to be some concrete beautification, go to google maps, type Witschelstr. 73, Nürnberg, and check it out on street view.  We can make this better.

Share

We are well aware that not everyone has cash that they can donate, so if you would be so kind as to share this project we would be VERY GRATEFUL!
story_txt:
Painting A New Refugee Home by Nurban Art Project
 The Nurban Art Project is an organization that has been founded by Julian Vogel, Marco Wegfahrt and Guy Palumbo with the goal of getting as many murals put up in the city of Nürnberg as possible in both the public and private sector.  This is our very first project.  
About two weeks ago, we were informed that there is an office building being converted to house refugees here on Witschelstr. 73 in Nürnberg, and we were asked to donate our time and make this new home for the incoming refugees welcoming and a bit more beautiful.  We happily accepted.  
This project is incredibly important to us because most if not all of the people who will be living in this building have come from incredibly difficult situations in war-torn regions and in many cases have sacrificed all that they have to make the long journey to Europe and land here in Germany.  We want to make sure that we can do our part to make them feel welcome here and also feel like they are moving into a real home after all they have been through.
The artists working on this project will be Julian Vogel and Cris Krieger, both long time mural artists based in Nürnberg, and Guy Palumbo, who will be contributing his first piece of this scale.  Julian and Guy have already gotten started because the scaffolding on the north side of the building is only there for a limited time and Julian will be heading off soon to Baghdad to do his part to make some walls more beautiful over there.  Cris will be painting the west side during the third and fourth weeks of November. The fourth, a collaboration piece, will be done when Julian is back from Iraq, over the course of the last week of November and the first week of December. 
  What We Need & What You GetSo in order to do these four murals, we need €850 to cover the costs of all the materials for 4 large pieces, 3 of which will be 4 x 9 meters (approx. 13 x 30 feet), and 1 mural that is 2.5 x 9 meters (8 x 30 feet).  It is a respectable amount of real estate to be covered, and we are going to need a lot of paint.  You can see how we are planing to approach the building in the image of the plan which is both at the top of this page and the gallery. Don't let the orange fool you! This is just a sketch, there will be plenty of color on those walls.While we have some pretty nice perks, you will also be getting is the ability to see exactly what is being done with your money.  We know there are many campaigns that you could give your money to, but with this one you will have four very large murals that you will be able to see online and in person if you ever come to Nürnberg.  
  The ImpactThis is an office building that has been converted into an apartment building, and it is not in a residential area.  It is surrounded by car dealerships, mechanics and a furniture store.  Getting these paintings up will make this place feel like a home, and that does a lot for the spirits after a long, hard journey to start a new life.If you want to get an idea of current neighborhood and why there needs to be some concrete beautification, go to google maps, type Witschelstr. 73, Nürnberg, and check it out on street view.  We can make this better.

We are well aware that not everyone has cash that they can donate, so if you would be so kind as to share this project we would be VERY GRATEFUL!

story:
To further push to make sure I will have all the supplies I need for this amazing trip, anyone who donates at the $5 mark (and above) will get an original 5x7" woodblock print as well as the other perks listed at that level. Fancy!!!


A massive 'thank you' to ALL the contributers for making this trip of mine possible. Know that you've enabled me to live out a dream!!!




Summary

Greetings! My name is Brandon Stewart and I am an artist from Seattle, Washington. For 10 years I have made my living as a freelance illustrator, picking up commissions and illustration jobs. But it's time to start being serious about my career, and this campaign is a step in that direction.


For too long I sat neutral without making steps to further my art career. But I finally did it, and signed up to exhibit my art amongst some of the most talented and elite fantasy/sci-fi artists working in the field today, and to my surprise I WAS ACCEPTED. This art show, SPECTRUM FANTASTIC ART LIVE is a huge opportunity to meet and chat with artists that I've been inspired by since I was a little dude making funny alien drawings. My hope is not just just to stammer around in awe, but to learn from the best of the best.


To further show my excitement, I will be maintaining a website dedicated to my trip. From the planning stages to the event itself, I will keep all contributers, or you folks that are merely interested, updated with my progress. I'll post photos and videos from the road and let everyone know where I'm at and what I'm doing. Be on the lookout for amazing sunset pictures and nerdy photos of me with some of my heroes!!! Please visit the website here.


I have posted some of my artwork (an eclectic mix) in the Gallery (tab above), but if you would like to see more: Go here for my 'darker' artwork, and go here, for some of the cuter, happier work.


For more info on SPECTRUM FANTSATIC ART LIVE (and to see my name list amongst the other exhibitors), go to: http://spectrumfantasticartlive.com/


By contributing even the smallest amount, I am that much closer to achieving a huge goal that I've had for many years. Thank you so much for your support in advance. Words cannot express how I will feel if this campaign is successful....


What We Need & What You Get

I am hoping to get together $2000 for this venture. Since there are too many variables when it comes to a 4000 mile round trip drive, I'll break down my monetary needs the best that I can, and I've tried to be conservative:

  • Fuel costs.

This is a very long trip and my calculations bring me to about $900-1200 in gas alone.

  • Food.

The wife and I will need to eat! But I assure you, we aren't fancy people that will be eating out all the time. Most of our food we will bring with, and our daily diet will most likely consist of snacks, because we don't have the time to stop and eat everytime someone is hungry. I can't even begin to guess at what this might cost. Cost estimate: $150-200

  • Lodging

On our drive my wife and I will likely be sleeping at rest stops, but when we reach Kansas City, Missouri,  we'll need a place to call 'home' for the 3 day event. My research maintains that hotel/motel rooms can run anywhere from $50-100 per night. We don't need a presidential suite, just a room without bugs. 

  • Supplies

Before we venture out, I will need to make sure that I have plenty of prints on hand to sell and business cards to handout. I will also need packaging supplies for all the prints and a few containers to haul things in. Cost estimate: $250


BECAUSE YOU ARE SUPER AWESOME AND HAVE DECIDED TO DONATE TO MY CAUSE, HERE ARE SOME POSSIBILITIES OF WHAT YOU MIGHT RECEIVE (depending of course, upon what tier you choose):

  • Lower Tier ($1 and $5):

This tier offers a thank you on my trip website and a hand-written postcard.

  • Middle Tier ($10-50):

The middle tier is an assortment of hand-signed prints sized at 4x6", 8x10" and 11x14". Print size varies depending on what monetary increment you choose. You pick which one you want from the prints that I have available. Below are some examples. Please see the GALLERY tab above for more choices). But along with that, this level also offers what the lower tier does as well.

  • Upper Echelon ($100-500):

The highest levels offer original paintings (done in acrylic and/or ink, with imagery of your choice*). At $100, you'll get a 5x7" original painting. At $250, you'll get an original 11x14" painting. The $100 and $250 perks will also receive the website 'thank you' AND the hand-written postcard, PLUS I'll toss in a shirt for you. At the highest perk level you'll get an original 18x24" painting, PLUS EVERYTHING from the lower tiers. Also, as an added bonus, I'll throw in my 2013 artbook titled DEPARTURE.

*my apologies, but I have to say 'your choice' to an extent. I cannot recreate the dot painting of Seurat or do a family portrait of 50 people. We can discuss your ideas later :)


4x6" PRINT EXAMPLES


8x10" PRINT EXAMPLES


11x14" PRINT EXAMPLES


The Impact

Without your help, this opportunity wouldn't be possible. This might be baby steps in the scale of a lifetime, but this is a massive leap in the right direction for my art career. I absolutely cannot thank you enough for your generosity!!! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to the cause, it's ok, I certainly won't hate you. But please, SHARE this campaign with EVERYONE you know on Facebook, Twitter or whatever social media suits your fancy. Help this go as viral as all of those cute kitty videos!!!

story:
Our Gallery

We aspire to help young artists make a career from their talent by giving them a place to exhibit their work.

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $1500 to pay rent, electric, and credit card machine for the gallery. We want to have a place to not only exhibit fine art, but teach young people the importance and value of the skill. We need help in keeping our doors open and advertising so we can get young artists on the right career path without having to ask too much of them.

The Impact

Our project is important because the need for art is dire. Art helps people relate to sociological and psycological aspects of their own personality though creation, and the mere ability to showcase and bring up artists allows young people to have a clear understanding of themselves and their community by visually understanding a specific artists place in society. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate, we would still very much appreciate your help in sharing our campaign. We want to get people into our gallery so the artists on display can sell their work and make a living. Art is not an easy thing, and it requires great time and talent, along with creativity. We would greatly appreciate if you could send people our way!


Dresher Arcade #5
319 W. Main Street
Lansdale PA 19446


Thank You!

story:
This project will help Arte Capoeira Center and Abada-Capoeira NYC bring in guests from around the world to attend and participate in our Batizado and Workshops. These guests bring in amazing amounts of energy and knowledge to the Batizado performance and student workshops but it's also very costly to bring them in from around the world. Without them our event would be incomplete and that's where we need your help! 


About Instructor Mucuiu 
Instrutor Mucuiù is the Founder and Executive Director of the Arte Capoeira Center. He has been teaching capoeira in the New York City area for over 15 years. Originally from Rio de Janeiro, Instrutor Mucuiù has always been fond of sport and healthy lifestyle. Besides capoeira, he has been training judo, swimming and Brazilian Ju-jitsu. He has a black belt in judo and has competed in many tournaments.

Capoeira is...
Capoeira is a Brazilian Martial Art that combines elements of dance, acrobatics, fighting and music. Developed in the 16th century, it was practiced in secret by African slaves and disguised a dance to fool the slave owners who had outlawed it. Capoeira incorporates music, dance and acrobatics with many deceptive and complex strikes and techniques to create a one of a kind martial art.


Batizado is...
The "Batizado" (baptism, in English) is a ceremonial roda where new students will get recognized as capoeiristas and earn their first graduation. Also more experienced students may go up in rank, depending on their skills and capoeira culture.

Please help spread the word to everyone you know!

story:
PeaceNow, a 501c3 non-profit, was formed to enlist a community of supporters who will create the momentum, passion, participation, and creativity to begin a new era of lasting global peace.

The goal with our “Street Art Campaign for PeaceNow” is to connect with the public at large, and inspire and empower them to work toward a peaceful future.  We want to make world peace not only possible, but inevitable.

Art in all forms has the power to move the hearts and minds of people. The awesome murals your money will help create, will sow the seeds of peace in communities around the world. You have the power for change at your fingertips.

PeaceNow is a grass roots effort, and so it is fitting that a grass roots artist is giving her gift of talent and passion to demonstrate how you can take action for peace. Jules Muck is a street muralist and a very talented artist.  An earthy soul who finds a concrete wall at 9am, and by 5pm has let inspiration push her to finish another stop-you-in-your-tracks painting.

When Jules was told about the PeaceNow vision of joining one billion people together for peace, her reply was “Hell, yes”.  We spent 10 minutes discussing possible peace icons and the next day, at 626 Ceres St on Skid Row in Los Angeles, the completed mural of Mahatma Gandhi was on the wall!

Jules is ready to use your donations to pay for herself and her team to create street art images of John Lennon, Martin Luther King, Mother Teresa, and other peace icons, in Miami, New York, Mexico City, and cities around the world.  PeaceNow needs people that DO!  People like Jules Muck, and people like you! 

Together, we need to be thinking peace, being peace, and doing peace. By donating whatever your resources allow, you will be part of a campaign to make peace a part of how we choose to live our lives. 

We are at a critical juncture when the intractable problems confronting nations have been fused into one common concern for the whole world’s survival; failure to act to stem the tide of conflict would be irresponsible.  If you believe peace is needed NOW, we are asking you to support PeaceNow, and donate to our Street Art Campaign!

JULES MUCK, ARTIST

Jules Muck started doing graffiti in Europe and great Britain almost twenty years ago. Muck began bombing in New York in the late 90s where she was discovered by Lady Pink who took her on as an apprentice for the next 4 years. Under her tag name Muck she has shown at Tokyo Big Site, the Bronx Museum of Art, the Weisman Museum in Minneapolis and the Fuse Gallery in New York. She has been publishedin Ganz's Graffiti Women, Cey Adam's Definitions and both of the Murrays books Burning New York and Broken Windows. 

Since moving to LA three years ago and adding her first name Jules to the equation, Jules Muck has shown at The Pacific Design Center and Rivera Gallery in Hollywood. Her murals are prominent all over the Venice Beach area, where she lives and has her studio. Most recently her works are on the side of Gjelina restaurant on Abbey Kinney Blvd. The Main Street Lindsay Lohan portrait was featured on Access Hollywood and in Newsweek's The Daily Beast.
*Our special thanks and appreciation to Buddy Clark for introducing Jules Muck to PeaceNow

SCOTT BRUER, PEACENOW FOUNDER

Scott Bruer is the founder and president of PeaceNow.com, a 501c3 nonprofit organization.  Scott formed PeaceNow with the intention of gathering one billion signatures for a peace petition supporting  the creation of departments of peace and peace economies. With the power of one billion signatures, the petition will be presented to the United Nations and all 196 countries of the Earth.

As the visionary and leader of this quickly growing organization, Scott continues to create initiatives to support the creation of peace and the successful collection of signatures. The PeaceNow Three Pillars to Create Peace include a Peace Practitioner Course, Peace Business Certifications, and the Peace as an Economic Engine Symposium.  Our mission began with the “ONE BILLION Signatures for Peace” petition drive and now, to further our goal to promote and create peace through action, we are launching our “Street Campaign for PeaceNow.”

DR. SUNIL SHARMA, PEACENOW AMBASSADOR

Dr. Sunil Sharma, our esteemed spokesperson for PeaceNow, was a keynote speaker at last year’s Rotary International Peace Conference in California, and is a Founding member of the Global Spiritual Leadership Council.  He was also an Invited speaker at the 1st World Parliament on Spirituality in India.  Sunil studied at the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology in Delhi, is the Founding President of the MeditationInstitute.org., and CEO of BrainiacJobs.com.

SEAN VANLOOZEN & LAURA RUDICH, FILMMAKERS

Sean and Laura are a filmmaking team based out of Venice, California. They have been working together for the past four years and recently completed their first feature documentary called Freedumb. Jules Muck, who was featured in the film along with five other local artists, became one of the many friends and inspirations they met throughout the process. They have continued to collaborate on projects with Jules and other artists in Los Angeles. In joining with PeaceNow, they hope to use their talents to bring inspiration to communities all across the world.

story:
...GOAL!

Con il sostegno di 74 amici il primo obbiettivo è stato raggiunto! 

Ora si può solo fare ancora meglio.. andare avanti! 

Ogni nuovo contributo che arriva sarà infatti un pezzetto di lavoro in più possibile, in un tempo più vicino. Vicino come l'estate.. ci vediamo sotto al fico!

GRAZIE A TUTTI.



(please scroll down for the english version)

CHI SONO

Mi chiamo Alice Guareschi, vivo a Milano, ho studiato filosofia e sono quello 
che viene definito oggi un 'artista visivo': lavoro con materiali e tecniche differenti, articolando la mia ricerca nel tempo tra opere video, testi, e la produzione di oggetti.  

Una selezione di quello che ho fatto finora è visibile qui: www.aliceguareschi.it

Amo le grandi città per la loro energia, perché mi permettono di muovermi
tra ambienti anche molto diversi tra loro, e perché offrono la possibilità di 
fare e vedere le cose che da sempre mi appassionano e nutrono il mio lavoro: cinema, teatro, mostre e concerti. 

E poi amo la Liguria. La costa di Levante e le Cinque Terre in particolare. 
E' un legame molto forte, istintivo, che ha radici profonde e ha a che fare
con i colori, le forme, gli odori, la luce di questo paesaggio insieme impervio
e bellissimo.


UN GIARDINO A TRAMONTI

Da anni cercavo un posto come questo: un pezzo di terra davanti alla linea dell'orizzonte dove poter tornare, che fosse lì ad aspettarmi nell'arco degli anni e delle stagioni, dove vivere a contatto con la natura, dove stare con gli amici, e che gli amici potessero sentire anche un pò loro perché risultato di uno sforzo e di un'immagine condivisa. 

Un posto aperto, da frequentare spesso, da curare insieme, in cui accogliere chi si appassiona al progetto, in cui fare accadere cose, in cui ritrovarsi. 

Un posto in cui ospitare un summer camp per artisti internazionali e organizzare un micro festival estivo di produzioni indipendenti aperto a tutti.

Finalmente l'estate scorsa l'ho trovato: è un piccolo giardino di 230 mq a picco sul mare a Fossola di Tramonti, dove comincia il Parco Nazionale delle Cinque Terre.

L'Acquisto della terra è stato solo l'inizio: ora si tratta di pensare, disegnare, costruire tutto!


COSA C'E' DA FARE

  1. Le cose più urgenti sono l'allaccio all'acqua potabile, una recinzione di rete solida che tenga lontano i cinghiali selvatici che scendono di notte dalla montagna (eh si! è parco naturale protetto..), una balaustra di legno sul davanti a cui appoggiarsi a guardare il mare senza volare di sotto, il ripristino dei muretti a secco e della base di pietra su cui posa il casotto, l'installazione di un piccolo impianto ad energia solare (nell'adorabile versione di kit per baite e case isolate!), l'acquisto di un wc portatile per gli ospiti più agées o per quando è proprio impossibile raggiungere il bosco, l'acquisto degli strumenti base per il mantenimento delle piante e del giardino (decespugliatore, rastrello a denti fitti, forcone, seghetto...
    e una bella camicia a scacchi, ovviamente!).

  2. Subito a seguire, nell'assoluto rispetto delle regole del Parco, la riconversione del casotto in lamiera in un piccolo cabanon (o una spaziosa cabina di barca a vela, se preferite): coibentazione interna con pannelli isolanti per mantenere stabile la temperatura, rivestimento e pavimentazione in legno naturale, rifacimento degli infissi delle due finestrelle e relative zanzariere, antiruggine e riverniciatura del tetto e delle pareti in metallo, realizzazione di un piccolo cucinotto da campo in esterno.

  3. E poi ancora... un tavolo con panche per grandi pranzi comunitari en plein air e cene sotto la stellata, doccia da giardino, sedie a sdraio, una grande piattaforma di legno per stendersi al sole, piante rampicanti da far crescere ai lati così il giardino è più raccolto, qualche albero per potersi sdraiare all'ombra e di cui mangiare i frutti quando è stagione, piante fiorite perché profumano e sono belle da guardare...

    N.B. Ogni cosa che arriva lassù, dal singolo chiodo alla trave di legno, va trasportata a piedi e in spalla per le tre rampe di gradini che separano il terreno dal parcheggio carraio... benvenuti in Liguria!


A COSA SERVE IL TUO CONTRIBUTO

Le quote contribuiranno per prima cosa a coprire le voci comprese nel punto 1, in modo da rendere il terreno utilizzabile a livello camping di base già da quest'estate (spesa stimata intorno ai 3000€). 

A seconda dell'obbiettivo raggiunto, e di quello che si rivelerà più urgente fare stando sul posto, il resto servirà ad avviare il lavori del punto 2, e realizzare alcune tra le voci del punto 3.

Un diario visivo in tempo reale documenterà passo per passo l'avanzamento dei lavori e le opere realizzate.


COME CONTRIBUIRE

Si può contribuire alla campagna in due modi diversi: 

  • scegliendo tra uno dei 'perks', che ti offrono benefits differenti: dalla cartolina alla foto in edizione limitata, dal libro d'artista al pic-nic, dal summer camp alla camminata lungo i sentieri costieri.. (vedi lista dei perks a fondo pagina)
  • con una donazione libera, cliccando su CONTRIBUTE NOW e inserendo nella casella l'importo preferito da € 1 a $$$..

Ogni contributo, anche piccolo, è determinante! 
Grazie a tutti!

ALTRI MODI IN CUI PUOI DARE UNA MANO

Se non puoi contribuire direttamente, ma il progetto ti piace e ti appassiona, puoi comunque sostenerlo in altri modi:

  • con idee e consigli (amici artisti e architetti, parlo soprattutto con voi!)
  • con lavoro di braccia, di cui ci sarà sempre molto bisogno!
  • aiutandomi a diffondere questa campagna tra le persone che ritieni potrebbero trovare interessante il progetto


--

ABOUT ME

My name is Alice Guareschi, I live in Milan, I studied philosophy and I’m what’s called a 'visual artist': I work with different materials and techniques, articulating my research over the years through video, texts, and the production of objects.  

Here’s a selection of what I’ve done so far: www.aliceguareschi.it

I love big cities for their energy, because they allow me to move between different worlds, and for the fact that I can do and see the things that move me and enhance my work: cinema, theater, shows, concerts.

And then there's my love for Liguria. The Levante coast and Cinque Terre in particular. It’s a peculiarly strong bond, instinctive, with deep roots that have to do with colors, shapes, smells, the light of that landscape which is both inaccessible and incredibly beautiful.

 A GARDEN AT TRAMONTI

It’s been years that I’ve been looking for a place like this: a piece of land in front of the horizon line to come back to, whether it’s there waiting for me with the passage of years and seasons, a place to live at one with nature, a place to be with friends, a place friends can feel is a little bit theirs as well because it’s the result of a collective effort and a shared image.

An open place, to visit frequently, to take care of together, somewhere to greet people passionate about this project, a place where you can make things happen, a hangout.

A garden to host an international artist summer camp and micro festival for independent production with days open to the public.

I finally found it last summer: it’s a little garden of about 230 mq (2500 sf) on a peak overlooking the sea, near Fossola di Tramonti, where the Cinque Terre National Park starts.

Buying the land was just the beginning: now it’s time to imagine, draw and build everything!

WHAT HAS TO BE DONE

1.  The most urgent tasks are: connecting the land to drinkable water, a solid gate for protection against wild boars that come down from the mountain at night (yes! this is a protected wildlife area…), a handrail one can lean on to take in the wonderful view without flying down towards the sea, re-construction of the dry stone wall and the rock base on which the cabin stands, installation of a small solar energy system (in the adorable version for mountain huts and isolated houses!), purchase of a porta potty for the older guests or for those times when it’s impossible to get to the woods, purchase of instruments to upkeep the plants in the garden (weed killer, fine comb rake, pitchfork, hacksaw…and obviously a checkered shirt!).

2.  Immediately afterwards, in full respect of the Park rules, the re-conversion of the metal sheet hut into a little cabanon (or a spacious cabin of a sail boat, if you prefer): internal insulation with insulating panels to maintain the temperature inside, floors in natural wood, re-construction of the two window frames and mosquito screens, anti-rust covering and a paint job for the roof and metal walls, construction of a small outside kitchen. 

3.  And then…a table and benches for the big lunches all together en plein air and dinners under the stars, outside shower, chaise longues, a large wooden platform for laying out in the sun, climbing plants to plant at the edges of the garden so it feels cosy, a few trees to create some shade as well as to have some fruit when the season comes, flowering plants because they’re beautiful and smell good…

P.S. Every single thing that arrives up there, from a tiny nail to wooden planks, has to be carried by foot on your shoulder for the three flights of stairs which separate the land from the parking area…welcome to Liguria!

 WHAT YOUR MONEY WILL GO TOWARDS

First of all, your contributions will cover the items listed under point number 1, in order to make the land usable for camping already this summer (estimated cost 3000€)

Depending on how much money is raised and what will reveal itself most urgent once there, the rest will serve to start the works mentioned in point number 2, and fulfill some of the items listed under point number 3.

A real-time visual diary will document step-by-step the various stages of the project and the works done.   

HOW TO SUPPORT

You can support the campaign in two different ways: 

  • choose in between one of the 'perks', and their different benefits: from a postcard to the limited edition prints, from the upcoming artist's book to the pic-nic in the garden, from the summer camp to the hike along the coastal trail..
  • click on the CONTRIBUTE NOW button and choose your custom amount from €1 to $$$...

Every contribution, however small, is crucial.  
Thank you everybody!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN GIVE ME A HAND 

If you can’t help directly, but you like the project and you feel passionate about it, you can help in other ways:

- with ideas and advice (artist friends, architect friends, I’m talking to you!)  
- with physical work, which will always be needed!  
- helping me spread the word about this campaign among people you think could be interested in the project.


--

PERKS: 


Cartolina in edizione limitata realizzata in collaborazione con Edition Taube / Limited Edition Postcard released by Edition Taube.

--

Libro d'Artista - Nuova produzione che sarà pubblicata da Edition Taube nel 2015  / Artist Book - New Release to be published by Edition Taube in 2015.

Un nuovo libro, che prende spunto in forma libera da questa esperienza, e fatto con materiali raccolti lungo il percorso / A new artist book, (loosely) based on this experience by the sea and made of the materials collected on the way.

www.editiontaube.de

--

Stampe in edizione limitata / Limited editions prints


UNTITLED (#1)
print on semigloss paper cm 50 x 40, framed
edition of 20 + 2 AP


--


UNTITLED (#2)
print on semigloss paper cm 50 x 40, framed
edition of 20 + 2 AP

--


SHE DOESN'T SAY THINGS ARE. SHE SAYS: THINGS SEEM TO ME
inkjet print on fine art paper cm 30 x 42, framed
edition of 3 + 1 AP (ed. 3/3 available)
