story:
irevuo Magazine will be a quarterly magazine dedicated to promoting unknown artists. We want to publish the first issue in January 2013.

The magazine will be available in both digital and printed editions. It will contain reviews, interviews, and a special showcase for visual artists (one artist will be chosen each issue, and promoted.) Also, we'll have articles and essays on art and related subjects.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically we need to cover expenses with:

Hardware. We need a good enough computer to make it all happen. This is a one time expense thing.

Typesetting and layout. We need to buy specialized software to do that.

The Impact

We believe in this dream of ours. We believe there are a lot of talented artists out there who deserve recognition and exposure. And we believe we can offer entertainment and information, we believe we can build a great platform.

But we can't do this without your help. Every donation counts, every dollar helps us build a website we can be proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any money? No problem. Let's make some noise, let's tweet and share this campaign, let more folks now about this new magazine and what it's trying to achieve.

story:
Format

35-45 minute documentary short. It will be told through interviews, b-roll footage, and historic photographs and footage.

Interview Subjects

Farmers:

The skilled workers are indubitably crucial to Maui Gold as they harvest millions of pineapples per year. It is their job to live up to the Gold standard of perfection.

We will also talk to farmers at the Maui Pineapple Company who formerly worked at the Maui Land & Pineapple Company to discuss the struggles of closing one farm and starting a new one.

Key Players:

Darren Strand, President of Maui Gold Pineapple Co.

Wes Nohara, Pineapple Expert

Todd Domeck, Owner of Maui Pineapple Tours

Mary Britton, Director of Maui Pineapple Tours

Others:

Theo Morrison, Historian at the Lahaina Restoration Foundation

 

Brief Outline

Act 1

Exploring life at Maui Gold and its Unique Community

- Introduce Maui Gold visually

- Introduce the farmers, and their morning routines to start working

-  Each farmer’s unique history farming and guess an estimate of how many pineapples they’ve created

- Culture surrounding Maui Gold

- How are Maui Gold Pineapples different from all other pineapples

- What makes Maui Gold a unique company

- What does the pineapple industry mean to locals

Short History of the Farm

- The rise and fall of pineapple canning

- How the Pineapple Research Institute founded the Maui Gold pineapple

- Pineapple power players: Dole and Del Monte

- Closure of farms and the impact on the community

- The founding of the Maui Gold Pineapple Company

 

Act 2

In the fields: Cultivating the perfect pineapple

- The steps of planting to picking

- How to know when it’s ripe

- What is it like working on the farm? Weather conditions, interactions, etc.

- How do you plant so many pineapples a day

- What have you learned overtime from working here

Act 3

Tourism and Beyond: Expanding the Legacy

- Take a closer look at the Maui Pineapple Tour and it’s immersive experience for tourists

- Looking towards the future of Maui Gold

- Why Maui Gold is important to Maui and American history

 

Production Logistics

A 5-7 day shoot

 

Equipment

We are shooting only with natural sunlight. No lighting equipment to better preserve the look and feel of Maui Gold.

We will be using non-intrusive equipment; DSLR cameras, wireless lav kit, shotgun microphones, and monopods.

 

Crew

3 filmmakers

Why we need your help:

While in Maui we are staying at a local hostel to cut down costs as much as possible. However, the cost of equipment rentals, festival submissions, transportation to and from the farm during our shoot will need funding.  We hope that you have felt inspired by Maui's history and help us tell the story!

 

Mahalo!

story:
✨ Hello! I'm Cafhune, an illustrator & designer based in the Philippines. ✨

 Instagram: @cafhune_art | Twitter: @cafhune | Online shop: cafhune.storenvy.com

This is my 1st Campaign though not my first time in creating pin. If you know me, I love creating works related to food! Especially sweets, and breakfast-like foods.

I created these babies out of love and would love to see all of them made, collected, and loved by others too. I'm hoping well through the support and kindness of this community we'll be able to unlock all the goals in this campaign.

- Unlike Kickstarter, Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform available to a much wider range! That includes my country: Philippines! 

- This is a Fixed funding campaign. Meaning, the rewards will only be earned if we'd reach the initial goal and the other stretch goals. If we don't reach the initial goal, all funds will be returned.​

- Interested in any of the locked designs? Don't hesitate in pledging! By pledging will not only help us reach and unlock all the goals, but it will also get you the lowest prices possible!

- Extra pins will be sold at USD$13+ in my shop instead of USD$10-$11 which you'll be paying here.

- Indiegogo immediately charges you and doesn't allow you to manually make any changes to your perk.  HOWEVER, if you contact me, I will gladly assist you and issue a refund so you can make your new choice / contribution to the campaign! 

- Surveys will be sent to all backers via e-mail when the campaign ends. Here you can choose which designs you'd like to order. You can even have 2 of the same design!

- Double-check your shipping information and email.

Not only will we be unlocking a pin design but every time we reach a goal, its sticker version will also be unlocked! Stickers will approximately 2" inches tall/wide. Depending on their size.

Pledging 2 pins and above will receive a sticker design of their choice.

  • July 13: ​Kickstarter Launches!
  • Aug 3: Kickstarter Ends!
    • Surveys are sent out
    • Contacting my manu to start production!
  • Early September: Enamel pins + more arrives!
    • Sorting & Packaging
  • September : Most orders go out
  • Early October: All orders out!

If everything is in order, packages should arrive September/October 2019!

Enamel pin manufacturing takes about a month or less to be produced and shipped.

All earnings from this project will be used to produce these pins.

  • 70% - pin production.
  • 20% - shipping and packaging.
  • 10% - indiegogo fees + other tax fees

- I will keep you updated on the campaign's progress. Keep in mind delay may happen from the manufacturer's side. There could also be delays from the post office once I shipped them out! 

- I have NO CONTROL over postal delays or production delays.

- Colors on the monitor maybe different from the product. These are only mock up colors. There should only be slight differences from the actual products.

- I have experience with making pins before and have trust over my manufacturers. Despite this being my first campaign for a collectable series, I have enough experience and resources to make things run smoothly. If there's any unforeseen problems, backers will be notified right away.

Thank you!!

-cafhune
story_txt:
✨ Hello! I'm Cafhune, an illustrator & designer based in the Philippines. ✨
 Instagram: @cafhune_art | Twitter: @cafhune | Online shop: cafhune.storenvy.com
This is my 1st Campaign though not my first time in creating pin. If you know me, I love creating works related to food! Especially sweets, and breakfast-like foods.
I created these babies out of love and would love to see all of them made, collected, and loved by others too. I'm hoping well through the support and kindness of this community we'll be able to unlock all the goals in this campaign.

- Unlike Kickstarter, Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform available to a much wider range! That includes my country: Philippines! 
- This is a Fixed funding campaign. Meaning, the rewards will only be earned if we'd reach the initial goal and the other stretch goals. If we don't reach the initial goal, all funds will be returned.​
- Interested in any of the locked designs? Don't hesitate in pledging! By pledging will not only help us reach and unlock all the goals, but it will also get you the lowest prices possible!
- Extra pins will be sold at USD$13+ in my shop instead of USD$10-$11 which you'll be paying here.
- Indiegogo immediately charges you and doesn't allow you to manually make any changes to your perk.  HOWEVER, if you contact me, I will gladly assist you and issue a refund so you can make your new choice / contribution to the campaign!

story:
The Concept:

What is C3?

Creative Catalyst Campaign (or C3, for short) is a project to aid youths in investigating their creative passions. This mission will be achieved by hosting fashion design mini-incubators along the MTP journey. Built around the idea that “we all have to start somewhere,” C3 is intended to address the very bud of interest. It is to function as the spark that sets a dream ablaze. 

The Construction:

What will each incubator entail?

Each incubator will be structured to have three parts: introduction/lecture, discussion, and activity. The setting will engage and push students to absorb key lessons: cohesion, collaboration, and process. These lessons are ones that apply to the design process, but also hold a meaning when addressing a greater life perspective. 
  • Cohesion = unification & integrity
  • Collaboration = relationships & community
  • Process =  It's not always about the destination, but also the journey.
The workshops will require attendees to assemble pieces with only a small idea of the end result - knowing the goal but not what it looks like. Working with an objective in mind, we will not know exactly what route our journey will take us. We will be piecing aesthetics together along the way with the intent of a gratifying outcome.

The Creation:

What will be the result of C3?

C3 is designed to invigorate youth designers. Participants may not otherwise have resources or support to investigate their interest in fashion as a career path. I believe that art and design are not career industries often respected and supported from infancy, if at all- it takes the presentation of a refined skillset to garner approval. I want C3 to be an opportunity for interested youths to try fashion on for size. I want to afford them the time to vocalize and act on a fascination.
Each city will produce one wearable art look. The design of the look will be determined by the theme/inspiration assigned to that city and the imagination of the respective youth participants. The group will complete a community sketch and the resulting art look will be constructed. The resulting art looks from each incubator will be exhibited to allow for further awareness of the project’s mission. Participants will also work on smaller individual projects as mementos to take home.
Not only do I hope to encourage a budding generation of artists, but I also hope to bring a societal awareness to the potential of such young people. The resulting footage and art will serve as a testament to the power of interest, passion, and support.

My Story:

Hi, my name is Syreeta!
As a young student, my career aspirations took vastly different forms before I was able to test my interest in fashion in a more direct way. It was that break that shifted my entire life and I’m forever grateful for its presentation.
Fast forward to a BFA and LLC... I still love the kids. I continue to work with them in auxiliary programming and enjoy giving back in different capacities, such as my prom initiative Perfect Promenade. More especially, being amongst children who are willfully present and excited about topics that I’m passionate while being able to share my knowledge with them is incredibly rewarding. It remains a purpose dear to me.back. :-)

My goal is not necessarily to morph an entire group of youths into promising fashion designers, but rather to listen and encourage.


My Destination:

Where am I going?
These funds will put me on a transcontinental train journey across America on a vintage rail car with stops in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Denver, Milwaukee, and Detroit. Millennial Trains Project leads "diverse groups of young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers, grow as leaders, and launch projects that benefit and inspire their communities." 
At each city, I will be directing C3 workshops with local youths. On-train discussions, leadership development, and more will fill the time in between. Coverage of all of these activities will be shared with you! After completing my MTP journey, I plan to use my experience as a building block to host C3 workshops in my own local community. I would love for it to become an ongoing project in the Washington, DC area.

The only way on to the MTP journey is through your kind and much appreciated donations! I must be one of the first to raise all of the funds to participate. Don't worry: say I don't make it, your donations will be returned. Still need incentive? All donations are tax-deductible and I have some awesome perks for you to check out! Every single donation will get a super big thank you and my sincerest love. I've always had a wickedly amazing support system and am forever humbled by you all!
Love,
Syreeta

story:
Short Summary

Moon Of Retribvtion is run by Caroline Diezyn, a queer artist and student. They travel around Southwestern Ontario vending at punk rock flea markets, pagan festivals, and queer events. They also sell online at moonofretribvtion.com. Their patches, pins, stickers, zines and more represent their interests values. Witchy, queer af, and anti-fascist, they've been at this since 2016. 

What We Need & What You Get

Usually Caroline puts their Moon Of Retribvtion art into production first and sells second. This time around they figured they'd try Indiegogo as a way to help pay for everything up front. As a grad student, funding Moon Of Retribvtion is a labour of love in and of itself. 

By contributing to the campaign, you get dibs on whichever pins you wanted, as well as extras from the Moon Of Retribvtion catalogue and extras that are exclusive to the campaign. 

The pins are approximately 1" in height (24 mm) and are soft black enamel with nickel-plated iron bases. The grey parts in the images provided will be nickel-plated silver colour. The pins come with rubber pinbacks, as well as information sheets. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share with your friends who are into witchy stuff, astrology, astronomy... whatever! Check out the stretch goals and share with anyone who you think would be into those, too :) Thanks!

Which pin should I choose?

The available pins are: Sun, Mercury, Venus, Earth, Moon, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Venus, Pluto, Pallas, Juno, Vesta, and Chiron. You could choose celestial bodies that have a particular significance to you. Maybe your astrological sign is associated with a planet, and you want to carry it with you. Maybe you want to invoke a deity associated with a planet. Maybe you want to use it as a talisman for the magical intentions the symbol carries. Maybe you just really dig astronomy. There's tonnes of reasons to choose whichever pin you choose, and each one comes with a card describing its astrological and astronomical significance. Below is a version of the card description you'll receive for each symbol. 

 

Risks and Challenges

The designs are already with the manufacturer and are ready to go to production as soon as funds are secured. There could be a delay in shipping, but Caroline has worked with this company many times before and has never had any issue.

story:
My name is Alana Richards and I am an Irish born Berlin based artist. I moved to Berlin in 2008 and have participated in many exhibitions here in my chosen city but also throughout Europe in the last ten years. I am currently working on my latest project; an exhibition inspired by the characters from Le Pustra's Kabarett der Namenlosen which is a 1920's Berlin inspired theatre piece.

I have always had a fascination with Weimar Berlin; this incredibly short lived period between the two world wars. A city full of contrasts; rich and poor, glamour and violence. I love to imagine the characters ; the decadence, the underground culture, the illusion of freedom in the city, the lack of laws and boundaries. The often romanticised Berlin was a very popular place to be in the 1920s as it very much is today.

Kabarett der Namenlosen portrays what I imagine from the decadent 1920's Berlin perfectly. I saw the show for the first time last year and was immediately inspired by the extraordinary cast of the beautiful and the dammed. I got in contact with the director Le Pustra and suggested putting on an exhibition inspired by his show, he was very interested by the idea and here we are today! 

I would like to invite you to be part of this experience with me, by supporting this exhibition - to come with me - to unravel the layers of Berlin’s underworld today. Become part of this strange reality that inspires the fiction. Experience the show and hang a part of in your home, experience the craft and come to my atelier or take a tour through Berlin’s underworld with a professional Berlin tour guide and myself leading the way.

I want to turn this into more of an experience than a typical painting exhibition, I want to break the boundaries between the gallery and the stage . The gallery we chose is the perfect setting for this exhibition. It is located in the heart of Schöneberg on Nollendorfstraße, a stone's throw away from where Christopher Isherwood once lived and also near the famous Cabaret, Eldorado.

With your help I can pay the location fee and cover the production costs of the gallery transformation. It is not a huge amount I am asking for but it is one that will truly make a massive difference to me. You can help by donating and/or sharing our campaign link online with your family and friends or any lovers of art or sleaze you know who might be interested in such an experience ;)

I hugely appreciate any help given to make this dream a reality. Thank you so so much!

Looking forward to seeing you at the opening night! 

Love

Alana Richards

WHAT WILL THE MONEY BE USED FOR?

  • Gallery rent
  • Installation materials and other production costs
  • Performance on the opening night
  • Transportation

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

As I have over ten years experience in running successful exhibitions with gallery support and without, I really don't see any risk in supporting this exhibition. The gallery has been booked for:

Dates: 23 February 2018 - 6 March 2018
Location: The Ballery, Nollendorfstraße 11, 10777, Berlin

www.theballery.com

Exhibition text :

Morphium: Hallucinations of a Kabarett is your intimate invitation to discover the provocative and colorful characters featured in Berlin’s only Weimar Republic inspired theatre play. Le Pustra’s Kabarett der Namenlosen has been interpreted through the imagination of Berlin based artist, Alana Richards. This deconstructed Cabaret and its habitués will be exposed in a gallery environment, presenting a unique collaboration binding together portraiture, film and installation whilst intertwining theatre production and figurative painting.

The exhibition takes its title from a composition by Mischa Spoliansky - originally written for the scandalous dancer Anita Berber - named in homage to Morpheus, Greek god of sleep and etymological root of the opiate that had so infected Weimar Berlin. This song features prominently in Kabarett der Namenlosen, creating an ominous atmosphere steeped in mystery and melancholy.

This exhibition is a continuation and extension of the Theatre play which looks more closely at the fictional archetypal characters - “The hallucinatory Nameless” - found in the deliciously tawdry Cabarets, riotous Revues and decadent Gender Bending Dance Halls of the wildly creative and sexually liberating Weimar Republic years in Berlin. This epoch has been very well documented and explored but still has the power to fascinate artists, historians and bohemians alike. In today’s unstable climate one can perhaps find echoes of the 1920’s; we may ﬁnd ourselves once again standing at the precipice.

Schöneberg was once home to many icons of the period - Christopher Isherwood, Marlene Dietrich and Claire Waldoff among them - and its thriving gay nightlife and performance heritage makes it the ideal backdrop for Morphium: Hallucinations of a Kabarett. Enter a smoky underworld of scandal, intrigue and self indulgence, captured by Richards on canvas. Using slow drying oil paint and a traditional technique she has produced a series of individual portraits that capture the very essence of these shadowy characters.

About me: 

After leaving Ireland at an early age, Alana Richards wandered, studied and lived impulsively, as she moved through Paris and then into the depths of Berlin in 2008.

Drawing from an eclectic range of influences and its rich experiences, her work today is focused on portraiture, and an interest that lies in capturing the soul of her subject as well as revealing subtle insights into herself at that junction of time.

Her initial photo sessions for each new work are a vital part of the process, as a close interaction with the subject sparks initial ideas, which are drawn and then painted with oil. Her technique is borrowed from artists such as Degas and Manet, and although the paintings are classically composed, the result has a freshness that is decidedly contemporary. Layers are often built up and torn apart, only to be rebuilt again, often giving the subject a complex and hidden history within the frame.

Visit: www.alanarichards.co.uk

story:
What is happening?

Four different artist-run gallery spaces in Baltimore, MD; bb, Open Space, Platform Gallery, and Terrault Contemporary are all very honored and excited to announce that we have all be accepted into, and will be exhibiting at SATELLITE Miami Beach through Tiger Strikes Asteroid collective from December 1-6, 2015. Meaning, we all submitted separate proposals for installations by various artists, and our proposals were accepted along with 40 other galleries across the U.S.A. to exhibit in SATELLITE and TSA Miami.

We are truly thrilled for this opportunity to be able to showcase Baltimore artists and represent and advocate on behalf of the Baltimore arts community in Miami, but WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET US THERE!

In the spirit of a collaborative arts community, instead of competing for funding we have all decided to fundraise together and divide the funding. We hope you support our cause!

What is TSA Miami?

Tiger Strikes Asteroid announced its partnership with The Satellite Show Miami Beach, produced by Art Market Productions for art fair week in Miami this December. The project, Artist-Run, focuses on the artist-run space, a thriving alternate model of support, exchange, and community to the established commercial market. From collectives with permanent spaces to one-person pop-up curatorial nomads, Tiger Strikes Asteroid will bring together an international representation of nearly 40 of these initiatives from across the United States in a repurposed hotel. Each room will feature a different installation/environment by one of these groups.

What we need:

TSA exhibition fee x 4: $1200

Estimated Travel Costs** (at 2 people per gallery, although more might attend):
$10,000

**Not all gallery workers attending will be using any one form of transportation or lodging, we all have different plans but this will help but in a dent in the costs it will cost many of us to get to Miami and stay there from November 28th through December 7th. We do not expect to make enough to cover everyones' travels, but anything helps!

Install materials and lighting: $800
Insurance: $240

About SATELLITE:
SATELLITE, a new project series brought to you by Brian Whiteley (founder of the Select Art Fair) and Art Market Productions, will debut this December 1 6 in Miami Beach. SATELLITE will populate several unoccupied beachfront properties, with each distinct venue stewarded by notable art organizations and curators. The goal of SATELLITE is to initiate new conversations and to foster experiential and exploratory interactions with art. 

About Tiger Strikes Asteroid:
Tiger Strikes Asteroid is a network of artist-run spaces with locations in Philadelphia, New York, and Los Angeles. Each space is independently operated and focuses on presenting a varied program of emerging and mid-career artists. Our goal is to collectively bring people together, expand connections and build community through artist-initiated exhibitions and curatorial opportunities.

What is happening?
Four different artist-run gallery spaces in Baltimore, MD; bb, Open Space, Platform Gallery, and Terrault Contemporary are all very honored and excited to announce that we have all be accepted into, and will be exhibiting at SATELLITE Miami Beach through Tiger Strikes Asteroid collective from December 1-6, 2015. Meaning, we all submitted separate proposals for installations by various artists, and our proposals were accepted along with 40 other galleries across the U.S.A. to exhibit in SATELLITE and TSA Miami.
We are truly thrilled for this opportunity to be able to showcase Baltimore artists and represent and advocate on behalf of the Baltimore arts community in Miami, but WE NEED YOUR HELP TO GET US THERE!
In the spirit of a collaborative arts community, instead of competing for funding we have all decided to fundraise together and divide the funding. We hope you support our cause!
What is TSA Miami?
Tiger Strikes Asteroid announced its partnership with The Satellite Show Miami Beach, produced by Art Market Productions for art fair week in Miami this December. The project, Artist-Run, focuses on the artist-run space, a thriving alternate model of support, exchange, and community to the established commercial market. From collectives with permanent spaces to one-person pop-up curatorial nomads, Tiger Strikes Asteroid will bring together an international representation of nearly 40 of these initiatives from across the United States in a repurposed hotel. Each room will feature a different installation/environment by one of these groups.
What we need:
TSA exhibition fee x 4: $1200
Estimated Travel Costs** (at 2 people per gallery, although more might attend):$10,000
**Not all gallery workers attending will be using any one form of transportation or lodging, we all have different plans but this will help but in a dent in the costs it will cost many of us to get to Miami and stay there from November 28th through December 7th. We do not expect to make enough to cover everyones' travels, but anything helps!
Install materials and lighting: $800Insurance: $240

About SATELLITE:SATELLITE, a new project series brought to you by Brian Whiteley (founder of the Select Art Fair) and Art Market Productions, will debut this December 1 6 in Miami Beach. SATELLITE will populate several unoccupied beachfront properties, with each distinct venue stewarded by notable art organizations and curators. The goal of SATELLITE is to initiate new conversations and to foster experiential and exploratory interactions with art. About Tiger Strikes Asteroid:Tiger Strikes Asteroid is a network of artist-run spaces with locations in Philadelphia, New York, and Los Angeles. Each space is independently operated and focuses on presenting a varied program of emerging and mid-career artists. Our goal is to collectively bring people together, expand connections and build community through artist-initiated exhibitions and curatorial opportunities.

story:
ABOUT ME

My name is Katarzyna and i’m a student of Polish National Film, Television and Theatre school. I deal with art that borders on different medias, such as film, painting, and photography.

ABOUT VIDEO

I started working on this project at the beginning of October 2012. It is the further continuation of experimentation that started with my first video art project “WIND/BREATH”. The initial goal of this project is to connect fine art photography with video art. The shots will be composed statically and compositionally photographic. The final result will bring to mind, motion photography. An original song will also accompany the video.

In this video I want to reveal emotions that we most commonly hide in ourselves so others around us won't see. The theme I'm sure is close to you all as it is to me. Hidden and emberassing emotions that rarely become released can have destructive power over us. Only when we throw them out in the open, do we allow ourselves to heal and reach serenity. This video does not have a typical screenplay, everything will revolve around image and emotion. A storyboard will be attached in the gallery section.

ACTION

What interests me the most in this project is uncovering and showing the audience the deepest emotions hidden inside a man. The image will introduce a man with a stone cold-face standing near a table, hiding any sort of emotion. His only escape are his hands, which shows the audience the tension and pain concealed behind a thick layer of skin. On the table near the man, appear different objects that the actor interacts with. The climax of the video is the actor painting a picture (inspired by the abstract expressionistic images created by Jackson Pollock) releasing all his emotions on the canvas. This form of painting and creating is catharsis for him and is the only way he can calm himself.

The project is a pastiche to the work and creations of Jackson Pollock, Dan Flavin and also Laura Letinsky. I will also consult with one of Poland's greatest video artists, Józef Robakowski.

The esthetic layer is immensely important to this project. The intended image must be sharp, clear, sterile and clean. Added to the white background will be the element of bright pastel fluorescent lights. That's why the project will be filmed with the professional Red Epic camera inside a film studio.

BUDGET AND EXPENSES

The whole production will cost around 900$, but i’ll invest 200$ from my pocket. So to fill the budget I need 700$ more.

budget:

- Renting the Red Epic Camera

- Props and Scenography

- Pay for cast and crew

CREW

Crew consists of people from Poland and Canada. We are mainly students of Polish Film School, from diffrent specializations: Photography, Cinematography, Production. The set designer is a graduate from the Academy of Fine Arts in Łódż

My previous video art you can watch here: https://vimeo.com/44402958 It was made in Poland and France.

SHARE

Sharing this with your friends is greatly appreciated.

Thanks!!!

http://igg.me/at/untouch

story:
Short Summary

I'm Dawn DeWitt, face and body painter. I'm going to be volunteering in Haiti for six weeks this winter at Jakmel Ekspresyon, and my intention is to fill my luggage with as many art supplies as I can carry! I will be working specifically with the orphanage connected with this organization and the children in local schools as well as a local dance troupe. None of the money raised will be used to fund the trip itself, that's on me and it's taken care of.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm simply looking for a little help in making sure that I can interact with as many local children as I can in a meaningful manner, and my way is through teaching basic art principles and being able to leave some supplies with them when I leave.

  • My goal is to raise $500 to purchase basic art supplies. Nothing fancy, nothing special. I will be taking things like pencils, paper, glue, scissors, acrylic paint and brushes. I'll also be taking as many small face painting kits as I can fit.
  • In return for your contribution you will receive a work of art done either by myself or one of my Jakmel students.
  • If my goal is not reached, oh well, those who did contribute will receive their perks and I will have gotten a little help with the expenses.
  • Any contributions over my goal will be donated to Jakmel to be used toward their rent in order to continue their many other arts directed programs.

The Impact

  • I realize I am very fortunate to have been given this opportunity and I just want to share it with as many people as I possibly can.
  • You never know when the simple things you do in your life can affect another human being. I know this trip will change my life and I hope it will change some other lives as well. Maybe it can change yours too, who knows?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's ok but I sure would appreciate it if you could spread the word for me. 

  • Share my campaign of Facebook!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Talk to your friends!
  • Check out Jakmel Ekspresyon's Facebook page and like it. Maybe there's something else you can do to help out.

story:
Why should you support this work?

Is there anything setting my work apart from the, literally, millions of people wielding a brush? I have to answer this, don’t I? If I can’t answer for myself how can I address you, my prospective investor?

I wonder if this is the right track? I mean, investors aren't exactly flocking around this endeavor. hmmmm. Oh well, onward and upward! (10/22/14)

Oh, well- back to the drawing board- Thanks so much to those that saw fit to contribute!

I have never been motivated to put my work into the human river- although I have dipped my toe in a couple of times. Painting is something I’ve always just taken for granted. I had private lessons from the age of nine- after nagging my parents for two years- and was a kind of an apprentice to a mad Russian, Wassily Somer, for 14 years- from age 13. Money, career, and all that were not part of Wassily’s make-up. Wassily initiated me into an unbroken lineage - through his own teacher Oskar Kokoshka- emerging from prehistory in cave paintings and stone idols. Painting, from this perspective is a Spiritual endeavor. 

I don’t do it for money. I do it for Love. 

 My life has been defined by ‘spiritual’ pursuits. As I enter my seventh decade, the responsibility to serve this Planet is before me. Perhaps such service is the role of Humanity?  Painting is the quintessential context for me to offer what small contribution I can. In fact, it’s all I have to give. I find therein harmonious active engagement of all three aspects of the Whole - focused in a ‘being gesture’ that presents an object rooted in the depths of the instant. This object is a painting. 

Each and every one of us is a miracle walking around in a miracle- beautiful beyond description. My work, inadequate though it must inevitably be, dives into that miracle, holds it in paint and color, and is set adrift into the Human river to work as it will. 

I feel strongly that this is work that needs to be done- that I must do as a matter of Conscience. I feel that it is of Real Value- both now and, perhaps more important, for the future- if we Human Beings have a future. I, for one, believe that we do. 

                    (Leda- study for the triptych 'Solve et Coagula' project website)


See some of the perks here- examples
See Daybreak ($1000 perk) here- unique
See Exultation ($4000 perk) here- unique
See Science in the Void here- Science in the Void
All of the perks available are worth more than the amount requested- yours is an investment, not a gift.

'Frozen Sun (breath of the Love Monster)' This is a digital approximation of what I call a 'procedural painting' that depends on the unpredictable interaction of incompatible materials for the final effect.


                         What do I intend to do?

Hallway of Mirrors, Anatomy of the Instant

This project consists of ten major paintings arranged in a circular installation. Each painting will be facing into the circle, mutually emphasizing each other.  Yet they are discreet in themselves. ( project website ) Three paintings will serve as anchors  tying the installation into a whole. These paintings are interrelated from three perspectives- it is, it is what it is, and it is how it is. The instant is dissected into three fundamental aspects- time, the timelessness of pure potency, and the 'unsayable impetus' or ‘will’ that states identity- in and as a single instance. Follow your eyes- what lights your attention lights the instant. This is the functioning of the installation as a whole- to light the instant.

Over the years I have experimented with a variety of techniques. Some of these are very intriguing. ( a selection ) The seemingly unrelated will be seen in context as of the same source, the same hand, the same heart. Every single painting, every brush stroke, is dedicated to, and is in, Love. 

Here is the lineage rooted in the dim mists of prehistory, the wonder that is the Human Reality. The Reality tasted in... lamplight flickering on the walls of a cave in France, the scent of the air in the Suleimaniyya Mosque, the echo of a medicine song chanted from a sacred peak, the profound silence in a Gothic cathedral- completely present with the immediacy of this instant, this now. Diving into this continuum in paint and color, references to Alchemy, Zen , Sufism , Taoism , and George Gurdjieff's challenge to ‘wake up’ and see come to bear. The project is unbound by any of this. Every instant is miraculous and whatever ‘stew’ savors of this miracle is of it. After all is said and done, there simply is. 

This project is the contemplation of the instant in one instance. It will inevitably be colored by that instance- but, given that the instant is  miraculous, one miraculous instance cannot but resonate with every instance- for every instance is of the instant. The present moment is without hierarchy or division. 

 I thank you for considering  this effort. I ask, most humbly, for your financial investment toward the actualization of it. We will truly be co-creators as we step into the Synergistic Epoch, wherein beckons the promise of a future for Humanity- one that is dynamic and evolutionary- that is, in short, responsible. 

                                                              ( project website )


                                                        PROJECT MAP


                     What I'm asking for and why

Rat Factory, Square One: ‘Hallway of Mirrors (The Anatomy of the Instant)’

                                                  ‘...better late than never...’ 

                  (Kingfisher- study for triptych 'Solve et Coagula' project website)


I will produce a series of ten paintings as detailed above. I will also set up an introductory display through which to enter the Project Space consisting of select paintings and drawings already on hand totaling forty additional works. This Project will be staged for three months, amidst ongoing promotional efforts via several appropriate avenues. All work will be available for sale. The Project, with your help, will also serve as a basis from which to seek commission work and to pursue sustained patronage- settting the stage for the next Project. In other words establishing the foundation for an ongoing business. Thus, ‘Rat Factory’ encompassing production and sales/marketing, management etc. under a single fluid model free from physical location, enabling efforts on a Global scale. 
                                                              
                                                              First steps first. 

The funds I have available will allow me to work for four months. I’ve already invested four months of work. ( project website ) My best estimate is that I need four additional months- plus the four I already have covered- to finish these ten paintings by June. That leaves four months to finance. I have concluded that it will take at minimum $9250 to bring everything to completion and ready to stage. Add to that the percentage due for the campaign itself and the cost of time and materials- shipping etc- to fulfill the perks that figure can be rounded to $11,000 Once  financing is in place to ensure the time and materials to produce these paintings the energy currently being directed to fundraising can be redirected to securing a display venue. A marketing plan will commence as the work progresses. Several potential venues are lurking in the background but it wouldn’t make sense to pursue them until I know when I can deliver. 

In addition to offering fifty pieces of Artwork for sale, people will be able to make contributions. Many people recognize the value in Art and wish to support the Arts but feel themselves excluded from doing so.  Crowdfunding allows people to play a real, direct role in the creation of something with the potential to open new possibilities into the World.  

One of the chief aims of the Project ‘Hallway of Mirrors’ is to establish momentum for what I am calling ‘The Rat Factory’ as an ongoing, self-sustainable business. This format, involving discreet yet interrelated projects staged for periods of three months each, can be duplicated anywhere, as well as opening opportunities as yet unknown. The vision motivating this modest beginning is Global in scope.  

As I see it we are all eddies in a single river- the Human river, which in it's turn is an eddy in the Sea of Life unfettered. So I ask for your investment- moral and financial- in a synergistic effort to remember the miracle that is that river, flowing through each and every one of us. 

Please, see the perks available and give your financial support to this effort. It's an investment in the future.                                             

                                                                     Thank you

                                          ( Oroborus, arylic on panels 40 days )

                                                          

                                                  Bare bones breakdown:

$5400                                               -Live/work space-   4 months =

 $500                                                              -Misc. bills-   4 months = 

$1600                                                           -Food-  $400  4 months =  

  $400                                   -Misc. personal expenses-  4 months =          

 ______________

$7900 

$1350.                                                            Materials and supplies =  

_______________                             

$9250                                                                no wiggle room at all = 

$1750                                              Campaign related expenses =

________________

$11,000                                                      


                                                            ( project website )

                                       Hazard

                                           Ah yes, the 'material question.

I think of an investment in Artwork as just that- an investment. It is an investment with a slight twist that differentiates a painting from a stock portfolio. That twist is what makes Artwork only secondarily a financial transaction bearing merely the promise of monetary gain. The real investment is in the future of Humanity. 

Art, as I see it, is an action. a Creative gesture, that has the potential to allow new possibilities to enter the World. These are possibilities inherent to the Human Reality and serve nothing less than the evolution of Consciousness on this Planet. A painting is a 'window into Eternity' and it is in this 'Eternal now' that all possibilities ache under the impetus of pure potential. We humans have the choice to follow the intimations of Beauty, a Beauty which, in it's Sheerness, permeates all 'times', all degrees of awareness. It is in the heart of Eternity that Sheer Beauty subsists- unchanging and immutable. It is this Beauty that is directly present in all instances of 'the beautiful' and is fluent throughout Being per-se.

To me Painting is not only a source for my deepest sense of 'rightness' it is also a 'being obligation' and as such a conscious service in Being, to Being, by being- thus, there simply is. We people are in no way separate from Being and are, in fact is-ness, full stop. It is by the manner in which our lives are lived that Being Creates and Maintains Being in an infinite 'dance' of extension and gathering, a 'process' of 'eating and being eaten.' How and why? This is is a matter for wonder in the presence of irreducible Mystery. It is this capacity for wonder that gives rise to a painting and it is to this capacity for wonder that a painting speaks directly- being to being in Being. 

The depth of the capacity to wonder is directly proportional to our capacity to receive and our capacity to receive is a 'function' of consciousness. By standing in contemplation before a painting, wonder at the Absolute Mystery can come clearer and this deepening wonder is 'food' for Being, as It is, in and as 'you'. It enhances awareness, stimulates consciousness, and opens the door to the Creative Reality wherein the Very Being of Beauty is eternally Self Created. That Being is Love. There are wonders without end.

            The drawing to be offered as a print at the $25 contribution level

                                            image size 8 inches by 10 inches

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I realize that not everyone that reads this will feel able to give money- as much as they may want to. (Let's leave aside those that see me as a pretentious blowhard! I've been called worse over the years.) There are links just under the video pane  making it convenient and easy to share this project. Anyone can help by disseminating this Campaign via social media and e-mail with just a click of the mouse. That in itself is a gift. The more people that see this the better the odds that it will be successful.

    Thank you for wading through this presentation. If you are able, and according to your own Conscience, please make a financial investment toward this work.

    It'll be pretty cool...

We will truly be co-creators as we step into the Synergistic Epoch, wherein beckons the promise of a future for Humanity- one that is dynamic and evolutionary- that is, in short, responsible. 
                                                              ( project website )

                                                        PROJECT MAP



                     What I'm asking for and why


Rat Factory, Square One: ‘Hallway of Mirrors (The Anatomy of the Instant)’
                                                  ‘...better late than never...’ 


                  (Kingfisher- study for triptych 'Solve et Coagula' project website)
I will produce a series of ten paintings as detailed above. I will also set up an introductory display through which to enter the Project Space consisting of select paintings and drawings already on hand totaling forty additional works. This Project will be staged for three months, amidst ongoing promotional efforts via several appropriate avenues. All work will be available for sale. The Project, with your help, will also serve as a basis from which to seek commission work and to pursue sustained patronage- settting the stage for the next Project. In other words establishing the foundation for an ongoing business. Thus, ‘Rat Factory’ encompassing production and sales/marketing, management etc. under a single fluid model free from physical location, enabling efforts on a Global scale. 


                                                              


                                                              First steps first. 



The funds I have available will allow me to work for four months. I’ve already invested four months of work. ( project website ) My best estimate is that I need four additional months- plus the four I already have covered- to finish these ten paintings by June. That leaves four months to finance. I have concluded that it will take at minimum $9250 to bring everything to completion and ready to stage. Add to that the percentage due for the campaign itself and the cost of time and materials- shipping etc- to fulfill the perks that figure can be rounded to $11,000 Once  financing is in place to ensure the time and materials to produce these paintings the energy currently being directed to fundraising can be redirected to securing a display venue. A marketing plan will commence as the work progresses. Several potential venues are lurking in the background but it wouldn’t make sense to pursue them until I know when I can deliver. 
In addition to offering fifty pieces of Artwork for sale, people will be able to make contributions. Many people recognize the value in Art and wish to support the Arts but feel themselves excluded from doing so.  Crowdfunding allows people to play a real, direct role in the creation of something with the potential to open new possibilities into the World.  
One of the chief aims of the Project ‘Hallway of Mirrors’ is to establish momentum for what I am calling ‘The Rat Factory’ as an ongoing, self-sustainable business. This format, involving discreet yet interrelated projects staged for periods of three months each, can be duplicated anywhere, as well as opening opportunities as yet unknown. The vision motivating this modest beginning is Global in scope.  
As I see it we are all eddies in a single river- the Human river, which in it's turn is an eddy in the Sea of Life unfettered. So I ask for your investment- moral and financial- in a synergistic effort to remember the miracle that is that river, flowing through each and every one of us. 
Please, see the perks available and give your financial support to this effort. It's an investment in the future.                                             
                                                                     Thank you

                                          ( Oroborus, arylic on panels 40 days )
                                                          
                                                  Bare bones breakdown:
$5400                                               -Live/work space-   4 months =
 $500                                                              -Misc. bills-   4 months = 
$1600                                                           -Food-  $400  4 months =  
  $400                                   -Misc. personal expenses-  4 months =          
 ______________
$7900 
$1350.                                                            Materials and supplies =  
_______________                             
$9250                                                                no wiggle room at all = 
$1750                                              Campaign related expenses =
________________
$11,000                                                      


                                                            ( project website )
                                       Hazard
                                           Ah yes, the 'material question.

I think of an investment in Artwork as just that- an investment. It is an investment with a slight twist that differentiates a painting from a stock portfolio. That twist is what makes Artwork only secondarily a financial transaction bearing merely the promise of monetary gain. The real investment is in the future of Humanity. 
Art, as I see it, is an action. a Creative gesture, that has the potential to allow new possibilities to enter the World. These are possibilities inherent to the Human Reality and serve nothing less than the evolution of Consciousness on this Planet. A painting is a 'window into Eternity' and it is in this 'Eternal now' that all possibilities ache under the impetus of pure potential. We humans have the choice to follow the intimations of Beauty, a Beauty which, in it's Sheerness, permeates all 'times', all degrees of awareness. It is in the heart of Eternity that Sheer Beauty subsists- unchanging and immutable. It is this Beauty that is directly present in all instances of 'the beautiful' and is fluent throughout Being per-se.
To me Painting is not only a source for my deepest sense of 'rightness' it is also a 'being obligation' and as such a conscious service in Being, to Being, by being- thus, there simply is. We people are in no way separate from Being and are, in fact is-ness, full stop. It is by the manner in which our lives are lived that Being Creates and Maintains Being in an infinite 'dance' of extension and gathering, a 'process' of 'eating and being eaten.' How and why? This is is a matter for wonder in the presence of irreducible Mystery. It is this capacity for wonder that gives rise to a painting and it is to this capacity for wonder that a painting speaks directly- being to being in Being. 
The depth of the capacity to wonder is directly proportional to our capacity to receive and our capacity to receive is a 'function' of consciousness. By standing in contemplation before a painting, wonder at the Absolute Mystery can come clearer and this deepening wonder is 'food' for Being, as It is, in and as 'you'. It enhances awareness, stimulates consciousness, and opens the door to the Creative Reality wherein the Very Being of Beauty is eternally Self Created. That Being is Love. There are wonders without end.


            The drawing to be offered as a print at the $25 contribution level
                                            image size 8 inches by 10 inches

  Other Ways You Can Help I realize that not everyone that reads this will feel able to give money- as much as they may want to. (Let's leave aside those that see me as a pretentious blowhard! I've been called worse over the years.) There are links just under the video pane  making it convenient and easy to share this project. Anyone can help by disseminating this Campaign via social media and e-mail with just a click of the mouse. That in itself is a gift. The more people that see this the better the odds that it will be successful.
Thank you for wading through this presentation. If you are able, and according to your own Conscience, please make a financial investment toward this work.
It'll be pretty cool...

story:
What am I doing?

As a visual artist for more than three decades, I am committed to using my artwork to improve the community in which I live. As a father I am keenly aware of the power that visual imagery can have on young children. When I discovered that the Center for Early Intervention on Deafness (CEID) is celebrating its 35th anniversary, I knew that I had found the perfect way to use my talents to make a difference for young children in my city. I want to create an inspirational mural that captures the imagination of both children and adults who enter CEID's doors. For me, murals are more than decoration, they provide beauty, community, connection, expression, and a sense of adventure.

For 35 years, CEID has provided life-changing services for Bay Area babies and young children who are deaf, hard of hearing, or have other communication disorders.  Many of the children also have other special needs.

CEID children and their parents face an array of daily challenges that would stop most of us in our tracks--but the challenges don't stop them.  The nurturing environment that CEID provides and the partnership of skilled, caring staff with proud and loving parents makes the children's future bright.  Parents and staff are committed to the belief that "The sky's the limit!" 

At CEID, caring and highly trained staff partner with parents to provide children with encouragement and new skills, setting high expectations in fun and creative ways.  All CEID classrooms are specifically tailored to provide an optimal listening and learning environment, including acoustically modified rooms with radiant floor heating, and soft walls and floors that absorb and reduce ambient noise.  


With your help, I will produce a mural for the Center that will be my small contribution to the CEID environment. The theme of the mural, which will cover walls and ceiling, is The Sky's the Limit!


What I Need

The mural will encompass a total of seven wall panels and the ceiling of the CEID entryway (a total of 854.5 square feet). I am attempting to raise $18,000 to complete the mural and ensure that it has a long life at CEID. Toward this end I will be:

  • Conducting initial meetings and creative brainstorming sessions with CEID staff
  • Creating, sharing and revising sketches and floor plans for the final mural
  • Developing the concept that includes the creation of a final detail drawing as well as choice of color palettes
  • Preparing walls and ceiling (cleaning, patching, smoothing, priming)
  • Transferring the drawing from paper to the walls
  • Adding color to the walls and begin to bring the mural to life (this is the very fun part)
  • Applying a protective coat to all surfaces and providing training and direction to CEID staff to insure a long mural life

What You Get

I want every one of you to be a part of the project, and frankly I can't do it without you. Toward that end, I will periodically update this site with videos, images and sketches of the project. I want you all to be a part of this process and to be as invested in it as I am. All donors will receive thank you gifts that are vital pieces of the mural.

The Impact

By being a part of this project, not only will you be funding the completion of this CEID mural, but also contributing to promoting CEID and its services to parents and families throughout the Bay Area. Your funding and your sharing of this work will extend CEID's reach and perhaps introduce their services to those in need.

Give however You Can

I understand that not everybody can contribute financially. That's okay! There are many other things you can do.

  • Tell your friends and family on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.
  • Tell people in person too!
  • There are other ways to help too, just ask me.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The newly established art history organization WHAT (Writing, History, Art & Theory) at the University of South Florida is hoping to raise enough money in order to publish MFA catalogues for the graduating class of 2015!  Our goal is to raise $5000 so we can print 500 copies of a high quality 50-page catalogue.

The publication of this catalogue would give us the opportunity to team up with MFAO (Masters of Fine Arts Organization), our sister organization, and to gain experience interacting with and writing about contemporary art and artists.  The publication of an MFA catalogue is an academic and fine arts initiative that supports the exemplary work of graduate students at USF. Furthermore, this is a group project where everyone will have a job in designing, writing, or editing the catalogue.  A publication of this scope will build the confidence and pride of the work produced by USF’s students. Not only will the funds allocated to this publication provide a clear and resounding voice for its graduate students – a crucial opportunity at a university dominated by its undergraduate students – but will serve as a tangible reminder that USF is an advocate for the fine arts community within its own student body, the larger area of Tampa Bay, and the international arts community at large.  Only you can help make this happen!

Our team of graduate art historians includes: Marlena Antonucci, Tracey Cole, Laura Colkitt, Mary Gilpin, Shanna Goodwin, Andrea Johnson, David Loisel, Chris Long, Bryce McWhinnie, Amanda Preuss, Ali Terndrup and Erin Wilson. (*See examples of their professional accolades below under "Getting to know our writers.") 

Supported also by undergraduate art historians Victoria Cooper and Jordan Shultz.

Take a look at the exemplary work of our featured artists by viewing their websites of past and ongoing work.

Michael Bauman: http://www.michaeljbauman.com

Katina Bitsicas: http://katinabitsicas.com

Christine Comple: http://ccomple.tumblr.com

Marcus DeSieno: http://marcusdesieno.com

Roberto Marquez: www.robertomarquezstudio.com

Beth Plakidas: http://www.bethplakidas.com

Janett Pulido Zizumbo: http://janettpulido.com

Curt Steckel: http://curtsteckel.com/home.html

Jaroslaw Studencki: http://www.jaroslawstudencki.com


*Getting to know our writers:

Our graduate art historians are enthusiastic and active researchers in their respective fields. Their scholarship has been selected for national conferences, including such recent selections as, “Searching for the Beloved: Homoerotic Representation in the Ottoman Empire,” at the University of Arizona (Loisel, 2015) and “‘Hair Culture’ Through the Lens of J.D. ‘Okhai Ojeikere” at Ohio University (Preuss, 2014). Others have received prestigious certifications, such as "Art Crimes and Cultural Heritage Protection" from the Association for Research into Crimes Against Art in Italy (McWhinne, 2014) and have been featured in publications, for example, Art-SEE, an Indiana University of Pennsylvania journal (Terndrup, 2013). They have also collaborated and curated an exhibition in 2013 at the Museum of Fine Arts St. Petersburg titled "Photographing the City” and have held numerous museum internships. Several have pursued their interests across the globe in study abroad programs in Paris, France and bi-annual excursions to the Venice Biennale.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I am a fine artist who lives in West Orange, NJ. (http://cherylwickham.com) This summer I will be travelling across the United States from sea to shining sea and painting as I go.

I will be travelling for approximately 35 days in July and August 2020, starting on the East Coast in New Jersey, heading on a northern route through Chicago to Seattle, down the Pacific coast to San Diego, then back across on a more Southernly route to New Jersey.  See below for the approximate route.

I will be stopping along the way at notable landmarks, National Parks and other places that sound interesting. As I go, I will be painting a series of watercolors to document the journey.

I thought it would be fun if people could receive real time artwork along the way!

What I Need & What You Get

Your contribution will cover the cost of my supplies and time painting.

My paintings typically take several hours to complete and my supplies include watercolor paper,  watercolor paints, painter's tape, pencil, and occasionally gel pen or ink pen.  In addition, there will be the costs of postage, time spent mailing, time spent compiling and editing the photo book and time updating contributors.

What you are getting here is the chance to buy original watercolor art fresh off the paintbrush and to support our National Parks. 

  • For $20, I will send you an an original watercolor postcard, which will be mailed to you from somewhere in the US while I am travelling. (Limited to 15)

  • For $100, you will receive for an original 9" x 11" matted watercolor of a view from one of our National Parks, to be sent after the trip. (Limited to 3).

  • For $45, you will receive a hard cover photo book of a selection of artwork painted while on the trip. Photo books will be autographed and will be mailed out in September after the trip is over.  (There is no limit to the number of books available. However, the printing of this book will be an exclusive Indiegogo edition and not released for sale elsewhere.  Once this campaign is done it will no longer be for sale. In addition, for every book over the first 5 sold, I will donate 50% of the net profits to the National Park system.)  

The Impact

By contributing, you not only get to support and receive original artwork, you will be supporting the National Park System too.   

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk here is that my trip will get cut short for some reason (sickness, car breakdown, family emergency, etc.). Other risks are that I will run out of supplies in a location without a nearby art store, that I will not be able to produce the artwork fast enough, or that I, for some reason, will not be able to paint. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean  you can't participate. You can always follow my photos of the journey on Instagram (@cherylwickhamart) from July 24 to August 28, or share my campaign and website with others who like art and might be interested in contributing.

story:
Mother of God of Priests 

“Tell the priests what you have seen.”

 

OVERVIEW

Mother of God of Priests is a painting by Michael Corsini.  It is a depiction of a vision chronicled in the Diary of St. Faustina.  Our Lady came to Faustina in a unique manifestation (see text below) and declared herself to be the “Mother of God of Priests.”  She asked St. Faustina to tell priests about her… this image will continue that mission.  Once complete the image will travel to parishes all over the country in order to prayer for the healing and renewal of priests.  I want to paint an image of Our Lady Mother of Priests.

 

BIO

My name is Michael Corsini and I am a painter.  I am a husband, to my beautiful wife Jessie, and father of five little ones.  I have been creating works of art for healing and renewal for nearly two decades.  I have a BFA from Ringling School of Art and Design as well as a MTS from the John Paul Institute for Studies on Marriage and Family.  I also spent 5 years in temporary vows as a member of the Franciscan Friars of the Renewal, in discernment of religious life and the priesthood.  Accordingly I have a deep love of the priesthood… I believe that in this time, the priesthood is under attack from outside and from within…. I want to paint this image in order to continue the mission given to St Faustina.  I believe it will bring healing and renewal to the priesthood when it is combined with the supplication and prayers of the faithful…  I will bring the painting to parishes all over the country to lead people in prayer and musical holy hours for the restoration of the priesthood.  Will you join me In this mission?  

 

GOAL

I need to gather at least $5,000 to get this project funded… that’s mostly supplies and time. What you get is a copy for yourself and other goodies (depending on your contribution), and the ability to join me in this mission!   My extended goal is $10000, at which point everyone, who funds at any level, will receive a free pack of (50) Holy Cards.  More importantly, this goal will allow me to travel with the image to parishes that can not afford to host the event!    

 

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is that I am doing this on my own… (well with lots of moral support from my kids!) I will be handling all the prints and fulfilling orders myself. I’ll be personally working with the printers, doing the packaging, and in some form, delivering them to you. This will extend the timeline on delivery, but I will personally vouch for each patrons’ order! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:

Share the project on Facebook and Instagram

Share my artwork found on Facebook and Instagram

Send the project to specific people who you think would be interested in it

www.michaelcorsini.com

Thank you for your support!

 

Stretch Goals

$7,000 - Beautifully designed car magnet for every contributor to the campaign!  It will feature a silver graphic design of the final image and also have the text:  Mary, Mother of God of Priests - Pray for us! 

$10,000 - Our Lady, Mother of God of Priests medal for every contributor to the campaign!  For adding to your rosaries, necklaces, or charm bracelets.  

 

The excerpt from the Diary of St. Faustina

1585. A vision of the Mother of God. In the midst of a great brilliance, I saw the Mother of God clothed in a white gown, girt about with a golden cincture; and there were tiny stars, also of gold, over the whole garment, and chevron-shaped sleeves lined with gold,. Her cloak was sky-blue, lightly thrown over the shoulders. A transparent veil was delicately drawn over her head, while her flowing hair was set off beautifully by a golden crown which terminated in little crosses. On Her left arm She held the Child Jesus. A Blessed Mother of this type I had not yet seen. Then She looked at me kindly and said: I am the Mother of God of Priests.  At that, She lowered Jesus from her arm to the ground, raised Her right hand heavenward and said: O God, bless Poland, bless priests. Then She addressed me once again: Tell the priests what you have seen.

Samples of Recent Work
story_txt: Mother of God of Priests “Tell the priests what you have seen.” OVERVIEWMother of God of Priests is a painting by Michael Corsini.  It is a depiction of a vision chronicled in the Diary of St. Faustina.  Our Lady came to Faustina in a unique manifestation (see text below) and declared herself to be the “Mother of God of Priests.”  She asked St. Faustina to tell priests about her… this image will continue that mission.  Once complete the image will travel to parishes all over the country in order to prayer for the healing and renewal of priests.  I want to paint an image of Our Lady Mother of Priests. BIOMy name is Michael Corsini and I am a painter.  I am a husband, to my beautiful wife Jessie, and father of five little ones.  I have been creating works of art for healing and renewal for nearly two decades.  I have a BFA from Ringling School of Art and Design as well as a MTS from the John Paul Institute for Studies on Marriage and Family.  I also spent 5 years in temporary vows as a member of the Franciscan Friars of the Renewal, in discernment of religious life and the priesthood.  Accordingly I have a deep love of the priesthood… I believe that in this time, the priesthood is under attack from outside and from within…. I want to paint this image in order to continue the mission given to St Faustina.  I believe it will bring healing and renewal to the priesthood when it is combined with the supplication and prayers of the faithful…  I will bring the painting to parishes all over the country to lead people in prayer and musical holy hours for the restoration of the priesthood.  Will you join me In this mission?   GOALI need to gather at least $5,000 to get this project funded… that’s mostly supplies and time. What you get is a copy for yourself and other goodies (depending on your contribution), and the ability to join me in this mission!   My extended goal is $10000, at which point everyone, who funds at any level, will receive a free pack of (50) Holy Cards.  More importantly, this goal will allow me to travel with the image to parishes that can not afford to host the event!     Risks & ChallengesMy biggest challenge is that I am doing this on my own… (well with lots of moral support from my kids!) I will be handling all the prints and fulfilling orders myself. I’ll be personally working with the printers, doing the packaging, and in some form, delivering them to you. This will extend the timeline on delivery, but I will personally vouch for each patrons’ order!  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you want to support the project but can't financially back the project, there are other ways you can help me reach my goal. These include:Share the project on Facebook and InstagramShare my artwork found on Facebook and InstagramSend the project to specific people who you think would be interested in itwww.michaelcorsini.comThank you for your support! Stretch Goals$7,000 - Beautifully designed car magnet for every contributor to the campaign!  It will feature a silver graphic design of the final image and also have the text:  Mary, Mother of God of Priests - Pray for us! $10,000 - Our Lady, Mother of God of Priests medal for every contributor to the campaign!  For adding to your rosaries, necklaces, or charm bracelets.   The excerpt from the Diary of St. Faustina1585. A vision of the Mother of God. In the midst of a great brilliance, I saw the Mother of God clothed in a white gown, girt about with a golden cincture; and there were tiny stars, also of gold, over the whole garment, and chevron-shaped sleeves lined with gold,. Her cloak was sky-blue, lightly thrown over the shoulders. A transparent veil was delicately drawn over her head, while her flowing hair was set off beautifully by a golden crown which terminated in little crosses. On Her left arm She held the Child Jesus. A Blessed Mother of this type I had not yet seen. Then She looked at me kindly and said: I am the Mother of God of Priests.  At that, She lowered Jesus from her arm to the ground, raised Her right hand heavenward and said: O God, bless Poland, bless priests. Then She addressed me once again: Tell the priests what you have seen.Samples of Recent Work

story:
What we need help for

During the course of the next year, The Jungle Lounge will take on 3 residents.  Each of them will be provided with a live/work space for one month, studio visits, gallery tours, personal introductions, and a solo show at The Jungle Lounge Gallery.  

Presently, the space needs to be built out with a sleeping loft and plywood-backed walls.  Our first resident will design and assist in the build out before mounting a show.  We are asking for material funds to get the space constructed and off the ground.  

We also hope to raise enough funds to cover the costs of each residents' plane ticket, transportation in and around NYC, and a $500 honorarium for participation in the residency.  

The buy-in for NYC is so high these days and The Jungle Lounge hopes to provide a bridge for queer artists who don’t feel they can make the jump to NYC.  

Barbara DeGenevieve Memorial Fellowship

In March, The Jungle Lounge will ask the School of the Art Institute of Chicago to recommend a few graduating BFA or MFA artists.  One student will be awarded a residency as the Barbara DeGenevieve Memorial Fellow. The resident will spend June in NYC culminating with a show that will open during Bushwick Open Studios.

story:
Fear Collecting Ritual: A Fools Journey

We all have fears. In a Fool's Journey, artist Lucien Shapiro begins a journey that offers guests the opportunity to place one of their fears into a vessel.

In this journey, Shapiro will travel to various regions across the country, performing two interactive rituals that focus on the collecting and relinquishing of fear and the journey of finding self and light, and screening a new film ANALECTS.

The project began with a debut in Los Angeles, and will continue as he travels towards the East Coast from the West Coast. The event will start with a film screening that takes on a see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil exploration of slowly losing the senses and an attempt to regain what was lost, starring Lucien himself and his sculptures.

This project is entirely self funded, and all events related to it are free to the public. Additional funding from this indiegogo campaign will help the artist recoup out-of-pocket costs from the Ritual. In making the choice to back this project, you will help the artist continue to his last destination where all of the fears he collected on the journey will be relinquished in a final ceremony.

What We Need & What You Get

GOAL: $10,000

Your donation will contribute in 2 big ways:

1. Supporting the artist in his quest to encourage participants to be brave enough to stand before strangers and place their fear into the Fear Relinquishing Vessel.

2. Enabling the project to make a full circle.  Everything must come full circle. While this journey will traverse the country, it begins in Los Angeles. Shapiro intends on also ending the journey in his home state of California, a place where he feels safe for the final ceremony.

A preview of our perks:

  • Fear Relinquishing 4 x 6 Photo Print signed by the artist and photographer
  • 16 x 24 Photo Print signed by the artist and photographer
  • Set of Limited Time Prints
  • Growth Vessel
  • Mask
  • Fear Protection Weapon
  • Fear Candle Holders
  • Invitation to Final Ceremony (space limited)


Lucien Shapiro's Film Screening and Ritual

The Analect Rituals is a take on see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil, and explores a symbolic loss of speech, hearing, and sight. As each of the senses is lost, a different mask is worn, and Shapiro goes on a quest for understanding in an attempt to regain what was lost. This is a project filmed by Shaun Roberts and scored by Edison, and is starring Lucien Shapiro and his artwork.

Symbolic of the continual search for guidance along the path of life, the Light Collector Ritual evidences the fact that the light we seek simply exists within ourselves. The ritual requires a constant circle of light, walking out of the darkness one faces through the realization of the light held within, and the journey does not end.


Follow the Journey

Even if you can't make a donation, you are encouraged to follow Lucien on his Fool's Journey in a couple of ways:
  • Come support an event in your town and relinquish a fear with the artist
  • Can't make it to an event? Mail your fear to PO Box 283 S.R CA 95402 (all mail must be sent before July 31st)
  • Spread the word by sharing this indiegogo campaign
  • Follow Lucien's journey on Instagram @lucienshapiro
  • Visit Lucien's website www.lucienshapiro.com
