story:
About us

Hello!  We are Lisa, Jessica, and Michelle. We are three ladies who have a wide range of skills and talents. We are passionate about art, community, and we love our hometown.

This campaign is about bringing the Moonlight Market to life. Imagine walking beneath the desert sky into a market that lights up the night with art and creativity. Imagine a place that supports the most talented artisans and crafters in the state. Moonlight Market will inspire and delight you as you discover many local treasures; plus it is just a stroll away from some of the best breweries and distilleries in town.  

Stop by the market and meet up with friends for dinner for a perfect evening out!

When you contribute to this campaign, you are helping us to build our dream. You are helping to create a truly unique place in the city of Albuquerque.


What We Need and What You Get

Our goal is to raise funds to help with the many start up costs that come with launching a new business. Things like licenses’, rent, insurance, and of course, boat loads of lights!  


We have been saving for and planning to launch the Moonlight Market for the past year. Finding the right rental property and neighborhood to launch the market has been more challenging than we could have imagined. 


We have powered through the disappointment of several leasing opportunities for “the perfect space” that fell through. In May, we stumbled across the actual perfect space, which happens to belong to a kind, generous, flexible, and patient man that we are honored to know.  Logistics require us to open the market somewhat sooner than we had planned, but this is an opportunity that we cannot pass up. We can’t do it without you!


In exchange for your contribution, not only will you be helping us to create one of the most unique places in town and an amazing community of people, but you will also get some really fun perks!  Our rewards include Moonlight Market gear, your name in lights,  as well as opportunities for merchants to get in on the ground floor of this business.  We expect our first season to be a wonderful success and we hope you will be a part of it.


Our goal is to raise $5000.


If we do not reach the full monetary goal of this campaign, the raised funds will go entirely to the launch of the Moonlight Market.  This is truly a passion project for us and our primary goal is to make it come to life!  All profits made this season will be reinvested in the market to grow and enhance it next season.


We truly adore our landlord, and are excited about paying him first. The more we do raise, the more we will be able to advertise and and promote our market and to bring our merchants together with awesome customers who support their work! 


Why Support Us

As artists, we understand the difficulties of trying to find a place to show and sell our creations.  Most of the markets, craft fairs, and art shows in Albuquerque (which are awesome by the way) fill up months in advance, and it is challenging for those new to the business to get a space.  We have experienced this frustration first hand!  We know that there is plenty of room in our city for Moonlight Market.  A unique market that introduces locals and tourists to our merchants’ work.  We are excited to promote our merchants and the other spaces where they sell their work whether it is online or at another market.  We are firm believers in abundance.


New Mexico is a unique place and we are excited to showcase some of the best it has to offer while supporting the artists themselves.  We are looking forward to serving our merchants and customers alike.  We want to build relationships with our merchants and create a community of people who can depend on one another.  


Each of our backgrounds and skill sets work perfectly together to support each aspect of this business.  Our experience includes large scale event planning and coordination, holiday craft fair development and management, business marketing, PR campaign management, recruitment, HR management, website development and social media management, and most importantly 15+ years of visual merchandising and retail management with a ridiculous track record of successful sales and team building - Sorry Jessica, I have to be honest about your skills!


Together, we have the experience to successfully operate, manage, promote, and grow this market.  We have the skills necessary to provide our merchants with the support that every small business owner needs.  We have a passion and love for art, for New Mexico, and for supporting the unique culture that our state has to offer.


Risks, Pitfalls, and Challenges

We are aware that there will be difficulties along the way.  There is always a learning curve with any new venture.  Who knew that zoning laws were so complicated?  We didn’t, but now we do.  New Mexico could have a 3 month monsoon season, which would be an issue for an outdoor market.


We are dedicated to meeting any such obstacles head on.  We are problem solvers and have spent years building the businesses of others.  We can’t wait to finally start building our own!

Other Ways You Can Help

We are so excited to get the the Moonlight Market off of the ground, and are truly grateful for any support you can provide.  We are going to need support on many fronts. Here is how you can help:


  • Donate if you can!


  • Spread the word!  Use the Indiegogo Share tool to help us promote this campaign on Facebook.  


  • Tell all of your friends about the Moonlight Market, and plan a visit!


  • Help us post fliers promoting the market!  Do you know of an awesome community board?  We would love to be there!


  • Support our merchants!  The more they are supported, the more they can focus on making awesome creations!


  • Follow us on social media and sign up for updates!  We can’t wait to tell you what is new at the market!

story:
Flint Public Art Project’s Free City Festival returns August 19th and 20th 2016, to the Chevy Commons. Now in its fourth season, Free City takes on the theme of Motion and Play inviting installations, sculptures, projections, and performances employing movement of objects and people through unexpected, unexplainable, and uncanny means. In its investigation of the phenomenology of motion, Free City 2016 invites artists and participants to ask: How do we move? For what purpose?

Free City is a large-scale public art festival that temporarily reclaims the former Flint-Chevy manufacturing site along the Flint River for public use. The festival features music, dance, and theater performances, art installations, and hands‐on workshops all free and open to the public to reconnect residents to the Chevy Commons site and its future potential. A critical mass of temporary activities turn the abandoned industrial property into an active public space, highlighting the ongoing transformation of Flint.

Flint Public Art Project (FPAP) invites you to help make this festival possible by making a donation today. Our goal of $10,000will support fees, expenses, and materials for emerging artists, providing them a platform to explore their work and give audiences Flint Unexpected experiences.  

This year, approximately 3,000 attendees from the wonderfully diverse communities of Flint, southeast Michigan, and beyond will attendthe Free City events. Due to the Social Disruption of the Flint water this year’s festival is more important than ever. The event will bring vital energy and enjoyment to a community that has experienced such upheaval for the past year.

FPAP’s mission is to organize public events, workshops and temporary installations to inspire residents to reimagine the city, reclaim vacant and underutilized buildings and lots, and use innovative tools to steer Flint’s long-range planning. It supports collaborations among local residents and organizations as well as with leading artists, architects, planners and community organizers from around the world, connecting Flint to regional, national, and global movements to revitalize neighborhoods and cities though art and design. The project documents and amplifies the many ways local residents, businesses, and institutions are transforming Flint and its public image and identity, and broadcasting this story to audiences throughout the city and the world.

GOALS

  • Raise $10,000 to help underwrite the expenses related to producing FPAP’s Free City Festival. These expenses include: the honorarium awarded to each of the featured artists; marketing and outreach; event security; photo and video documentation of the Free City activities; artists’ housing; and production and wrap-up costs.
  • To reconnect residents to the Chevy Commons site and its future potential.
  • Build networks of support for local, national, international artists and the Flint community that are productive and lasting.
  • Provide a venue for the creative voices in our community to tell our stories and empower one another to take control of our own narratives.

SOME EXAMPLES OF WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL SUPPORT

$10-$75: Helps underwrite the expenses for housing the artists.

$100: Enables us to provide meals and travel assistance for our artists and volunteers.

$200: Helps underwrite an honorarium awarded to one of the festival’s featured artists who will present excerpts from new work or a piece that has not yet been presented to the public.

$500: Helps underwrite the costs of travel materials needed to help the artists realize their projects

$1,000: Helps underwrite production and documentation costs, including venue and equipment rental, photographers, publications, etc.

Other ways to support Free City 2016

  • Back this campaign and encourage your friends and contacts to also donate.
  • Like Flint Public Art Project on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/flintproject
  • Post this campaign to your social media with the hashtag #freecity2016
  • Sign up to volunteer at www.freecityflint.org

Other ways to make a donation:

Make checks payable to Flint Public Art Project and include Free City 2016 in the memo field and mail to:

Flint Public Art Project

Attn: Free City Committee

604 University Ave

Flint, MI 48503

story_txt:
Flint Public Art Project’s Free City Festival returns August 19th and 20th 2016, to the Chevy Commons. Now in its fourth season, Free City takes on the theme of Motion and Play inviting installations, sculptures, projections, and performances employing movement of objects and people through unexpected, unexplainable, and uncanny means. In its investigation of the phenomenology of motion, Free City 2016 invites artists and participants to ask: How do we move? For what purpose?
Free City is a large-scale public art festival that temporarily reclaims the former Flint-Chevy manufacturing site along the Flint River for public use. The festival features music, dance, and theater performances, art installations, and hands‐on workshops all free and open to the public to reconnect residents to the Chevy Commons site and its future potential. A critical mass of temporary activities turn the abandoned industrial property into an active public space, highlighting the ongoing transformation of Flint.
Flint Public Art Project (FPAP) invites you to help make this festival possible by making a donation today. Our goal of $10,000will support fees, expenses, and materials for emerging artists, providing them a platform to explore their work and give audiences Flint Unexpected experiences.  
This year, approximately 3,000 attendees from the wonderfully diverse communities of Flint, southeast Michigan, and beyond will attendthe Free City events. Due to the Social Disruption of the Flint water this year’s festival is more important than ever. The event will bring vital energy and enjoyment to a community that has experienced such upheaval for the past year.
FPAP’s mission is to organize public events, workshops and temporary installations to inspire residents to reimagine the city, reclaim vacant and underutilized buildings and lots, and use innovative tools to steer Flint’s long-range planning. It supports collaborations among local residents and organizations as well as with leading artists, architects, planners and community organizers from around the world, connecting Flint to regional, national, and global movements to revitalize neighborhoods and cities though art and design. The project documents and amplifies the many ways local residents, businesses, and institutions are transforming Flint and its public image and identity, and broadcasting this story to audiences throughout the city and the world.
GOALS

Raise $10,000 to help underwrite the expenses related to producing FPAP’s Free City Festival. These expenses include: the honorarium awarded to each of the featured artists; marketing and outreach; event security; photo and video documentation of the Free City activities; artists’ housing; and production and wrap-up costs.
To reconnect residents to the Chevy Commons site and its future potential.
Build networks of support for local, national, international artists and the Flint community that are productive and lasting.
Provide a venue for the creative voices in our community to tell our stories and empower one another to take control of our own narratives.

SOME EXAMPLES OF WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL SUPPORT
$10-$75: Helps underwrite the expenses for housing the artists.
$100: Enables us to provide meals and travel assistance for our artists and volunteers.
$200: Helps underwrite an honorarium awarded to one of the festival’s featured artists who will present excerpts from new work or a piece that has not yet been presented to the public.
$500: Helps underwrite the costs of travel materials needed to help the artists realize their projects
$1,000: Helps underwrite production and documentation costs, including venue and equipment rental, photographers, publications, etc.
Other ways to support Free City 2016

Back this campaign and encourage your friends and contacts to also donate.


Like Flint Public Art Project on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/flintproject



Post this campaign to your social media with the hashtag #freecity2016
Sign up to volunteer at www.freecityflint.org


Other ways to make a donation:
Make checks payable to Flint Public Art Project and include Free City 2016 in the memo field and mail to:
Flint Public Art Project
Attn: Free City Committee
604 University Ave
Flint, MI 48503Federal Tax ID: 46-2244924
You can also donate through Fractured Atlas at http://fracturedatlas.org/site/contribute/donat...

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ted and I have two older sisters. I also have a mom. And I realized early on that sisters, mothers and daughters interact in mysterious ways that would be forever alien to me. The women in my family are headstrong and more often than not, right. That didn’t leave much wiggle room for me growing up and therein lay the seeds for the comedy series. When sisters go to war, dig a trench and keep your head low!

I’m also a filmmaker from NYC. After getting an MFA in film directing from Columbia University in NYC, I worked as a network TV producer for a number of years in Los Angeles. The industry is changing and there is no better time than now to be producing original content.

With your help, we’re self producing the 30 min. pilot episode of our comedy series, Welcome to Big Sky Adventures. We’ll distribute the show on our YouTube and Vimeo channels and after establishing a solid series identity with the highest production quality, we’ll shoot the following two episodes and then seek partners for the rest of the season. 

The key to all this is getting our pilot shot and edited. We have a compelling storyline, a fantastic cast and we can’t wait to share our world with you!

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is $14,970 to get our pilot shot and edited. We’ve cut our costs down as much as possible while still ensuring the highest production quality.

  • Wardrobe/hair and makeup  $1,300
  • Cameras, lights/sound/set operation  $6,775
  • Locations  $2,000
  • Transportation  $2,100
  • Insurance and Medical  $2,500
  • Misc. expenses  $295
 Total  $14,970

And when you contribute to “Welcome to Big Sky Adventures”, you’re not just helping us create and tell our amazing local Montana stories, you’ll be getting these great benefits!

  • $100  - Your own digital copy of the finished product plus special bonus features.
  • $250 - Signed script + photos with the cast + all of the above
  • $500 - Private screening party invite + your name in credits + all of the above
  • $1000 - Associate producer credit + all of the above
  • $5000 - Executive producer credit + on-set visit during shooting (with family member or guest) + preview of next two episodes + all of the above

The Impact

Montana is a unique place and culture. It represents something strong and significant in not just the United States but around the world.  And sure, this amazing state has been used as a backdrop for numerous films and shows, but "Welcome to Big Sky Adventures" will tell the actual stories of the remarkable people who live here. Through the Tuss sisters and the world they live, love and fight in,  Welcome to Big Sky Adventures will bring to life the absurdities that confront not just Montanans, but everyone trying to make sense of a rapidly changing world.

Risks & Challenges

Once we have our pilot shot and edited, our cast and crew will have to quickly turnaround and prepare to shoot episodes two and three. This will take place at the same time as our marketing and distribution efforts. What we're going to do, creating a network quality show for independent web distribution, is only now becoming a realistic endeavor but with our team of veteran producers and team members, we have a realistic path forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute now, there are other ways that you can help:

  • Ask friends and family to get the word out about our new show on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter
  • Watch our show!

Thank you!

story:
TRAIL recycled Art in the Landscape is an annual environmental Sculpture Trail taking place primarily in Teignmouth, Devon, but also branching out along the coast to include sites in Shaldon, Holcombe and Dawlish. Sculptures have to have a minimum of 70% recycled materials and/or carry a strong environmental message. A gallery exhibition, Indoor TRAIL under the same ethos runs along side the event.

In its 11th Year, the reigns of the organisation have been handed from its founders, local artists Liz Lockyear and Julia Vella to sculptor Luci Coles and glass artist Amy McCarthy, who's big Ideas you will read about below.

The ethos of TRAIL remains to;

  • encourage and support entries from amateur and professional artists alike, 
  • encourage businesses and community groups to get involved,
  • raise awareness of environmental issues that are so relevant to our lives, our surroundings and our future,
  • take an open view on what art should be.

TRAIL is run by volunteers. The money we raise will go directly to....

1. Allow the Sculpture TRAIL to run;

  • pay insurance (we cannot run without this)
  • cover cost of publicity materials.

2. Encourage local community involvement;

  •  to fund artist led workshops with local schools and community groups,
  • to offer prizes specifically for youth and community entries.
3. To encourage a wider network of artists, especially those working with an environmental theme;

  • Offer prizes to include professional and recent graduate artists, public vote and environmental prizes.

We hope to put TRAIL recycled art in the landscape on the national and even international art calendar. Benefiting sponsors, artists local business and communities involved.

So how can you help?

Are you a local business? Then please sponsor a flowerbed or prize. For donations between £75 and £500 We can offer fantastic value for money in advertising both on our sinage, sitting prominently in prime position on the promenade for 6 weeks in prime tourist season and for high end investors, county wide press coverage. 

Do you want to support this fantastic art event as an individual? -or just get yourself an original piece of artwork? Please give as much as you can afford. There are donations between £10 and £50 with original arty perks to sit on your coffee table or hang on your wall.

'Fly me to the moon' 'Hunting by Moonlight' and 'Little green man',  'Catching Light in the Forest' (SOLD) and 'Diving for Treasure' are all available for a £50 donation. Original artworks so first come first served. One more will follow shortly. Work is framed and available to view at TAAG Gallery, Northumberland Place, Teignmouth.

If you want to find out more or get involved please leave us a comment or visit our website where you will find artists briefs and lots of archival images to inspire you to join in!

new website for artists brief (currently under construction so may change daily!) www.trailart.co.uk

Old website containing archives of the last 10 years of TRAIL
www.trail.org.uk

story:
CURIOUS CABINETS

15 artists from around the UK have come together to put on an exhibition with a difference! From a variety of different disciplines and backgrounds, the Curious Cabinets artists are inspired by Cabinets of Curiosity. The exhibition will include work by dress makers, craftsmen, photographers, painters and more.

We want to raise money to allow us to put on an exciting and mysterious exhibition that offers an alternative event for Halloween.

By helping us to raise money we hope to provide a Private View  of the exhibition on the opening night (which all contributors will be welcome to attend), as well as helping us to buy the materials needed to stage the exhibition. 

 

The exhibition opens on Friday 21st October with a Private View 6-8pm

The exhibition then runs daily from 22nd October - 3rd November

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are looking to raise £500. This will be used to pay for materials to set up the exhibition (e.g. plaster board, paint, fabric etc.) as well as to pay for a drinks licence and refreshments for the Private View.

Any remaining money will be shared out between participating artists to help towards the cost of making work.

This project is receiving no further funding and even the smallest contribution will make a huge difference.

In return for your contributions, the artists have prepared a range of perks for you to select from, including original artworks, artists book, posters and prints. Perks start from just £1 so make sure you take a look at what's on offer.

 

If we don't reach our goal the exhibition will still go ahead, but we will not be able to put on such a lavish show. We want to give visitors an experience to remember, thinking about the texture and atmosphere in the exhibition space, as well as just the artwork on display. 

 

Between us, we have put on many successful exhibitions, and attracted hundred of visitors. This time we aim to do something a little different, and we hope you will share in our vision.

 

Meet the artists

This group of artists came together from a shared interest in cabinets of Curiosity and an ambition to put together this exhibition. 

Gill Alderson

Gill's current practice is based on an ongoing interest in contemporary drawing practice. Gill draws on unusual and unpredictable surfaces in order to challenge her own language of drawing. Often the materials chosen to work with have been domestically sourced. Intrigued by the molding and reshaping of materials to create objects or environments that suggest hidden narratives, the work is often accompanied by an air of disquiet. Often this disquiet suggests performance within the installations constructed.

Gill is offering an artist book entitled Punctum as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Punctum, by Gill Alderson (See Perks)

 

Lizzie Biscuits

Lizzie  makes affordable dramatic clothes for performers and peacocks.

Lizzie is offering a beautifully made Minimal as a Crowdfunding Perk. Choose any animal you like and Lizzie will make and dress it for you. Ready in time for Christmas!

Minimal (see Perks)

https://www.facebook.com/lizziebiscuits/?fref=ts

 

Michael Borkowsky

Michael's practice speculates upon a reality where scent is our primary means of communication and considers how art and artists would exist if that were the case. 

Michael is offering 2 Travel Perfume Assemblages as Crowdfunding Perks. These works consider the similarities between perfume and travel - both afford you the chance to adopt personas and acquire characteristics. 

Travel Perfume: Assemblages 1 (See Perks)

Travel Perfume: Assemblages 2 (See Perks)

 

www.michaelborkowsky.com

 

Richard Bradley

Richard is a Mixed Media artist, working with photography and sound.

Richard is offering a postcard of one of his photographs as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Postcard by Richard Bradley. (See Perks)

 

Sylvia Causer & Andrea Freeman
 

Together, Sylvia and Andrea are live/performance art partnership Pink and grAy who describe themselves as mature women doing daft things. However their work is underpinned by deep social concerns. They share a philosophy of ‘do no harm’ and are passionate about art being accessible and providing an experience outside of a gallery, usually one that engages people’s emotions, through humour or compassion. Pink and grAy critique and challenge social rituals and isms and are prepared to tackle difficult issues, including death and grieving. 


 

Pink and grAy are offering an A3 poster of their performance Betrayed as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Betrayed Poster (See Perks)

 

https://vimeo.com/162412881

facebook.com/TwomatureladiesPinkandGray/?pnref=lhc

 

Sandria Gilling

Sandria's artistic endeavours over the past 8 years have been concerned with the various representations of language from the historical to present times.
Interpretations of a text are affected by the reader as an individual; and becomes complicated by the physical and mental barriers of translation, and dependent on their physical and mental states of who they are as human beings. Sandria's reconstructions confront the reverence we pay to the written word. The question could be asked ‘Does the truth reside in a finished text or is it mislaid in the process of editing and self-correction? Her research has involved my interest in 17th Century folklore and fairy tales; magical realism writers such as Angela Carter and the radical theories outlined in the theories of Jack Zipes and Marina Warner.

Sandria is offering an artist book, Nightly Visitor, as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Nightly Visitor book. (See Perks)


 

Tomas Harker

Tomas is a painter based in Leeds who revisits stories of the past. He recontextualizes imagery culled from classical paintings and found photographs, obscuring or altering parts of the original works to create a new, uncanny experience. Tomas’ figurative paintings are inspired by a longer historical practice of reappropriating art from previous periods. 

Tomas is offering 2 postcards which he has also painted on by hand as Crowdfunding Perks.

Postcard 1, by Tomas Harker (See Perks)

Postcard 2, by Tomas Harker (See Perks)

www.tomasharker.co.uk

 

Sharon Mossbeck

Sharon Mossbeck is a conceptual artist making work about death, inspired by religion and history. Although her work may be about death, it is perhaps better understood as a celebration of life, while questioning what may happen beyond.

Sharon is offering a collage of her well known painting The Heart of a Heartless World as a Crowdfunding Perk. 

The Heart of  Heartless World Collage. (See Perks)

www.sharonmossbeck.com

 

Sue Taylor

Sue's work is influenced by memories of growing up in the 1960s, in a social structure where most of the women she knew did low paid, repetitive and task orientated work. These women were feisty and lively, supporting one another and the agency and determination to care for their families while working long hours, I find inspirational.  Another influence is Emily Bronte, who along with her siblings needed to find work outside the home in order to support herself. I find aspects of her life and personality intriguing and would love to have met her. 

Sue is offering an artist book entitled E.J.B as a Crowdfunding Perk.

E.J.B by Sue Taylor (See Perks).

 

Jayne Caesar

Jayne is an artist currently based in Sheffield. Her work is both autobiographical and self analytical, and is primarily based around the closed adoption system of the late 1960's. Through the exploration of film, photography and sculpture, Jayne aims to produce work which highlights the impact and the psychological issues that surround this system. 

Jayne is offering an artists book, which is a play adapted from a screen play, as a Crowdfunding Perk. The book is entitled Sheila's Family Portrait.

Sheila's Family Portrait by Jayne Caesar (See Perks)

www.jaynecaesar.co.uk

 

 

Catherine Harrison

Catherine Harrison is a professional working artist based in Liverpool creating work from her studio in the Baltic Triangle. Harrison works with themes of history, alchemy and symbolism and these themes are expressed through a variety of media including drawing, glass, metal and found objects.

Catherine is offering a small, framed drawing as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Untitled [Drawing by Catherine Harrison] (See Perks)

www.catherineharrison.co.uk

 

Henk Littlewood

Henk is a cabinet maker as well as an artist. He uses sustainably sourced hardwoods and traditional carpentry techniques to make contemporary pieces of furniture that reflect the beauty and internal structure of timber. Henk sources materials from tree to board in order to have complete control over the structure and form of each piece made. His designs are informed by a background in scientific research (Zoology) and an interest in comparative morphology. Henk's art is in revealing the intrinsic harmony and warmth in natural forms. Form and function - utility in design.

Henk is offering a beautifully made hand turned wooden bowl as a Crowdfunding Perk.

www.woodenhenk.com

 

Rachel Durance

Rachel is a Multimedia Artist

 

Damien Fisher

Damien is a Mixed Media Artist

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign. We realise that many people may be interested in our project without being able to contribute any money, but we would also really appreciate you helping us to spread the word.
One of the biggest challenges in Crowdfunding is reaching new people, and you can really help us by sharing links to our campaign with friends and family. 
Everyone is welcome to come along to the exhibition, which will be FREE and open to the public from 22nd October - 3rd November. We hope to see you there!

 

Any questions or press inquiries, please contact sharonmossbeck@hotmail.co.uk

Punctum, by Gill Alderson (See Perks)
 
Lizzie Biscuits
Lizzie  makes affordable dramatic clothes for performers and peacocks.

Lizzie is offering a beautifully made Minimal as a Crowdfunding Perk. Choose any animal you like and Lizzie will make and dress it for you. Ready in time for Christmas!

Minimal (see Perks)
https://www.facebook.com/lizziebiscuits/?fref=ts
 
Michael Borkowsky
Michael's practice speculates upon a reality where scent is our primary means of communication and considers how art and artists would exist if that were the case. 

Michael is offering 2 Travel Perfume Assemblages as Crowdfunding Perks. These works consider the similarities between perfume and travel - both afford you the chance to adopt personas and acquire characteristics. 

Travel Perfume: Assemblages 1 (See Perks)

Travel Perfume: Assemblages 2 (See Perks)
 
www.michaelborkowsky.com
 
Richard Bradley
Richard is a Mixed Media artist, working with photography and sound.
Richard is offering a postcard of one of his photographs as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Postcard by Richard Bradley. (See Perks)
 
Sylvia Causer & Andrea Freeman 
Together, Sylvia and Andrea are live/performance art partnership Pink and grAy who describe themselves as mature women doing daft things. However their work is underpinned by deep social concerns. They share a philosophy of ‘do no harm’ and are passionate about art being accessible and providing an experience outside of a gallery, usually one that engages people’s emotions, through humour or compassion. Pink and grAy critique and challenge social rituals and isms and are prepared to tackle difficult issues, including death and grieving. 
 
Pink and grAy are offering an A3 poster of their performance Betrayed as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Betrayed Poster (See Perks)
 
https://vimeo.com/162412881
facebook.com/TwomatureladiesPinkandGray/?pnref=lhc
 
Sandria Gilling
Sandria's artistic endeavours over the past 8 years have been concerned with the various representations of language from the historical to present times.Interpretations of a text are affected by the reader as an individual; and becomes complicated by the physical and mental barriers of translation, and dependent on their physical and mental states of who they are as human beings. Sandria's reconstructions confront the reverence we pay to the written word. The question could be asked ‘Does the truth reside in a finished text or is it mislaid in the process of editing and self-correction? Her research has involved my interest in 17th Century folklore and fairy tales; magical realism writers such as Angela Carter and the radical theories outlined in the theories of Jack Zipes and Marina Warner.

Sandria is offering an artist book, Nightly Visitor, as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Nightly Visitor book. (See Perks)
 
Tomas Harker
Tomas is a painter based in Leeds who revisits stories of the past. He recontextualizes imagery culled from classical paintings and found photographs, obscuring or altering parts of the original works to create a new, uncanny experience. Tomas’ figurative paintings are inspired by a longer historical practice of reappropriating art from previous periods. 

Tomas is offering 2 postcards which he has also painted on by hand as Crowdfunding Perks.

Postcard 1, by Tomas Harker (See Perks)

Postcard 2, by Tomas Harker (See Perks)
www.tomasharker.co.uk
 
Sharon Mossbeck
Sharon Mossbeck is a conceptual artist making work about death, inspired by religion and history. Although her work may be about death, it is perhaps better understood as a celebration of life, while questioning what may happen beyond.

Sharon is offering a collage of her well known painting The Heart of a Heartless World as a Crowdfunding Perk. 

The Heart of  Heartless World Collage. (See Perks)
www.sharonmossbeck.com
 
Sue Taylor
Sue's work is influenced by memories of growing up in the 1960s, in a social structure where most of the women she knew did low paid, repetitive and task orientated work. These women were feisty and lively, supporting one another and the agency and determination to care for their families while working long hours, I find inspirational.  Another influence is Emily Bronte, who along with her siblings needed to find work outside the home in order to support herself. I find aspects of her life and personality intriguing and would love to have met her. 

Sue is offering an artist book entitled E.J.B as a Crowdfunding Perk.

E.J.B by Sue Taylor (See Perks).
 
Jayne Caesar
Jayne is an artist currently based in Sheffield. Her work is both autobiographical and self analytical, and is primarily based around the closed adoption system of the late 1960's. Through the exploration of film, photography and sculpture, Jayne aims to produce work which highlights the impact and the psychological issues that surround this system. 

Jayne is offering an artists book, which is a play adapted from a screen play, as a Crowdfunding Perk. The book is entitled Sheila's Family Portrait.

Sheila's Family Portrait by Jayne Caesar (See Perks)
www.jaynecaesar.co.uk
 
 
Catherine Harrison
Catherine Harrison is a professional working artist based in Liverpool creating work from her studio in the Baltic Triangle. Harrison works with themes of history, alchemy and symbolism and these themes are expressed through a variety of media including drawing, glass, metal and found objects.

Catherine is offering a small, framed drawing as a Crowdfunding Perk.

Untitled [Drawing by Catherine Harrison] (See Perks)
www.catherineharrison.co.uk
 
Henk Littlewood
Henk is a cabinet maker as well as an artist. He uses sustainably sourced hardwoods and traditional carpentry techniques to make contemporary pieces of furniture that reflect the beauty and internal structure of timber. Henk sources materials from tree to board in order to have complete control over the structure and form of each piece made. His designs are informed by a background in scientific research (Zoology) and an interest in comparative morphology. Henk's art is in revealing the intrinsic harmony and warmth in natural forms. Form and function - utility in design.

Henk is offering a beautifully made hand turned wooden bowl as a Crowdfunding Perk.

www.woodenhenk.com
 
Rachel Durance
Rachel is a Multimedia Artist
 
Damien Fisher
Damien is a Mixed Media Artist
 
 
Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign. We realise that many people may be interested in our project without being able to contribute any money, but we would also really appreciate you helping us to spread the word.One of the biggest challenges in Crowdfunding is reaching new people, and you can really help us by sharing links to our campaign with friends and family. Everyone is welcome to come along to the exhibition, which will be FREE and open to the public from 22nd October - 3rd November. We hope to see you there!
 
Any questions or press inquiries, please contact sharonmossbeck@hotmail.co.uk

story:
Bref résumé


Je roule ma bosse comme illustratrice et travailleuse autonome depuis plus de 5 ans déjà. J'adore ça, même si la part d'insécurité financière qui vient avec est de plus en plus pesante.

Suite à mon déménagement à Montréal dans la dernière année, j'ai dû me résigner à reprendre un travail alimentaire pour m'aider terminer mes mois en un seul morceau, souvent de justesse. Cet emploi à temps partiel me coupe une grande part du temps que je peux allouer à la recherche de nouveaux contrats d'illustration et à mes projets personnels sans me sortir de la précarité financière.

Le tatouage, je vois ça comme un nouveau défi pour me redonner de l'estime personnelle à court terme et l'autonomie financière à plus long terme. J'aspire à faire cohabiter ces deux métiers intimement liés, l'illustration et le tatouage (en plus de mes projets de collage) pour qu'ils se nourrissent l'un de l'autre. 

Je sais que je ne ferai pas l'unanimité en choisissant de travailler à mon domicile plutôt qu'en salon, mais pour avoir expérimenté les deux en tant que cliente, j'ai de loin préféré la chaleur et la convivialité du studio maison, et c'est ce que je veux offrir à ma future clientèle. Ainsi, je préfère prendre moins de clients et prendre le temps de discuter avec chacun(e) de ses envies et inquiétudes afin de donner le meilleur service possible

 Ce dont j'ai besoin

Ma mentor, qui m'apprend à encrer la peau de façon aussi jolie que sécuritaire, m'a aidée à élaborer une liste du matériel dont j'aurai besoin pour commencer à zéro. 
En voici une version simplifiée:

  •  Une machine rotative, le power supply, le cable et une pédale;
  • Les aiguilles (liners et shaders de différentes tailles) et tubes;
  • Les encres, le papier thermique, du matériel à dessin
  • Tout le matériel d'hygiène (gants, sacs protecteurs pour les fils, la machine et la bouteille, du saran wrap, des bavoirs dentaires, du defend barrier film, du savon vert, du liquide antiseptique, du désinfectant de surface, etc. ) et plein d'autres cossins indispensables (Papier thermique, gobelets pour l'encre, bouteille, abaisse-langues, masking tape, rasoirs jetables, essuies-tout, Vaseline, etc)
  • Ainsi tout ce qu'il me manque pour aménager mon atelier en un environnement confortable et stérile. ( Une table à massage, un petit banc qui roule, une lampe, des rideaux, etc.)

Ce que vous obtenez

C'est là que ça devient intéressant pour vous! En plus d'avoir désormais dans votre entourage une nouvelle tatoueuse motivée et consciencieuse, vous recevrez DES AFFAIRES! 

LISTE DES AFFAIRES:

Carte surprise 5$
Reçois par la poste une de mes cartes postales, de souhait ou affichettes surprise (que je choisirai parmi mon inventaire en fonction de ce que je connais de toi, signée de ma main avec un petit mot personnalisé. Possibilité de la faire envoyer à un proche avec pour une surprise double. ;)


Dans ta boîte aux lettres toute l'année! 25$
Même principe, mais reçois ou fais envoyer 5 cartes surprise réparties tout au long de l'année avec des messages personnalisés pour te faire sourire au milieu des factures quand tu t'y attendras le moins.  


Portrait Facebook 40$
Le changement de saison est le moment idéal pour pimper ton profil Facebook, et quoi de mieux pour cela qu'un portrait unique réalisé de mes mains! 
(Fichier numérique basse-résolution, style "cartoon")


Affiche encadrée 50$
C'est ben l'fun aller dans les foires et acheter des prints, mais ils finissent souvent froissés dans le fond du gade-robe parce qu'on a la flemme d'aller le faire encadrer. Ce temps est révolu! Avec cette option, vous choisissez une affiche de votre choix parmi toute ma sélection de plus grands formats et je vous la livre avec un joli cadre tout blanc ou noir avec passe-partout blanc. (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)

Volaille - 50$

Collage original encadré (cadre doré et noir vintage) Format cadre 6 x 8 pouces Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)

 

L'Hygiène de l'oisillon - 50$

Collage original encadré (cadre doré vintage) Format cadre 5 x 7 pouces Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)

Insomnie - 50$

Collage original encadré (cadre argenté vintage) Format cadre 7 x 7 pouces Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)

 


Eaux fortes et Bain de foule - 75$
Deux collages originaux encadrés
Format cadres 6 x 8 pouces chacun
Intérieurs passes-partout: 4 x 6 pouces chacun

Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Flash Tatou prioritaire - 80$ 
Dès que je suis prête à opérer, je fournirai de temps en temps sur ma nouvelle page une sélection de petits dessins originaux à tatouer une seule fois chacun, premier choix aux premiers qui se manifesteront. Avant de publier ces planches, j'offrirai prioritairement le choix aux bénéficiaires de cette option, et bien sûr ce sera déjà payé. :)
Faites vite, limite de 5!
18 ans et +


Certificat cadeau - 100$
À appliquer sur un projet de tatouage de ton choix! 
18 ans et +

L'Offrande - 100$

Collage original encadré (cadre blanc vintage) Format cadre 11 x 13 pouces Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Journal de Québec - 100$
Collage original encadré (cadre turquoise vintage)
Format cadre 13 x 15 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 7,5 x 9,5 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Tranche(s) - 120$
Trois collages originaux encadrés
Format cadres: 8,5 x 11 pouces chacun
Intérieur passe-partout: 5 x 7 pouces chacun
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Le Colonel - 120$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 13 x 17 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 8 x 10 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Les petites amoureuses - 120$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 13 x 17 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 8 x 10 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Filtre - 120$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 13 x 17 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 8 x 10 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


La naissance des sirènes - 120$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 13 x 17 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 8 x 10 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


La ration des troupes - 120$
Collage original encadré (cadre vintage turquoise)
Format cadre 13 x 15 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 7,5 x 9 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Querelles intestines - 150$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 17 x 21 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 12 x 15 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Ghosting Henri - 150$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 17 x 21 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 12 x 15 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Seuls - 150$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 17 x 21 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 12 x 15 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Super Like - 150$
Collage original encadré
Format cadre 17 x 21 pouces
Intérieur passe-partout: 12 x 15 pouces
Investissez dans l'art local pour mettre en valeur votre salon ou votre lieu de travail.  Bonne idée cadeau pour les fête! (Livraison ville de Montréal seulement, possibilité de pick-up dans Hochelaga.)


Forfait portrait de couple 220$
Prends de l'avance pour Noël, la St-Valentin ou un anniversaire et offre LE cadeau personnel et éternel qu'est le portrait d'amoureux(ses). On se rencontre ou on clavarde pour évaluer le style et vos envies et je réalise en médiums mixtes (aquarelle et numérique) le souvenir de votre amour. Vous recevrez un fichier haute-résolution à imprimer dans le format de votre choix (du faire-part à la grande affiche encadrée) avec des suggestions d'imprimeurs au besoin.

Voilà!

Si jamais il y a surplus, :D je m'engage à utiliser cet argent pour du matériel d'art ou des frais associés à ma pratique artistique (impressions, emplacements pour foires, etc.). J'en manque toujours! Si par malheur je n'atteins pas mon objectif, je vais acheter une partie du matériel listé ci-dessus et essayer de trouver un autre moyen de financer le reste, parce que j'y tiens pour vrai. Les certificats pour les tatouages seront donc aussi applicables dans un futur proche.


 

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Je comprends bien que plusieurs d'entre vous n'ayez pas les moyens de financer les campagnes de tous vos amis Facebook (c'est d'ailleurs mon cas). Mais, si vous croyez au projet, n'hésitez pas à partager dans vos réseaux en expliquant pourquoi ce serait une bonne idée de miser sur moi.

Je vous remercierai éternellement pour ça. <3

Forfait portrait de couple 220$Prends de l'avance pour Noël, la St-Valentin ou un anniversaire et offre LE cadeau personnel et éternel qu'est le portrait d'amoureux(ses). On se rencontre ou on clavarde pour évaluer le style et vos envies et je réalise en médiums mixtes (aquarelle et numérique) le souvenir de votre amour. Vous recevrez un fichier haute-résolution à imprimer dans le format de votre choix (du faire-part à la grande affiche encadrée) avec des suggestions d'imprimeurs au besoin.
Voilà!
Si jamais il y a surplus, :D je m'engage à utiliser cet argent pour du matériel d'art ou des frais associés à ma pratique artistique (impressions, emplacements pour foires, etc.). J'en manque toujours! Si par malheur je n'atteins pas mon objectif, je vais acheter une partie du matériel listé ci-dessus et essayer de trouver un autre moyen de financer le reste, parce que j'y tiens pour vrai. Les certificats pour les tatouages seront donc aussi applicables dans un futur proche.
 
 D'autres façons d'aider
 Je comprends bien que plusieurs d'entre vous n'ayez pas les moyens de financer les campagnes de tous vos amis Facebook (c'est d'ailleurs mon cas). Mais, si vous croyez au projet, n'hésitez pas à partager dans vos réseaux en expliquant pourquoi ce serait une bonne idée de miser sur moi.Je vous remercierai éternellement pour ça. <3

story:
Hello, my name is Joseph Martin, and I am a graduate of Manhattan School of Music and Queens College in the disciplines of Collaborative Piano (MSM) and Piano Performance (QC). 

 

         When I graduated from Queens College, it suddenly hit me, like a pound of bricks, that the only way someone was going to give me a check for having a great version of a Beethoven sonata was if I 

 

a) took three months out of my life, learned grant writing, found the government agency in charge of it, and petitioned the powers at large to explain why this was an important cultural good, 

 

b) found a considerably wealthy art patron that made it his goal in life to pay for all of my concerts, or

 

c) did it on Youtube with some silly gimmick like, “Hear the Appassionata——while Joe lights his hair on FIRE!”

 

          I decided it was of more utility to pursue accompanying for my Masters—after all, there’s clearly a need for an accompanist with the numbers of singers in New York, right? Well, yes, but after that degree, I found out that anybody can ask for an accompanist to show up anywhere in New York for $25/hr, with no guarantee the job would happen, OR guarantee that there would be any more hours than that, and yes….everytime someone posted on Facebook for one, they got it. So the demand was….only as high as that. I wasn’t exactly an escalator repairman….my skills were slowly becoming more expendable as the college graduation rates for “collaborative artists” was increasing. 

 

         So, seeing all the flaming hoops I had to go through to just play one piece of Beethoven as a “professional”, I decided I’d stop trying to vie for supremacy in a world with ever-decreasing opportunities from the established outlets, and try to spend the rest of my life making it easier for people, like me, that JUST wanted to play some classical music, be appreciated, and have a little something for their daily bread. If that meant I had to become 24/7 morally good Lex Luthor, so be it, the world needs it now, that I know.

 

Breakdown of Costs: 

 

Each concert, I give $40 to three performers, $30 to an artist for a program and poster, $90 to the venue thanking them for putting us up, providing storage space, helping further our cause, and $40 to me for booking everyone and organizing it, which comes down to:

 

$40x3=$120

$30+$90=$120

=$240+$40=$280

 

A goal of $3600 would keep us is in business for a year; my recording on the video says 2 years, but it was a good take, and I made all the recording myself, so give me a break, if you read this whole thing, I feel like you’ll forgive the time discrepancy. Additionally, I’m going to want to fundraise for slightly more expensive projects, such as paying for a performance of the last Beethoven Quartet, so….this assumes that it was rigidly the same month to month, which it will be, unless I hire people for a performance of a Beethoven Quartet.

 

Perks: 

 

Donate anything above $100-I’ll play for you

 

If I don’t reach my goal: I’ll try again.

 

The impact of your donation here will mean that the world still values live music, and music performed without the micro managerial clout of education or religious observance guiding it. I want there to be a child that can hear Ravel’s Alborada Del Gracioso which WASN’T part of a music appreciation course, or part of Communion at a church. You’re supporting music for music’s sake, for the rich traditions it has always represented, for the geniuses that it produced, because of MUSIC. And yes, I do believe this does connect to the cosmic beyond and all that good stuff, and when people say Bach did everything for God, I think this is the same person we’re trying to connect to as well, minus the political and social constrictions and connotations.

Music at the Daily Press is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Music At The Daily Press must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Please give!

story:
We have uncovered the world's first human rights exhibition and are displaying it in a new traveling exhibition titled ‘A New World Image.' Our first destination is the Royal Danish Library/Black Diamond in Copenhagen, where the exhibit opens on 30 September, precisely 65 years after the original show opened in Paris. We have everything ready for this event, but we need your help in covering the final production costs to build the exhibition. With your support, this will be just the beginning of taking our exhibition to destinations around the world and creating a contemporary visual archive of human rights.


Why is this project important?

What do we mean when we say "human rights"? What do these rights look like to us? Do we envision physical suffering, structural inequality, individual triumph, communal resilience, or a history of achievements to be celebrated? The answer matters to the way we understand the world and how to change it. However, we seem to have become so familiar with the term "human rights" that we rarely question what it actually means, where it comes from, or what its future is. This exhibition seeks to change that by re-examining the new world image that was built up around human rights in the aftermath of the Second World War and juxtaposing this image with the way human rights are visualized today.  

                         

What we need and what you get

We have (almost) everything we need to make this a reality:

  1. THE CONTENT: The original traveling exhibition from 1949 and digital copies of installation photographs, diplomatic correspondences and promotional material + a photo-competition organized by the Danish Institute of Human Rights to provide contemporary content. 
  2. THE SPACE: The Royal Danish Library has invited us to show the exhibition at the Black Diamond in Copenhagen, where the exhibition will be free and publicly accessible. 
  3. THE DESIGN: An exciting and spatially flexible design, developed by our talented project architect, Simon David + a new visual identity developed by our fantastic graphic designers, Alfons Hooikaas and Tim Gambell. 
  4. EVENTS: Support for the opening reception on 30 September and two public panel debates in October and November at the Black Diamond.
  5. CONSTRUCTION: The majority of the funding we need for installation materials + a super skilled carpenter, Will Huntley, who'll bring the design to life.

We ask for your help to get us across the finish line and help us cover the final production costs of building the exhibition.



For your donation, you do not only receive our sincerest gratitude, but also a list of rewards that you can see in the right column of this page. We can't wait to give you tours, send you original artwork made for the exhibition and much more! Even more importantly, you'll become part of this project in helping us build a new exhibition that will travel for years to come. This is only the beginning, and we hope to bring it to many other destinations (we're already in touch with venues in Sweden, France and Mexico) - so please get in touch if you would like to discuss showing the exhibition near you!


What was the original Human Rights Exhibition?

“...to ensure that 20th-century man shall not merely approve the Declaration of Rights but appeal to it constantly and as a matter of course, and shall understand that, if he makes it a part of his life, he will never have a charter that is worth more to him.”

Jaime Torres-Bodet, Director-General of UNESCO in 1949

In 1948, the UN adopted the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. This has become a widely celebrated and cited document, but in 1948 no one really knew what it was supposed to mean in concrete terms, and very few even knew that it existed. To address this problem, the UN’s Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) organized an exhibition that was supposed to explain in visual terms how human rights had emerged in cultures around the world since the beginning of time. They invited all of their fifty member states to submit materials, and carefully curated these submissions into a compelling new history of humankind. After the exhibition opened in Paris on 30 September 1949, it was sent in a smaller version to countries around the world. 


The project:  re-display and new material

We now live in a time when Jaime Torres-Bodet's goal seems to have been reached: We appeal to human rights constantly and as a matter of course - but have they come to seem so self-evident that we don't reflect on their meaning anymore? Through a re-display of this historical exhibition for the first time since its inception, we want to contribute to a contemporary debate about the meaning and visual culture of human rights. We've already made one exhibition in New York this spring in partnership with Columbia University's Institute for the Study of Human Rights and the Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation. This event made it clear to us what an amazing platform this material is for reflection and critical discussion. 


Visualizing Universalism exhibition, 17 April-23 May 2014

First stop: Copenhagen

Now we want to take the exhibition traveling. We have been invited by the Royal Danish Library to show our exhibition at the Black Diamond in Copenhagen, where it will be free and publicly accessible. This is one of the most iconic and visited spaces in Copenhagen, so we're thrilled to be able to show the exhibition there. 

Photo-competition and building a new visual archive

We have also teamed up with the Danish Institute of Human Rights, who have organized a photo competition about the meaning of human rights in Denmark today (read more about the competition - in Danish - here: http://menneskeret.dk/kalender/fotokonkurrence-menneskerettigheder-dag-danmark). The best submissions will be included in our exhibition and will offer a contemporary point of comparison to the depiction of human rights from the 1940s. For each future destination of the exhibition, we want to gather new photographs of human rights and in this way build a contemporary visual archive of human rights. 

The Black Diamond in Copenhagen


How your donation will be used

Every dollar you donate will go to building this exhibition, and we will make our expenses public so you know exactly where the money went. Below is a list of tasks we need to complete:

  • Covering the final costs of building 10 columns out of plywood, which will show the story of the 1949 Human Rights Exhibition as well as the winning images from the Institute of Human Rights photo competition.
  • Buying 40 squaremeters of plexiglass that will host the original traveling exhibition on the floor of the exhibition space. This unconventional display will both serve as a metaphor for the way "history is beneath our feet", and as a flexible display method that can be arranged differently in other spaces, including being placed on a wall - or maybe even on a ceiling!
  • Printing the explanatory text and contextual materials as well as the winning photos from the photo competition. Most of this will be shown on boards that can easily be stacked and sent to another location, and a smaller part, such as key quotes and headlines, will be printed in vinyl that can be stuck directly to the window and the floor.
  • Transportation of installations from the construction site to the venue.


    • How this project was born

    Eva and Katrine are both from Denmark and met three years ago after coming to New York to study history and human rights. While writing a paper about human rights and museums, Katrine came across a reference to the Human Rights Exhibition in a UNESCO publication from 1949 (Eva still remembers the day Katrine showed her a printed copy of this little reference, having no idea how much this would shape both of our futures). With a little more research into this seemingly forgotten event, it turned out that original copies of the traveling exhibition still existed, for example in an antiquarian bookstore in Israel and in Maryland, USA. 

    We decided that the world needed to see these, and founded the Human Rights Exhibition Project after we had finished our studies. Columbia University’s Institute for the Study of Human Rights offered to host us, and that’s where we’ve been based for the past year. We have spent this time doing research; building a presence for the project; organizing a lecture series, workshops, and a symposium; and most importantly, making an exhibition titled 'Visualizing Universalism' that opened in April this year. You can see more about the Human Rights Exhibition Project on our website.

    Now, in the capable hands of our project architect, Simon, the exhibition has been re-conceptualized for travel. This new leg of the project not only references the travels of the original exhibition, but also brings this historical event profoundly into the present by gathering contemporary photographs of human rights at each destination. 

    From the beginning, this project has been made possible by the creativity, support, and excitement of people we have met along our way. That's why we're so excited about the opportunity to spread the project's reach through this campaign and the subsequent travels of the exhibition. We hope you'll be part of the journey!

    Not able to donate? You can still help!

    We can't get around this fact: Cash is what we need to make this happen. However, if you're not able to support the project financially, we hope that you'll share it with others and spread the word. Please share it if you donate, too. And of course, we hope that if you’re in Copenhagen between 30 September and 5 November, you’ll come see the exhibit!


    Risks and challenges

    We’ve already pulled together the majority of the resources we need and found amazing people who have been willing to help us out with their time and their talents. Because we have built and opened an exhibition before, we are confident in our abilities to carry this project through.  

    Our biggest challenge is our time line, since production of the installations has to start in mid-September, while printing has to start no later than the 23rd. We really hope to get the last funds we need by that point. However, if we do not reach our funding goal, we will still build a version of the exhibition with less durable materials, which will make it trickier to take it traveling.




    Thank you for reading, and welcome to the project!

story:
Hi there!  My name is Maddie and I am in need of funds for my craft supplies and so I can make product and also be able to have the fees to enter fairs.

  • I am (cough)in my very early 50s, recently lost my job and due to divorce have no savings. Never in my life did I think I would be in this position at this age and I have had to swallow a lot of pride which brings me to this page.  I simply can no longer afford the supplies I need.
  • I make a variety of whimsical “one of a kind” paper mache’ items as well as figurines and season wreaths of all kinds.  In addition I make jewelry, candles and retro inspired corsages for the holidays.  All are hand-made.

What I Need & What You Get

  • With your kind donation I will be able to purchase booths at upcoming bizarres and craft fairs, as well as the much needed plastercraft, papers, paints, ornaments, booth set ups and finally I hope to have enough money left over to launch an online store so any additional funding would go to setting up my business with the proper paperwork for a tax ID and web hosting.
  • To Reward people for their help and donations I have several Perks ranging from votive candles, paper mache' figures, necklaces, pendants and bowls - all handmade.
  • If I do not reach my goal, any contribution will still be applied to my art supplies and I will press on.  I am always creating and it's what makes me excited to get up in the morning.

The Art

  • I am inspired by a bygone era of handmade art that truly brings a smile to my face when I am sculpting or painting.
  • I have recently showed my art to a local store that said "I knocked it out of the park" as well as friends and Facebook people who love my sample pics and are ready to buy.  I just need the supplies to make it happen.

Also…

Trust me I know how it is if you are broke.  If you are unable to donate monetarily, I ask if you could please forward my link to spread the word to others who may be interested.  Every little bit helps and getting the word out is a wonderful and much appreciated way to contribute.

We are all in this together!  I thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Maddie

also be able to have the fees to enter fairs.

I
     am (cough)in my very early 50s, recently lost my job and due to divorce have no

story:
What is Illuminated: Art and Beautiful Writing?

Illuminated:  Art and Beautiful Writing (or just Illuminated for short) is a series of four workshops and a gallery show based on appreciating calligraphy and hand lettering. 

I came up with the idea for Illuminated: Art and Beautiful Writing after searching for calligraphy instructors in Savannah, Georgia. There were not any I could find, so I gradually thought of the idea of hosting short calligraphy workshops and then holding a gallery show to display the work that people created. And here we are! 

As an M.A. candidate for Arts Administration, I am hosting this project as part of my final graduation requirements. I am using all my knowledge of event planning, marketing, and fundraising to make this idea a reality. 


Events

There will be four workshops, each held at Blick Art Materials, 318 E. Broughton Street, Savannah GA, from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Each class only costs $5 OR Pay-What-You-Can!  The classes are:

  • Writing as Communication: A Hands On History by Bride Whelan on July 18
  • An Introduction to Lettering: Pen versus Brush by John Stevens on July 25
  • An Introduction to Japanese Calligraphy by Yoshiko Moon on August 1
  • Hand Lettering and Illustration by Jessie Wei Hsuan Chen on August 8

John Stevens teaching one of his previous classes.

There's also one gallery show, Illuminated: Art and Beautiful Writing which will be open from August 14 to 16.  It will be held at Oglethorpe Gallery, 406 East Oglethorpe Avenue, Savannah, GA. The opening reception is on August 14 from 6 p.m. - 9 p.m.. 


What's Needed

The overall budget for this project is $2, 500. Where is it all going? 

  • $1,100 goes towards paying the talented tutors for their time and in some cases travel, especially as workshop fees are heavily subsidised.
  • $750 goes to securing the gallery space for the show.
  • $450 goes toward marketing the event. 
  • $200 goes towards paying for all the printing, food, and fundraising!  
  • If I don't reach the goal, all the money goes towards paying the artists for their time. 

The Oglethorpe Gallery, where the show will be held.



The Impact

If you donate to this project, you will

  • Bring awareness of different types of calligraphy to Savannah
  • Help build a community around a shared interest
  • Get some really cool perks~ 

Yoshiko Moon demonstrating Japanese calligraphy.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk associated with this project is reaching the full goal. I used some of my tuition to pay for this event, so if I do not make it I might not be able to finish graduate school. Fortunately, I also have:

  • Marketing, fundraising and financial knowledge gained from SCAD 
  • Helped manage an Indiegogo campaign prior to this
  • Many different ways that people can help
  • A great team!


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate to this campaign? You can still help! 

  •  Like and follow Illuminated on Facebook at www.facebook.com/illuminatedsummer. 
  • Tell everyone just how awesome this project is using the hashtag #illuminatedsummer. 
  • Volunteer for gallery show hours! 
  • Interested in sponsoring Illuminated? Email us at illuminatedsummer@gmail.com. 

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Every little bit helps.

story:
The English version is lower, as the Spanish version ends!

Womeet

¿POR QUÉ?

Womeet nace de la pasión de tres chicas por hacer proyectos sociales; junto con la oportunidad que tenemos de viajar a India. Vimos que era una oportunidad idónea para llevar a cabo un proyecto relacionado con la mujer en India. Nuestro objetivo es aportar nuestro granito de arena a la mejora de este colectivo, a través del emprendimiento y así crear el principio de una gran mejora en India.

¿CÓMO?

A través de un proceso de emprendimiento basado en la teoría de Design Thinking, centrado en el trabajo en equipo. Las participantes serán mujeres de diferentes perfiles (estudiantes, trabajadoras del sector público, responsables de un negocio familiar, etc) con un mismo punto en común: el interés por desarrollar nuevos proyectos y sus sueños para mejorar su entorno.

El proceso Desing Thinking se basa en 4 fases: observación, ideación, prototipo e implantación. El objetivo es aprender esta herramienta a través de su puesta en marcha, de manera que estas mujeres puedan aprender la teoría en la práctica; o lo que es lo mismo; aprender haciendo.

El proyecto se basa en dos pilares: la unión y el aprendizaje. 

La unión es porque fomentamos el trabajo en equipo. Nosotras estaremos allí y trabajaremos junto con ellas y ayudaremos a que sus proyectos salgan adelante, siendo ellas siempre las protagonistas del proyecto. Por otro lado, el aprendizaje. Ellas aprenderán de nosotras a la vez que nosotras aprenderemos mucho sobre ellas. 

¿QUÉ?

Womeet es un proyecto sin ánimo de lucro, y es por ello que buscamos financiación a través de esta campaña de Crowdfunding; para cubrir los gastos de transporte del proyecto, ponentes con experiencia, alquiler de local de trabajo, y material.

Nosotras estaremos solo dos meses en India. Es muy poco tiempo si pretendes crear un impacto positivo en la zona. Tendrá un seguimiento ya que no será empezar una cosa y no terminarlo, queremos que todo salga bien para que el proyecto de verdad ocurra y que el cambio sea real.

El proyecto será algo cercano, viviréis la experiencia que están viviendo las mujeres mediante nuestras redes sociales: Facebook,Twitter,Instagram y los blogs tanto en castellano como en inglés.

¡CONÓCENOS!

Somos Beatriz Santamaría, Eider Etxebarria e Iratxe Tajada; cofundadoras de la Junior Cooperativa Want Coop (wantcoop.com), a través de la cual desarrollamos diferentes proyectos divididos en áreas de trabajo basados en las 4 bases que necesitamos las personas para adentrarnos en el cambio: 

·EDUCAR.GLOBALIZAR.EMPODERAR.CAMBIAR ·

A través de este proyecto queremos exprimir el viaje a India, y volver con la sensación de haber contribuido a la mejora del entorno indio.

¿AÚN QUIERES AYUDAR MÁS?

¡Hay muchas formas de colaborar! Si ya has aportado tu granito de arena y aún quieres hacer más, no te preocupes, ¡Hay otras muchas formas!

Del mismo modo que si no puedes permitirte colaborar económicamente, lo entendemos y te agradeceríamos mucho si...

Compartes esta campaña a todos tus conocidos a través de esta página: trabajo, universidad, colegio, amigos, gimnasio, etc. ¡Haz que todos sepan de nosotras y anima a otros a colaborar!Recuerda:en la unión está la fuerza.

¿DUDAS SOBRE LA CONTRIBUCIÓN?

Si tienes dudas sobre el pago a través de PayPal, contacta con beatriz.want@gmail.com o eider.want@gmail.com y te ayudaremos.

English version

Womeet

WHY?

Womeet starts from the dream of three young girls for working on social projects; together with the opportunity we have to travel to India. We saw that it was a wonderful opportunity to develop a project related with women. Our objective is to do our bit to help in the progress of this collective, though the entrepreneurship and in this way, to create the beginning of the big progress in India.

HOW?

Through an entrepreneur process, based on the theory of the Design Thinking, centered on the team work. The participants will be women of different profiles (students, public sector workers, responsible of a family business, etc) with one similar point on common: the interest on developing new projects and their dreams to make a progress on their surroundings.

The process of the Design Thinking in based on 4 phases: observation, ideation, prototype and testing. The objective is to learn this tool though the practise, in this way this women could learn the theory in the practise; or which is the same; learning by doing.

The project is based on two pillars: the unity and the learning.

The unity is because we encourage the team work. We will be there and we will work ith them and we will help them to develop the projects, being always the women the protagonist of the project. On the other hand, the knowledge. They will learn from us, in the same way we will learn a lot from them.

WHAT?

Womeet is a non-profit project, and that is why we are finding the financing though the Crowdfunding campaign; to cover the costs of the transport of the project, the orators with experience, renting the working space and the material.

We will be only two months in India. It is a very short time if you want to make a positive impact in the surrounding. It would have a continuity, is not going to be start one thing and not finishing it; we want to everything goes well, the project really happen and to have a real change.

The project would be something near, you would live the experience that are living the women though our social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and the blogs in spanish and english. 

KNOW US!

We are Beatriz Santamaría, Eider Etxebarria and Iratxe Tajada; co-founders of Want Junior Coop (wantcoop.com). We develop different projects which are based  in the fourth bases that people need to be the change: 

·EDUCATE.GLOBAL.EMPOWER.CHANGE ·

Though this project we want to take advantage about our trip to India, and come back with the feeling of having contributed on the progress of the Indian surrounding.

Though this project we want to take advantage about our trip to India, and come back with the feeling of having contributed on the progress of the Indian surrounding.

YOU EVEN WANT TO HELP MORE?

They are any ways to collaborate! If you have already bit to help and you still want to do more, don’t worry, they are more ways!

In the same way if you can not afford to collaborate economically, we understood and we would appreciate if you…

Share this campaign to all your acquaintance through this web page: work, university, college, friends, gym… Make that everyone know about us and encourage others to collaborate! Remember: unity is strength. 

QUESTIONS ABOUT CONTRIBUTION METHOD?

If you have questions about payment via PayPal, please contact beatriz.want@gmail.com or eider.want@gmail.com and we will help you.

story:
Short Summary

I am a Los Angeles Artist Neneki "Nick" McGee. My Art has been featured on TV, Movies, Magazines, Art Galleries and Museums. I have been featured at some the largest Music Festivals like SXSW, Lollapalooza and Taste of Soul Los Angeles performing my 10 minute LIVE Speed Portrait Paintings to Music.

The purpose of my Indiegogo Campaign is to raise funds for a Street Tour where I will perform my 10 minute LIVE Paintings at various Landmarks like Venice Beach, Hollywood and Las Vegas. Then I want to conclude the tour with a big Los Angeles Art Show showcasing the paintings painted at various events. My Art Show will also include a LIVE Painting stage performance by me.

Your contribution will be a huge boost for my Art. It will allow me to share my gift of Art directly with others. It will inspire, amaze and uplift everyone who comes in contact with this project. I am very passionate about Art. It has taken my life on a incredible journey. I want to motivate others to Dream and find their Passions!

What We Need & What You Get (Perks)

Funds raised will cover Art Supplies, the cost of a photographer/cinematographer to cover this project, a trip to Las Vegas to LIVE Paint, Marketing Material for the Art Show, and the rental of a venue for the LIVE Painting Showcase and Art Show.

For contributing to my campaign I offering Limited Edition Prints, Original and Custom Art.

Limited Edition 11x17 inch Prints

Original Art

 

Custom Art

 I truly believe I will exceed my campaign funding goal. If I do not reach my goal I will still move forward with this project with funds raised. This project is another dream of mine that will become reality.

I hope you connect to my Art and this Project and Support it in any way you can!

If you like the project but you can't support it monetarily:

Spread the word!

Put a link to this project on your blog, website or what ever you can imagine! I am thankful for every little bit of help!



Best wishes,

Neneki "Nick" McGee
