story:
BACKGROUND

The Community Rejuvenation Project (CRP) has dedicated itself to cultivating healthy communities through beautification, education & celebration, using public art as a foundation for holistic, positive community engagement. Partnering with local government, community-based organizations, business owners and business organizations, since 2010, CRP has created more than 100 murals painted in Oakland, Richmond, and Hayward. These include projects commissioned by the City of Oakland and the City of Richmond. CRP’s community partners past and present include People’s Grocery, Restorative Justice for Oakland Youth, United Roots, Phat Beets, the University of Hip-Hop and many others. Since the mid 2000s, CRP has promoted public art and education with regard to youth development, teaching classes and workshops at numerous schools and youth-centric programs.

For more info on the Community Rejuvenation Project, please check out www.CRPBayArea.org


THE ALICE STREET MURAL PROJECT

CRP is planning a video documentary and corresponding  mural project focused on the diverse African-American and Chinese communities intersecting at 14th and Alice Sts in Oakland. Twenty “culture keepers” from the historic Hotel Oakland and Malonga Casquelord Center will be interviewed on the history of the neighborhood, the communities that thrive there and their cultural practices. Translators will be used to conduct interviews with native Chinese speakers.

The interviews will be used to guide a mural design process by CRP. The mural portion includes painting approximately 10,000-sq. ft of surfaces on three different properties facing a parking lot in a prominent downtown location, which will be completed by a team including CRP artists and youth interns. Upon completion of the mural, CRP will hold a neighborhood block party featuring live music and dance.

A permanent website including the documentary, as well as extended interviews, photographic stills, and additional educational material, will be created to extend the reach and scope of this project.

We are projected to start the mural in July 2014, with a dedication upon completion in early August 2014.

WHAT WE NEED

We are raising $8,000 which will be matched by the East Bay Fund for Artists. Funding will go directly to the rental of two scissor lifts, the purchase of 1000 cans of Belton spray paint, 100 gallons of Novacolor acrylic; and the promotion and costs of community engagement events including presentations at Hotel Oakland and Malonga Casquelord Center and the mural dedication block party. Finally, we are hiring a professional Mandarin / Cantonese translator, Victor Luo, for the interviews, presentations, and subtitles for the documentary.

WHAT YOU CAN GET
Gift incentives included limited edition artwork, mural tours, CRP's mural anthology, and other merchandise.

WHAT HAPPENS IF THE FUNDRAISING GOAL IS NOT MET

EBFA will match your donation UP to $8,000. That means even if the goal is not reached your contribution will still be matched.

WHAT WILL BE THE IMPACT OF THIS PROJECT

This project will significantly transform blighted walls in the heart of downtown Oakland into a vibrant reflection of the diversity of the city's vast cultural heritage. Through the words of local residents, it documents the area's rich history. It build bridges between neighbors and community members. Finally, through the website, the public will be able to connect to local resources and all of the programs featured in the documentary.
story_txt:
BACKGROUND
The Community Rejuvenation
Project (CRP) has dedicated itself to cultivating healthy communities through
beautification, education & celebration, using public art as a foundation
for holistic, positive community engagement. Partnering with local government,
community-based organizations, business owners and business organizations, since 2010, CRP has created more than 100 murals painted in Oakland, Richmond,
and Hayward. These include projects commissioned by the
City of Oakland and the City of Richmond. CRP’s community partners past and
present include People’s Grocery, Restorative Justice for Oakland Youth, United Roots, Phat Beets, the University of Hip-Hop and many others. Since the mid 2000s,
CRP has promoted public art and education with regard to
youth development, teaching classes and workshops at numerous schools and
youth-centric programs.
For more info on the Community Rejuvenation Project, please check out www.CRPBayArea.orgTHE ALICE STREET MURAL PROJECTCRP is planning a video documentary and corresponding  mural project focused on the diverse African-American and Chinese communities intersecting at 14th and Alice Sts in Oakland. Twenty “culture keepers” from the historic Hotel Oakland and Malonga Casquelord Center will be interviewed on the history of the neighborhood, the communities that thrive there and their cultural practices. Translators will be used to conduct interviews with native Chinese speakers.The interviews will be used to guide a mural design process by CRP. The mural portion includes painting approximately 10,000-sq. ft of surfaces on three different properties facing a parking lot in a prominent downtown location, which will be completed by a team including CRP artists and youth interns. Through the words of local residents, it documents the area's rich history. It build bridges between neighbors and community members. Finally, through the website, the public will be able to connect to local resources and all of the programs featured in the documentary.

story:
Hello my Name is David McLeish,

I have spent the past five years working with Veterans, and teaching art as a means to expression. I would appreciate any assistance in supporting their efforts to participate in an exhibition during Art Basel Miami. Your donation will afford these two Veterans the opportunity to highlight their work on the national stage During art Basel MIAMI.

Your donation will go a long way to building their portfolio and career. 

They are both based out of Jacksonville and have shown a dedication to art and healing the community through art, and it would be great to reward their efforts by helping the participate in this world class exhibition.

Any funds raised over and above the 2,500.00 will be put towards future work with Veterans art expression.

story:
Who is this crazy nutter making a Mutant Vehicle?

Experienced mutant vehicle designer, Vulfie Munson, has successfully designed, funded, and transported two creative mutant vehicles to the playa, so if you had the chance to meet his previous mutants Frobot and Mr. Cephalopod, you know what you are in for and if not, in the gallery are a few photos of Vulfie's previous successful projects. His projects are both functional and beautiful in an otherworldly kind of way, so let's make this project happen.

What is a Mutant Vehicle?

A mutant vehicle is a unique, motorized creation that shows little or no resemblance to their original form, or to any standard street vehicle on the Burningman Playa. Mutant vehicles are radically, stunningly, (usually) permanently, and safely modified from their base vehicle just like CAVE, Ceti Alpha V Eel!

What we need and what you get:

Your contribution will allow us to finish building and transporting this beast. We have a basic structure: golfcart with fuel-efficient engine, generator and frame. What we still need is building materials for the outer carcass of the critter (including the shell and LED lighting for night time), and fuel & transportation to the playa (this is usually the biggest expense).

If our fabulous donation perks aren't enough, find us in the BRC during Burningman 2014 at Khan's Asylum (3:00 and Gold) for tasty beverages and good company. Flag us down on the playa and hitch a ride! (subject to availability)

Did somebody say "Perks"?!?

Redshirt Level: Contribute $5+ and receive a hearty thank you from the crew and ceremonial drink to your memory on the playa.

Yeoman Level: With a $10 contribution you will receive an official Ceti Alpha V Eel Sticker!


Ensign Level: Contribute $25+ and receive a Ceti Eel Embroidered Patch! (logo above)

Science Officer Level: Contribute $50+ and get a spiffy Khan-dom! A handy aluminum chainmail can cozy/phone case/or ?, that will keep your goods protected.


Captain Level: Contribute $100+ and we'll send you an original Ceti Eel ear cuff. Each one is uniquely different. Your brainwaves and memories will be reported back to our database. Made of wire and polymer clay.


Commodore Level: Contribute $200+ and receive a one-of-a-kind Khan necklace made of wires, polymer, alloys, and other things that your primitive intellect wouldn't understand. Each one is uniquely different.


Admiral Level: Contribute $500+ and get a Khan Necklace, a right and left Ceti Eel Ear Cuff, 2 Embroidered Patches, a Sticker, and a Hearty Thank You!

KHAN!!!: Contribute $1000 or more and get the mother of all prizes; An original 16"x20" acrylic painting signed by artist Vulfie Munson. (unframed on canvas) Each one is uniquely different.

More CAVE specifics:

Measurements: H 9' - L 18' - W 8'
Lighting: High intensity LED pirhana lights. 10 strips in blue.
Power: Honda 1000i generator (for lighting) and 15 hp motor (powers the vehicle itself).
Capacity: Seats 8 burners comfortably.
Transportation: 20'x8' open trailer by way of 4x4 Toyota Tundra (rental vehicle).

Can't contribute? You can still help!

Use Indiegogo's handy share tools to help get the word out. Let's make some noise!

story:
Short Summary

You can help the Moroccan Artist Imad Elbaz create his own Alabaster Stone and Art Gallery, called Imagine Paradise near Ouzoud Falls, Morocco!

Imad is a very talented artist who lives near the base of Ouzoud Falls in Morocco.  He is the main resource for artwork in that area.  If a shop owner needs a sign or a door painted, they must find Imad.  His name means Imad the Falcon. 

The traditions of the Berbers (Amazigh, “The Free People”) are very important to him, and he combines traditional with leading-edge techniques in his art pieces.  Now, Imad would like to establish his own alabaster stone and art shop, and you can help! 

Project Alabaster Stone

Like most artists around the world, Imad has struggled to support himself.  Two years ago he worked for a shop and learned the traditional stone techniques.  The shop owners asked him to sit outside carving stone every day, and also manage the store while they traveled.  He carefully sold items, took care of everything and learned the business well.  In return, they paid him about $10 a week, which is very low pay for this area.  However, Imad relates easily to tourists from many countries, and he knows that they like alabaster!

Alabaster is easy to carve and is extremely beautiful.  The carvers say it can “bruise” easily, so it’s important to take care while working with it.  One piece can take up to three days to carve and polish.  The tiny figurines are more difficult, and the carver must be very talented and experienced to create these pieces.  Alabaster stone is stunning, as you know, and comes in a variety of colors. 

Now, all Imad needs is some seed money to meet with elders in the mountains, buy the initial investment of alabaster stone, register his business, and get some good carving tools.

You can help Imad be financially independent. Soon we would like to travel to the mountain villages, and take you with us through videos and photos.  When we return to Ouzoud Falls, we will begin to build the art shop.  We've finally chosen a name, IMAGINE PARADISE.  We hope to include a shop, cafe and art gallery.

What We Need & What You Get

We have some nice perks, such as getting a portrait made of you or a loved one!  You can also choose from some beautiful Alabaster stone carvings.  Please look at the Gallery for some recent photos. 

Our goal is to raise $700 or more.  This amount will cover all the costs for the alabaster, tools, business registration, and transportation.  Any amount will help Imad to build more financial success.  If we don’t reach our goal, but do receive some funds, we will do as many steps as we can to establish Imad’s business.  This is the best idea for his financial freedom, and we are dedicated to building a wonderful shop and profitable business.

You will be helping a young man who lives in poverty but intensely desires to be an entrepreneur.  This project will transform his life.  And, we’re offering you some enticing gifts as perks!  Check them out to the right, and in the details below.

Risks & Challenges

We have heard of the artisans who live in the mountains, and we know the general areas and villages.  But, we have to do some investigative work on our journey to find them.  This will be fun, challenging and exciting.  However, I have a feeling that we will  meet the individuals who can teach us the most about stone carving.  I'm delightfully amazed with the amount of kindness and helpful here.  I’m sure we'll have a lot of assistance that will point us in the right direction.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute right now, there are other ways that you can help.  Can you share our link?

http://igg.me/at/alabaster

You can find Imad's art on Facebook at:

http://www.facebook.com/art.dreamingtribe

and find Imad on Facebook at:

https://www.facebook.com/imad.art.9


Thank you, dear friends!

story:
I'm Jordan Krall, author and publisher. I've had books published by Eraserhead Press, LegumeMan Press, Copeland Valley Press, MorbidBooks, and Black Rainbows Press.

My press is DYNATOX MINISTRIES and I've been publishing a wide variety of limited edition books in a wide variety of genres since December 2012.

For the last 2 years, I've held "KrallCon" which is basically a get together for authors, readers, and artists associated with Dynatox Ministries. The first one was fairly small and the second a bit larger. We even had author Rob Harris come over from the UK. The convention is held in East Brunswick, New Jersey for the most part but Black Betty's is in South Amboy/Sayreville which is only about 15 minutes away. East Brunswick is about halfway between NYC and Philly and is close to a few major highways as well as train/bus stations.

This is the second part of the campaign to raise money for this event. This part is to raise money for hotel costs for some of the guests who are traveling great distances (like author Michael Faun who is coming all the way from Sweden!).

By contributing, you’ll be helping some authors with their costs. You’ll also get a chance to own some exclusive books.

I thank you in advance!

story:
Hey there!

My names Shiverz/ReddKlaw/Sophie and I'm passionate about all things creative!

I have a BA(hons) in animation and I am a professional freelance artist by trade with almost ten years’ experience.

Originally from England, I travelled to Japan in search of a different life. After arriving I amazingly landed my first career in 3D animation.  Skipping forward to the present, I am still happily living in Japan and working as a 2D freelance artist, unfortunately I was unable to continue working in animation due to visa constraints. I am now hoping to return to the 3D animation industry and expand my existing freelance art career. In order to advance my goals I need new equipment, supplies and materials to work with; my current PC is too outdated to keep up the latest standard animation software, and I need constant exposure to this software in order to return to remain viable in this industry.
I work every day is a freelance artist (outside of my regular day job) art is my life. I am dedicated to my career as an artist; however dedication alone can only take me so far. That’s where this campaign comes in, with your wonderfully generous support and my hard work, dedication, and initiative, I believe I can make my lifelong dream of becoming a professional full time animator come true.

The Things I Need To Get Going

Ok, so let’s get to the specifics of what I need to get this thing started.

First:

The hardware.

Any animator knows you need a lot of engine room for animating, or anything creative. From picture editing to a full length 3D animation, you need to have the goods to help you create.

SO, to update my system to get into all that animating stuff, I am looking at one of the following:


MacBook Pro

(Minimum hardware) 

MacBook Pro 15” with retina display - MGXA2J – with English keyboard

Cost 210, 384yen = $1,825  = £1,147

This will run Autodesk Maya 3D, but for no more than 1-2 years.


(Recommended hardware)

Macbook Pro 15” with retina display – MGXC2J Options

2.8 ghz processor 1 tb hard drive with English keyboard and Apple Care

Cost  ¥379, 738 = $3,295  = £2,072 


OR


iMac

(Minimum hardware)

iMac 27” – ME088J

16gb ram

1tb fusion drive

magic mouse + trackpad English keyboard

Cost: ¥260,064 = $2,269 = £1,427 


(Recommended hardware)

iMac27” 5k - MF886J

4ghz processor

32gb ram 

4gb video card

English keyboard

magic mouse + trackpad

Cost: ¥425,736 = $3,714 = £2,336 


The other stuff:

Maya Autodesk 2014 -  ¥21,121/ $185 /£116 ~ ¥167,832/$1470/ £924

Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator/After Effects - Ranging from ¥2,000/$15/£9~¥6,000/$50/£31 a month.

Hey, even art materials like paints, pencils and all that jazz.

Courses that help me improve my skill, ideally this online course with iAnimate that trains you in the latest aspects of 3D animation:

https://www.ianimate.net/apply.html

As you can see, there's a lot to get started. But it's a matter of getting the ball rolling and riding that creative dream to where I want to be. I believe it's possible, especially when backed by you guys!


Why should I believe you?

Good question. Let me throw some lil' Shiv facts at you~

I am very career driven when you mix this with my one passion in life: art. I will do whatever I can to succeed. I have a very determined work ethic and follow my goals to the end. It’s how I ended up in Japan, and here.

Sounds cheesy and default, but wait....there's more!

A good and somewhat perfect example is my long career in art. Starting from a young age I kept that art desire alive throughout school, college and eventually I managed to gain a degree at University. This spans over a good percentage of my life, the university course alone was four years, so imagine the rest!  Post to this, gaining a freelance career along as well as employment in several areas within the industry. I continued my freelance art career even after moving countries.

Another point to mention is, well, moving to Japan. Let me put it this way: If you can imagine moving, not just to another city, or state, but to a completely different country, than you can imagine how much planning and drive was required to contemplate the practicality of moving to Japan, let alone to actually achieve this goal and move here, establish a life here and try to advance that life. I was not even dissuaded by the terrible series of events that occurred in Japan during March 2011.

No, this isn't an ego boost, or me exclaiming how awesome I am, I want to simply letting you guys know that this isn't the first time I've had challenging goals. I continue to work, plan, struggle and achieve… there have been mountains to climb in the past, but with focus and determination I was able to tackle them (metaphorically speaking, I’ve never angered a mountain). I am confident that your support is what I need to push through that final mile and turn my creative dream into my real world career.


It's not just money that can help.

Nope! You can also help by spreading the word too~ Tell your friends, family, neighbours, that dude you see at the bar sometimes, even your pets (They can totally understand you). Use those books of face and those tweetings, it all helps, and it is all deeply deeply appreciated.

you can see, there's a lot to get started. But it's a matter of
getting the ball rolling and riding that creative dream to where I
want to be. I believe it's possible, especially when backed by you
guys!

Why
should I believe you?
Good
question. Let me throw some lil' Shiv facts at you~
I
am very career driven when you mix this with my one passion in life:
art. I will do whatever I can to succeed. I have a very determined
work ethic and follow my goals to the end. It’s how I ended up in
Japan, and here.
Sounds
cheesy and default, but wait....there's more!
A
good and somewhat perfect example is my long career in art. Starting
from a young age I kept that art desire alive throughout school,
college and eventually I managed to gain a degree at University. This
spans over a good percentage of my life, the university course alone
was four years, so imagine the rest!  Post to this, gaining a
freelance career along as well as employment in several areas within
the industry. I continued my freelance art career even after moving
countries.
Another
point to mention is, well, moving to Japan. Let me put it this way:
If you can imagine moving, not just to another city, or state, but to
a completely different country, than you can imagine how much
planning and drive was required to contemplate the practicality of
moving to Japan, let alone to actually achieve this goal and move
here, establish a life here and try to advance that life. I was not
even dissuaded by the terrible series of events that occurred in
Japan during March 2011. 

No,
this isn't an ego boost, or me exclaiming how awesome I am, I want to
simply letting you guys know that this isn't the first time I've had
challenging goals. I continue to work, plan, struggle and achieve…
there have been mountains to climb in the past, but with focus and
determination I was able to tackle them (metaphorically speaking,
I’ve never angered a mountain). I am confident that your support is
what I need to push through that final mile and turn my creative
dream into my real world career. 


It's
not just money that can help.
Nope!
You can also help by spreading the word too~ Tell your friends,
family, neighbours, that dude you see at the bar sometimes, even your
pets (They can totally understand you). Use those books of face and
those tweetings, it all helps, and it is all deeply deeply
appreciated.

story:
Our Story

Infusion is a Cleveland based, co-ed performing arts group. Saturday, September 6th, Infusion presents Cleveland's largest variety show, the seventh annual Sin + Skin! The event will be held at The Performing Arts Center at The Cleveland Masonic Temple, on the corner of Euclid and E. 36th St. We pack the night full of live music with varying genres and performance art from across the spectrum. In the down time, patrons visit our vendors in the lobby to indulge in purchasing both items to take home and interactive services (i.e. caricature sketches).

After years of searching, we have found the perfect venue. There is plenty of stage and dressing room space, well lit vending space, free secured parking and entrances, air conditioning and everything else our theater loving hearts could possibly desire. The catch is that the room rental is close to double what we have paid previous years; $2500. We fear the increased cost, may decrease the profit. The profit is important, because it is how we pay all of the other acts and bands. On average, we have about 20 acts hit the stage throughout the night. We split the profit among all of the acts. You can see how starting at negative $2500, could pose a problem. Especially when we refuse to charge over $20 for admission. We want our patrons to have the best experience possible. We keep the ticket price low, so that the entire event can be fun and affordable. We want our patrons to be able to attend, play, drink and still have money left over to purchase products from our vendors, if they so choose.

The entire ideology behind our show is to treat the talent, the way we know they should be treated. Too often, local performers, troupes and bands invest a lot of their own money to do what they are passionate about and put on an amazing show for their audiences. Only to have bars, clubs and venues expect them to perform for free, while paying big national acts a ton of money. In our seven years performing  in state and out, and hosting this show, we have seen quite a few things and have learned a lot. A bad experience can crush spirits and ruin performances...whether it be not receiving guaranteed pay or dying of thirst underneath scorching lights, in a venue without air conditioning, on a 80 degree day. A little hospitality, consideration and appreciation, goes a long way. We work hard to give everyone the most fun, relaxed and best experience possible. It is our way of supporting the local arts and showing our appreciation to the community. 

Year after year, performers have jumped on the bill without a guaranteed amount of pay, because they trust us. We have proven our intentions and loyalty to the community. Each of them knows they will walk away paid and happy. The amount of pay is only undetermined, due to the many variables that can factor into the show's financial success. The last thing we ever want to do is make a promise we can't keep. They trust we always have their best interest in mind and know the more profit the door makes, the more they make. Thus, giving them the opportunity to invest in their own show, via costuming, props, equipment, etc. Performers put a lot of time, effort and money into bringing ideas to life for the sheer joy of entertaining an audience. Without you and without your support, there is no purpose behind the passion. 

What We're Asking & What We're Giving

Funds received from our vendors and sponsors help to pay for the costs encountered prior to show day. Such as: several mediums of design and advertisement, t-shirt design and order, security deposit for the venue, liquor license and alcohol, and food and water for the talent. We really couldn't do it without the immense support we've received over the years.
Funds received from YOU, the contributor, will go directly toward the cost of the venue. We chose a goal of $2500, because ideally we'd like to start with a zero balance due, day of show, but every bit helps! 
  • All donations of $3 or more will receive access to insider info regarding next year's show, before it is announced to the general public.
  • All donations of $5 or more will receive access to discounted, pre-sale tickets next year, before they are available to the general public.
  • $10 - receive a coupon for 20% of this year's Sin & Skin event t-shirt. 
  • $20 - receive a coupon for 30% off this year's Sin & Skin event t-shirt.
  • $30 - receive a coupon to redeem a FREE Sin & Skin event t-shirt. 
  • $30 - receive one general admission ticket to Sin & Skin and a coupon to receive 10% off of the Sin & Skin event T-shirt. PLUS a free gift from Visual Grammar 216.
  • $50 - receive a coupon to redeem a FREE Sin & Skin event t-shirt and an invite for you and a guest to attend this year's exclusive after party. 
  • $50 - receive one free general admission ticket to Sin & Skin and a coupon to redeem a FREE Sin & Skin event t-shirt. PLUS, a pair of tickets to the Combichrist show on October 8th at the Cleveland Agora.
  • $50 - receive one general admission ticket to Sin & Skin and a coupon to receive 20% off of the Sin & Skin event T-shirt. PLUS a free gift from Exile Leather.
  • $50 - receive one general admission ticket to Sin & Skin and a coupon to receive 20% off of the Sin & Skin event T-shirt. PLUS a free gift from Crow Leather Works.
  • $50 - receive one general admission ticket to Sin & Skin and a coupon to receive a free Sin & Skin event T-shirt. PLUS a pair of tickets to All That Remains at the Cleveland Agora on September 12th.
  • $75 - receive TWO general admission tickets to Sin & Skin and a coupon to receive 25% off of TWO Sin & Skin event T-shirts. PLUS a gift certificate from Cleveland Exotic Dance for $50 toward any regularly scheduled class.
  • $75 - receive TWO general admission tickets to Sin & Skin and a coupon to receive 25% off of TWO Sin & Skin event T-shirts. PLUS a gift certificate from Cleveland Exotic Dance for a FREE private dance lesson for up to 10 people.
  • $100 - receive a coupon to redeem two FREE Sin & Skin event t-shirts, an invite for you and a guest to attend this year's exclusive after party and two VIP passes to this year's show. *Each VIP pass includes admission to the event, reserved opera box seating and two drink tickets. 
  • $100 - receive an original, high quality print of an Infusion performance shot by Prismatic Vision Photography. Print is 24" x 36", autographed and framed. *See Gallery  for image.
  • $150 - receive a coupon redeemable to have Infusion perform at your event or private party, at no charge. Some conditions apply.
  • $250 - free entry to Sin & Skin for you and a guest, for life (includes this year's show).
Additional 
*Coupons, passes and invitations will be delivered via email. All items will be redeemable at the event. In the instance, you are unable to attend the event to collect your perks, please email booking@infusioncrew.com to make other arrangements. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share the event. Spread the word. Attend local shows. 
    https://www.facebook.com/events/1446150575647510/
    http://www.infusioncrew.com/sinandskin

story:
THANK YOU SO MUCH!

We've reached the end of our campaign and would like to send our big THANK YOUs to our friends who supported this project. We know that this is not the end for the tough days being experienced by the victims of Typhoon Yolanda. Nevertheless, the support they are receiving should be able to uplift their spirits and carry on.

AID 4 ART 4S

In light of the current tragedy - Typhoon Yolanda  (Haiyan) - that befell our fellow countrymen, including friends and relatives, we - the members of Styles, Strokes and Sketches Society (4S) - Philippines decided to extend our hand through the art works we make. Paint it forward!

MOTORIZED FISHING BOATS as MILESTONE GOAL

For every US$2,500.00 we raise, we will have a motorized fishing boat constructed and sent to our target communities. Otherwise, we will send funds through RED CROSS.

BENEFICIARIES

The objective of this campaign is to help rebuild the lives of those affected by Typhoon Yolanda-Haiyan. This typhoon destroyed the homes of about 673,000 individuals (channelnewsasia.com). We may not be able to target everyone, but we will make sure the short list we have will gain and hopefully start anew through the AID we provide.

We have planned to divide the collected funds and distribute them to the areas of
1. Estancia-Iloilo (relief efforts are yet to reach them)
2. Mahaplag-Leyte
3. Eastern Samar
4. Bgy. Lonoy-Roxas City

And of course, our efforts will be documented.

Below is a short docu-video shared by our member who lost their home, friends and relatives.



AID 4 ART 4S

AID in exchange for works of ART.

AIM


To help restore Typhoon Yolanda victims means of living.

SUMMARY


A Fund Raising Campaign for Typhoon Yolanda victims and 4S (Styles, Strokes and Sketches Society) artists.

For every contribution, an artwork will be given (a Postcard, a Shirt, a Personal or Group Portrait).

ABOUT 4S and this CAMPAIGN


As an organization of Filipino artists, we would like to use our talents to help our fellow artists and countrymen - particularly the victims of Typhoon Yolanda - recover from this hardship by donating funds we gather from this campaign.

The other side of this campaign aims to help aspiring and striving member artists by distributing their works as PERKS for those who will support this project. To help them, we will give proper compensation for their artworks.

In a nutshell, majority of the funds we gather will be donated to the Typhoon Victims. What's left will be used for the creation of PERKS, bank fees and other miscellaneous or administrative expenses.

PERKS


Perks will be in the form of POSTCARDS, T-SHIRTS and personalized PORTRAIT PAINTING (Pen and Ink, Coffee on Strathmore, Acrylic or Oil on Canvas).

Shirt design by Edmund Mamuyac


HOW

1. Artworks will be created in the Philippines by volunteer 4S members.

2. Postcard Perks will be sent to Contributors via BYPOST.COM

3. Shirts will be sent via Philippine Postal Service or other similar courier services.

4. Portrait Artworks (on canvass) will be sent as First-class Mail.

5. Motorized fishing boats will be constructed in Camarines Norte, Philippines.

We will focus on basic needs of our target communities such as 
1. Water containers
2. Nutritious Food that can be easily acquired
3. Infant formulas and Milk bottles
4. Over-the-counter Medicines for Kids and Babies
5. Art Materials for kids
6. Emergency Shelter (Tarps) and Basic Tools to rebuild homes
7. Source of Livelihood (fishing boats, nets)

We all know that this tragedy requires resources way bigger than our GOAL ($10,000.00) so in case we exceed that target, we will continue providing AID until all resources for AID is depleted.

DELIVERY SCHEDULES

Actual delivery schedules may be faster than the ones posted on the PERKS section. We just want to give ample time just in case we get problems with Shipping and Courier services. Boat construction may take longer but will be documented and posted on our Facebook campaign page: https://www.facebook.com/aid4Art4s

BREAKDOWN OF FUNDS

1. About 40 to 45% goes to Target Communities
2. 30% goes to Perks creation, Artists Honorarium and Shipping Costs
3. 15 to 20% goes to Indiegogo*, PayPal** and Banks for their services
4. 13% goes to administrative and other miscellaneous costs

* 35% goes to PERKS creation if we reach our goal (4% goes to Indiegogo)
** If we do not use PayPal, the 4.4% + $0.30 will be added to Typhoon Victims Fund

WHO WE ARE

Styles, Strokes and Sketches Society (4S) - Philippines, A group of Filipino artists currently focused on Portrait works. You can find us at the following Facebook Sites:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/358256030916523

https://www.facebook.com/ssssociety

Collage work (above) courtesy of Fernando Ymas, with inputs from Edmund Mamuyac

For reference, 4S also recently held an EXHIBIT at Singapore as part of the SINGA CUP 2013. 

Above: Oil Painting on 3' 6" x 7' 6" by Antonio Paras

Other sample works, as well sa photos of the devastation will be placed at the bottom of this page.


OUR ROSTER OF ARTISTS WHO VOLUNTEERED

Feel free to check out their works online.

Antonio Paras
Armar Ramirez
Carlo de Castro
Earlene Lee Collis-Smith
Edmund Mamuyac
Fernando Ranie Salazar
Fernando Ymas
Isagani Punzalan Carlos
Joan Honoridez
Jose Tolentino Jimenez
Liza Faunillan
Marlon Labitan
Noel David
Ric Sanchez
Ruben Furio
Vic Enciso
Yoj Baetiong

SAMPLE WORKS

Postcard Design (left) and Portrait Sketch (right) by Fernando Ymas


Watercolor/Acrylic (left) and Coffee Portrait Art (right) by Jose Tolentino Jimenez

Postcard Digital Painting (left) and Oil Pastel on Sandpaper (right) by Joan Honoridez


Digital Oil Paintings by Noel David


Digital Artworks by Ruben Furio


Above: 4S Entries for AUCTION with proceeds going to Typhoon victims


SINGA CUP 2013 Traditional Art Exhibit Entries

ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN'S CREATOR

Samuel T. Sendon II currently holds an administrative position at Styles, Strokes and Sketches Society (4S, Philippines) focused on Marketing and Publication tasks. Outside of the group, he is an active member of KABALIKAT CHARITY CIVIC COMMUNICATOR INC. (Talisay and Daet, Camarines Norte Chapters) who do volunteer radio communications assistance for the said province.

story:
Art With A Mission

                                                  Youth-Headed Households

Art can play a very important role in the lives of children, making a difference in their quality of life. As children create art, the process empowers them to explore their  thoughts and feelings and contributes to their well being through self-expression. 

Art With A Mission is a small organization dedicated to providing opportunities and support, through the arts, to children in need. 

Recognizing the need to support the financial, mental and emotional health of vulnerable children,  Art With A Mission has been working  to establish sustainable arts programming for children in Rwanda. 


In May of 2012 Renee Balfour, director of Art With A Mission-US, traveled to Rwanda to collaborate with Emmanuel Nkuranga, director of Art With A Mission-Rwanda and the Inema Art Center. Together they hosted art workshops for over 125 children.  In September Renee will return to Rwanda to continue working directly with children , assisting and supporting the children with the creation of paintings. She will return in October with an estimated 100 paintings by the children for an exhibition of their art. The exhibition "Gukiza" will open on October 1 at the McGuffey Art Center. The exhibition will include paintings, photographs and statements from the children documenting the process of creating their work. The childrens' artwork will be for sale, with proceeds returning directly to the children in the youth-headed households who produced them. The support the children receive through the sale of their work assists them with school fees and their basic needs. 

The creation and exhibition of the childrens' art allows the children  to freely express themselves and provides a sense of accomplishment and means of support. Working together, the children establish a bond and a strong sense sense of community through the creative process.   

As a way to share the diverse culture of Rwanda and its children and to engage children in our own community, a variety of children's events are scheduled at different locations around Charlottesville. In Support of Art With A Mission, the McGuffey Art Center,  the University of Virginia Center for Global Health, the UVa Global Surgery Initiative, and the African American Heritage Center, will host a series of month-long free events and classes. Events will include free dance, music and poetry performances. Children's classes in painting, clay, poetry, dance and music will be taught by local artists and visiting artists from Rwanda and are free to children in the community. The classes will allow children to learn about the culture of children in Rwanda and provide them with the joy of creative self-expression shared by children everywhere. 

Art With A Mission is seeking support to fund the exhibition costs, travel and materials and teaching funds. Exhibition costs include framing, photography costs, advertising and an opening reception. Travel costs include travel to and from Rwanda. Material costs include the costs of paints, canvasses and brushes for the children to create their artwork. Teaching funds will pay for teachers' materials and the cost of performance costs during the month-long events. 

Please consider making a contribution no matter the amount, $5 will provide a child with a canvas, paint and brushes to create a painting.

Art With A mission is entirely operated by volunteers and is dedicated to the establishment of sustainable children's art programming to provide long-term support to children through the arts. 

Please visit the photo gallery at the top of the page.
story_txt:
Art With A Mission
                                                  Youth-Headed Households
Art can play a very important role in the lives of children, making a difference in their quality of life. As children create art, the process empowers them to explore their  thoughts and feelings and contributes to their well being through self-expression. 
Art With A Mission is a small organization dedicated to providing opportunities and support, through the arts, to children in need. 

Recognizing the need to support the financial, mental and emotional health of vulnerable children,  Art With A Mission has been working  to establish sustainable arts programming for children in Rwanda. 


In May of 2012 Renee Balfour, director of Art With A Mission-US, traveled to Rwanda to collaborate with Emmanuel Nkuranga, director of Art With A Mission-Rwanda and the Inema Art Center. Together they hosted art workshops for over 125 children.  In September Renee will return to Rwanda to continue working directly with children , assisting and supporting the children with the creation of paintings. She will return in October with an estimated 100 paintings by the children for an exhibition of their art. The exhibition "Gukiza" will open on October 1 at the McGuffey Art Center. The exhibition will include paintings, photographs and statements from the children documenting the process of creating their work. The childrens' artwork will be for sale, with proceeds returning directly to the children in the youth-headed households who produced them. The support the children receive through the sale of their work assists them with school fees and their basic needs. 
The creation and exhibition of the childrens' art allows the children  to freely express themselves and provides a sense of accomplishment and means of support. Working together, the children establish a bond and a strong sense sense of community through the creative process.   

As a way to share the diverse culture of Rwanda and its children and to engage children in our own community, a variety of children's events are scheduled at different locations around Charlottesville. In Support of Art With A Mission, the McGuffey Art Center,  the University of Virginia Center for Global Health, the UVa Global Surgery Initiative, and the African American Heritage Center, will host a series of month-long free events and classes. Events will include free dance, music and poetry performances. Children's classes in painting, clay, poetry, dance and music will be taught by local artists and visiting artists from Rwanda and are free to children in the community. The classes will allow children to learn about the culture of children in Rwanda and provide them with the joy of creative self-expression shared by children everywhere. Art With A Mission is seeking support to fund the exhibition costs, travel and materials and teaching funds. Exhibition costs include framing, photography costs, advertising and an opening reception. Travel costs include travel to and from Rwanda. Material costs include the costs of paints, canvasses and brushes for the children to create their artwork. Teaching funds will pay for teachers' materials and the cost of performance costs during the month-long events. 
Please consider making a contribution no matter the amount, $5 will provide a child with a canvas, paint and brushes to create a painting.
Art With A mission is entirely operated by volunteers and is dedicated to the establishment of sustainable children's art programming to provide long-term support to children through the arts. 
Please visit the photo gallery at the top of the page.

story:
Introduction

Toria Garbutt is a spoken word artist from Knottingley - a deprived ex-mining town in West Yorkshire. From as young as 9 she kept a diary, and wrote poetry in parallel.

"Toria's words are silk javelins. Frank explorations of self, outpourings of a joyfully pained mind. She means it. Cos she's lived it. I love that girl" Mike Garry

Her resulting début album is an incredibly visceral and engaging collection of confessional, observational and character based punk poetry. With a punk heritage, a staccato heartbeat and a unique flair for storytelling, her work is brutally honest yet breathtakingly beautiful.


The album is being released by Nymphs & Thugs Recording Co., and independent spoken word record label formed in spring 2015. This campaign is also supported by A Firm Of Poets; a nationally established spoken word organisation that provided Toria with a national platform, and ultimately paved the way to this release.

 

Funding requirements

Right, so this is where we're at financially...

  • Manufacturing the albums: £400
    - 250x professionally manufactured CDs with on-disc artwork
    - Recorded at Eiger Studios in Leeds
    - Cardboard sleeves, hand screen printed by Robin Goodall at Wood Street Arts studios in Wakefield
    - Artwork designed by Nathan McGrory
  • Manufacturing the merchandise: £100
    -     Limited edition prints and tote bags, hand screen printed and hand framed by professional artists.
    - Punk-style pin badges designed by Nathan McGrory
  • Capturing the album on video: £250
    -     Working with a range of talented West Yorkshire-based filmmakers to capture spoken word videos for the Nymphs & Thugs YouTube channel
The label has finances in place to cover the basics if needs be, but with your help, we can give this album the campaign that it deserves, and you'll get much more it.

The Impact

From the moment that people see Toria perform, they're astounded at her work. Her remarkable honesty, her unflinching ability to delve far deeper than most would ever even discuss in private, and her integrity as both a writer and performer.

"These are confessional stories about love, heartbreak and addiction.  Getting them off my chest helps me to stay sane.  Some of my poetry is hard hitting and dark but there is hope and beauty in there too. On a personal level I suppose it's partly about getting closure." Toria Garbutt

"Art's not really considered a viable career option for working class kids.  There's this notion of poetry as an elitist pursuit and that's a shame because there are some incredibly talented kids out there whose voices aren't being heard.
I'm just speaking my own truth, in my own words, in my own style. I refuse to conform because to me authenticity is everything. There's a lot of bollocks in the media. We need people to say it like it is. These are stories that need telling." Toria Garbutt

Call it "credit crunch poetry" or just straight up "punk poetry" - in a nation in which the most vulnerable areas are strangled by poverty and agenda-driven austerity, Toria is both a shining beacon and a middle finger firmly raised.

Risks & Challenges

Spoken word in general is a hard sell, because most people refuse to engage with poetry, no matter how good it is or what it's about.

"Most people ignore most poetry because most poetry ignores most people" Adrian Mitchell

Toria's style doesn't conform with traditional poetic styles or values - so this album sits between the academic poetry fans, and those who wouldn't touch poetry with a bargepole. It's poetry for the rest of us - it speaks to the masses.

But we believe that she can break through and silence both camps - essentially it's a punk album, and with a nod to artists like John Cooper Clarke, Attila The Stockbroker and Patti Smith, we'll make them listen!

Toria has already charmed audiences nationwide, thanks to the platform provided by A Firm Of Poets - and the more help that you give, the more her audience will continue to grow.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the wonga but love the idea of Toria's campaign, then spreading the word on social media is just as valuable and incredibly important.

  • Share this campaign on your personal or professional networks
  • Follow and share Toria Garbutt on Twitter
  • Follow and share Nymphs & Thugs
    Website | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube | Instagram | SoundCloud

Thanks for reading, and thanks in advance for any support that you provide!

story:
Blank walls + artists + apprentices + YOU=Artstart Community Mural Project

With your support, we can hire young artists and give them an opportunity of a lifetime to work with professional lead artists to create murals in Sonoma County.

Artstart Community Mural Project


Artstart is a non-profit youth arts organization that hires young artists, between the ages of 15-21, to work with professional lead artists to create public works of art for Sonoma County. Artstart is commissioned by businesses, hospitals, individuals, and municipalities to create site specific artworks.


For the Community Mural Project,  we are trying something new! We have noticed multiple empty wall spaces on buildings where the owner has given permission to create a mural, but there are no funds. By supporting a publicly funded campaign, YOU are helping to make a difference.

Help us launch this new endeavor!

This project not only helps Artstart’s apprentices, but professional artists as well. This project will be taking art out of the conventional gallery space and into the community. This will help to beautify the area, and create more positive spaces in our city, where businesses and community will grow.


Our inaugural artists are Erik Burke and Julia Davis. Erik is an internationally known mural artist, who has painted on walls from Brazil to Miami to his hometown of Reno. He will be painting a mural along the train tracks on the side of the buidling located at 2nd Third Street in Santa Rosa.

 

Julia Davis is a local artist who has painted murals in Portland, Vancouver and just finished a mural on the side of Brotherhood Skate Shop in Santa Rosa. She will be painting a mural on the side of Mekong Market, located at 206 Sebastopol Ave in Santa Rosa.

Both of them bring a unique, vibrant and beautiful style to their work, and we are very excited about what they will create!


Also, if we raise more money, then we paint more murals!!  


For more information on the artists please visit their websites:


www.doyouknowbudsnow.com

www.eriktburke.com

 


What We Need & What You Get


For these two murals we are hoping to raise $5,500. That sum will help pay the lead artists, as well as the young apprentices working with them. The rest of the money goes towards supplies and Artstart. With any luck we will raise more than we need, which means we will be ready to paint more murals!


 We are printing up unique stickers and t-shirts with drawings by the artists as a perk for your donation of $25 and $60. At the $100 donation we are throwing a Mural Celebration party, here at Artstart, sometime in late summer. Both artists will be present to discuss their work, and we will have appetizers by local chef Gerard, of Gerard's Paella. There will be wine and beer and live music.
 
Other Ways You Can Help


We understand that donating is not within everyone's budget. If you cannot donate, tell your friends who can! Help us get the word out about this special project.

Special Thank You

Special thanks to Spring Maxfield, Judy Kennedy, Jenny Rose Edwards, and John Webley for their support! With out these Artstart supporters, this project could not have happened! THANK YOU!!

For payment by check, please mail to:

Artstart

716 Bennett Valley Road, Santa Rosa, CA  95404

 

For more information about Artstart visit www.artstart.us 

For more information on El Radio Fantastique, please visit their website at www.elradiofantastique.com

Artstart is a non-profit youth arts organization. Contributions for the purposes of Artstart Community Mural Project must be made payable to Artstart and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
About my project...

Hi, My name is Kyla Bourgh and I am crowd funding for my exhibition that is running from April 11th- May 2nd at the Gam Gallery in Vancouver BC. Canada.

Last summer, I was invited to an artist in residence program in Zurich, Switzerland to a creative community called Zitrone. While there, I was inspired by the wonderful, forward-thinking people who are dedicated to running this space. For my exhibition, I returned to Zurich, to examine the innovative and constructive use of a building that would otherwise stand empty.

I spent three months working with a photographer from Zurich documenting the four-story building and interviewing the people who are integral to running and maintaining the space. It is not subsidized by any organization but is run by the people who work in it.

My exhibition is a visual narrative that will introduce the overall concept of how Zitrone is run and how it can benefit other artistic communities.

I have been a practicing artist for the past 12 years focusing mainly on painting and poetry.  It became apparent while on this journey that my strongest passion is connecting communities and people and sharing solutions. 

The next 2-3 weeks will be the most crucial time and where I need the most support for the production of my exhibition.  I will be using my fundraising to cover the costs of equipment needed, supplies, and to contribute to some of the expenses of my journey . I went back to Zurich as a leap of faith to create this exhibition as well as to grow as an artist.

I hope that this campaign will support the completion of my project and in return there are many exciting perks.

I want to thank- you for your time and contributions.  I hope to see you at my exhibition.

Kyla Bourgh

Funding this project means...

  • Supplies, equipment and support to make this project happen.
  • Helping me recover some of the travel and living expenses. I went to create this project with funds from my own pocket and it was a leap of faith to create it. 
  • Help me share the experience with others and assist in starting up the dialogue about solutions for the loss of cultural space.
  • Contribute to the creation of a cross cultural and collaborative live stream between Zurich and Vancouver !

The Impact.

Your contribution will help with encouraging a dialogue around loss of cultural space to development.  This is an issue that is happening all over the world.  Any solutions can bring the creation of other solutions and opens a conversation about issues that need to be under discussion.

This is a passion for me and a beginning of much more work. I want to contribute to in bridging ideas that have cultural and creative impact.

Come meet me, join me at my exhibition, and be a part of the conversation.

My exhibition opening will be held Friday, April 11, 2014 join me at the Gam Gallery. 
located at 110 East Hastings, Vancouver BC Canada.

www.gamgallery.com

If you are in the Vancouver area and can join me for a social dialogue around the issues of areas that are losing culture to re-development, come and join the conversation!!!

There is also a chance for a cultural exchange between Vancouver and Zurich via live stream.

To be announced once funds are raised to make this part of the project happen. 
You can join us for the live stream and meet some of the people of Zitrone in Zurich, Switzerland!  I will be updating as things happen!

story:
Why we are asking for help.

We are a soon-to-be husband and wife team with a shared love of the arts. We operate a small gallery, Shrewdness of Apes, in Covington, Kentucky where we create and collect works of all sorts. We are asking you to be part of a collaborative art project we dreamed up while planning an adventure. We can't wait to do what we love - make stuff, find stuff, share stuff -  all while traveling across the sea.


We <3

A few things we can't live without: collaboration, tiny things, street art, assignments, taking pictures, flea markets & thrift shops, watercolors, over-the-top tourist attractions, getting mail, meeting people, leaving a mark, DOGS, exploring, nature, finding things, opening packages, memories, experiences, shared stories, rocks, fossils, weird stuff, stuff that looks cool, stuff that's old! 


If you like these things too, read on!

Getting the obvious out of the way, we are traveling from Cincinnati, Ohio to Norway, England, Wales and maybe beyond. We'll see where the wind takes us.  In addition to the travel, we want to do the things we love, explore the world, meet people and create.  Our project "You & Me Across the Sea" brings all of these things together. Whether we are scouring markets, visiting tourist attractions or hanging with nature we will be making a mark, taking something with us or leaving something behind. Plus we will be documenting our progress all along the way. 


So here's where you come in. In return for your generous contribution you will receive one of our perks. Pick the one that calls out to you, You will be part of our story and have some cool stuff to show for it.


In addition, we will have a gallery show of the art and/or photography associated with this project. You & Me Across the Sea - The Great Collaboration will debut in November 2014. All contributors will be listed along with their pieces, so if having something in an art show is on your bucket list reach out and grab this opportunity!


People are actually pretty great on the whole. 

You, you're the best.

While we know there are more important things for you to want to donate to, amazing important causes and innovative products, we believe that wonder and beauty and love make the world go round and we think our project is a perfect example! We will be collaborating with people and creating fun and memorable pieces. We love meeting new people and exploring new places. We love the idea of leaving things behind and imagining who will stumble upon them. We love that something ordinary can, through journey and intent, become rich with memory and bring a smile to the face of the person who looks upon it for years to come. We are excited.


Please check out our perks below to see our project in action. We think we have some great ideas, definitely things we'd grab ourselves, but if you have an idea that you think would work we'd love to hear it. Email us at tosoagallery@gmail.com.


Now for the perks!


Post It

Ever wish you could just send something out into the universe? Do you want to make your mark? With this perk we write your words on a post it and...you guessed it...post it somewhere.  

  • "NKOTB rules!"
  • "If you prick us do we not bleed?"
  • "I love you!!!!"  
Tell someone something in a way they'd never expect. Don't let Michael <3 Hilary be the only love story out there. Whatever you choose to say, we'll help you say it loud. We will take a photo for you and provide you with the exact location and then leave it there for all the world to see.


Chalk It Up

Faces and figures are everywhere! In Chalk It Up we will combine the spirit of street art with the patterns all around us. A log turns into a bear, a street sign becomes a smile and eyes make spirits at every turn. At your request we will turn the ordinary into something full of joy.  Whether you are declaring your love by means of a heart or sharing your love of that certain subject, let us know and we'll do out best to make it work. Or leave it up to us to find inspiration and send it your way. The sky's the limit!


Postcards

Often weird, wonderful and abundant throughout the world, we will find, buy and mail a postcard to you while on our trip. Who doesn't like getting mail, especially from a foreign country? This perk includes the purchase of a post card and postage back to your home. 

Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch - A special postcard request is being offered from this unique destination. Known as the town with the longest name in the world, postmarks from this tiny town can be much sought after. Should you choose this specific destination, we will make sure to get a postmark as well. It includes the whole name of the town and since postage often runs out we will be prepared with our own when we visit.

Frogner Park - Our second special request postcard is from Frogner sculpture park in Oslo, Norway. Most of the sculptures are some of the strangest you will see merging many human forms in towers, poses and shapes you wouldn't expect. We suspect there will be many interesting postcards available here and will make a special trip just for you.


Godzilla VS Postcard

This perk takes the tourist postcard and adds a monster! We will pick the best odd, touristy, or funny postcard we can find and add an invasion. Purchase of postcard, monster drawing and foreign postage included.


I'm with stupid => 

Those of you that know us have been waiting for this one. We will use iron on letters to emblazon your phrase of choice on a t-shirt. One of us will wear the shirt in public for at least a few hours. We will document ourselves and the reactions we get. When choosing this perk you will get our favorite photo printed and access to any additional ones online.

Examples include

  • the classic I'm with stupid
  • the entire alphabet
  • Stud Muffin ( Michael's example)
  • Backgammon players haunt my dreams (also Michael's example)
  • Isn't she lovely? (Hilary's example...although it's just asking for some tourist taken photo to show up of me bending over while wearing) 

No foul language please. We will be wearing these out in public.


Tiny you on a big trip

This trip sounds great already, right? Do you want to come along?This perk is one way for you to take the trip with us. Send us a photo and we'll print and cut out the subject. We will take this tiny version of you to see all the landmarks we see. At least two photos will be taken showing your tiny self enjoying Norway, Wales and places beyond. Don't worry they will be flattering. Want to send your dog? We want you to too! Any subject allowed. We will document your wee adventure and email these to you when we get back. We will also post them to our facebook page and they will be included in our upcoming show at SoA Gallery, You will also get...wait for it...the TINY YOU. We'll send you back to yourself all fresh from travels.


Somebody's watching me

This perk gets you a googly eyed creature born of a foreign land. We will grab an ordinary object found on our travels and add one of the best accessories, Googly Eyes. We will send you a photo and mail the creature to you all from across the world. A whimsical and a great addition to your family can be yours. We will make every effort to find something that screams out your name.



Mini Masterpiece

Everyone likes original artwork. Well, everyone we like likes original artwork. We love to create and inspiration is all around us. Whether an animal at the zoo, an interesting building, a beautiful sculpture or that waiter at the local restaurant, if you choose this perk we will draw and paint a custom 4 x 6 watercolor inspired by our surroundings and mail it to you while on our trip. Foreign postmarks and stamps along with a special thank you from us included. We will take photos of the work but should you want your piece on display you may bring it on down to the gallery and we'll include the original.



    Magical Monument

    Would you love to stumble across something extraordinary and beautiful when you least expect it? In this perk you can make that happen...for someone else. This is a perk of sharing in the best way possible. We will create a scene with you in mind using objects found in the surrounding area. It may be in a forest, a parking lot, a shopping center or a front yard. It might be on the coast or left in a restroom or on the side of the street. Whatever we create we will leave it behind for others to discover and enjoy. We'll take a photo for you and allow you to title the piece either before as an inspiration for us or after as a reflection of the work created. 


    Finding 50

    Do you love those really interesting photo studies where the photographer catches the most interesting things? So do we! With this perk we will do it 50 times over. With your purchase you can be the instigator. 50 different dogs, 50 different women, 50 different men, 50 different trees, 50 different pubs, 50 different meals, you get the picture (literally). This project will start at the airport in the good old US of A and continue to Norway and England and Wales and perhaps beyond. Each set will be unique to you and your name will be included in the final project. These will be exhibited at SoA Gallery and posted to our facebook page.



    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand if you can't help but certainly thank you for reading this far and giving us the chance. Think back...did any of it make you laugh? Did you wish you could do it? Did you think so-and-so would love that?? If yes then PLEASE share. We want a wide slice of life to be included in our story, the more the merrier and welcome any shares and forwarding you are willing to provide. We hope you'll take a moment to mention us on Facebook, twitter, Tumblr and all the rest. Especially to your friends with dollars burning holes in thier pockets. :)
story_txt:
Why we are asking for help.We are a soon-to-be husband and wife team with a shared love of the arts. We operate a small gallery, Shrewdness of Apes, in Covington, Kentucky where we create and collect works of all sorts. We are asking you to be part of a collaborative art project we dreamed up while planning an adventure. We can't wait to do what we love - make stuff, find stuff, share stuff -  all while traveling across the sea.We <3A few things we can't live without: collaboration, tiny things, street art, assignments, taking pictures, flea markets & thrift shops, watercolors, over-the-top tourist attractions, getting mail, meeting people, leaving a mark, DOGS, exploring, nature, finding things, opening packages, memories, experiences, shared stories, rocks, fossils, weird stuff, stuff that looks cool, stuff that's old! If you like these things too, read on!Getting the obvious out of the way, we are traveling from Cincinnati, Ohio to Norway, England, Wales and maybe beyond. We'll see where the wind takes us.  In addition to the travel, we want to do the things we love, explore the world, meet people and create.  Our project "You & Me Across the Sea" brings all of these things together. Whether we are scouring markets, visiting tourist attractions or hanging with nature we will be making a mark, taking something with us or leaving something behind. Plus we will be documenting our progress all along the way. So here's where you come in. In return for your generous contribution you will receive one of our perks. Pick the one that calls out to you, You will be part of our story and have some cool stuff to show for it.In addition, we will have a gallery show of the art and/or photography associated with this project. You & Me Across the Sea - The Great Collaboration will debut in November 2014. All contributors will be listed along with their pieces, so if having something in an art show is on your bucket list reach out and grab this opportunity!People are actually pretty great on the whole. You, you're the best.While we know there are more important things for you to want to donate to, amazing important causes and innovative products, we believe that wonder and beauty and love make the world go round and we think our project is a perfect example! We will be collaborating with people and creating fun and memorable pieces. We love meeting new people and exploring new places. We love the idea of leaving things behind and imagining who will stumble upon them. We love that something ordinary can, through journey and intent, become rich with memory and bring a smile to the face of the person who looks upon it for years to come. We are excited.Please check out our perks below to see our project in action. We think we have some great ideas, definitely things we'd grab ourselves, but if you have an idea that you think would work we'd love to hear it. Email us at tosoagallery@gmail.com.Now for the perks!
Post It
Ever wish you could just send something out into the universe? Do you want to make your mark? With this perk we write your words on a post it and...you guessed it...post it somewhere.  

"NKOTB rules!"
"If you prick us do we not bleed?"
"I love you!!!!"  Tell someone something in a way they'd never expect. Don't let Michael <3 Hilary be the only love story out there. Whatever you choose to say, we'll help you say it loud. We will take a photo for you and provide you with the exact location and then leave it there for all the world to see.
Chalk It UpFaces and figures are everywhere! In Chalk It Up we will combine the spirit of street art with the patterns all around us. A log turns into a bear, a street sign becomes a smile and eyes make spirits at every turn. At your request we will turn the ordinary into something full of joy.  Whether you are declaring your love by means of a heart or sharing your love of that certain subject, let us know and we'll do out best to make it work. Or leave it up to us to find inspiration and send it your way. The sky's the limit!


Postcards


Often weird, wonderful and abundant throughout the world, we will find, buy and mail a postcard to you while on our trip. Who doesn't like getting mail, especially from a foreign country? This perk includes the purchase of a post card and postage back to your home. Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch - A special postcard request is being offered from this unique destination. Known as the town with the longest name in the world, postmarks from this tiny town can be much sought after. Should you choose this specific destination, we will make sure to get a postmark as well. It includes the whole name of the town and since postage often runs out we will be prepared with our own when we visit.Frogner Park - Our second special request postcard is from Frogner sculpture park in Oslo, Norway. Most of the sculptures are some of the strangest you will see merging many human forms in towers, poses and shapes you wouldn't expect. We suspect there will be many interesting postcards available here and will make a special trip just for you.Godzilla VS PostcardThis perk takes the tourist postcard and adds a monster! We will pick the best odd, touristy, or funny postcard we can find and add an invasion. Purchase of postcard, monster drawing and foreign postage included.





I'm with stupid => 
Those of you that know us have been waiting for this one. We will use iron on letters to emblazon your phrase of choice on a t-shirt. One of us will wear the shirt in public for at least a few hours. We will document ourselves and the reactions we get. When choosing this perk you will get our favorite photo printed and access to any additional ones online.
Examples include

the classic I'm with stupid
the entire alphabet
Stud Muffin ( Michael's example)
Backgammon players haunt my dreams (also Michael's example)
Isn't she lovely? (Hilary's example...although it's just asking for some tourist taken photo to show up of me bending over while wearing) 

No foul language please. We will be wearing these out in public.






Tiny you on a big trip
This trip sounds great already, right? Do you want to come along?This perk is one way for you to take the trip with us. Send us a photo and we'll print and cut out the subject. We will take this tiny version of you to see all the landmarks we see. At least two photos will be taken showing your tiny self enjoying Norway, Wales and places beyond. Don't worry they will be flattering. Want to send your dog? We want you to too! Any subject allowed. We will document your wee adventure and email these to you when we get back. We will also post them to our facebook page and they will be included in our upcoming show at SoA Gallery, You will also get...wait for it...the TINY YOU. We'll send you back to yourself all fresh from travels.



Somebody's watching me
This perk gets you a googly eyed creature born of a foreign land. We will grab an ordinary object found on our travels and add one of the best accessories, Googly Eyes. We will send you a photo and mail the creature to you all from across the world. A whimsical and a great addition to your family can be yours. We will make every effort to find something that screams out your name.



Mini Masterpiece

Everyone likes original artwork. Well, everyone we like likes original artwork. We love to create and inspiration is all around us. Whether an animal at the zoo, an interesting building, a beautiful sculpture or that waiter at the local restaurant, if you choose this perk we will draw and paint a custom 4 x 6 watercolor inspired by our surroundings and mail it to you while on our trip. Foreign postmarks and stamps along with a special thank you from us included. We will take photos of the work but should you want your piece on display you may bring it on down to the gallery and we'll include the original.






  

Magical Monument
Would you love to stumble across something extraordinary and beautiful when you least expect it? In this perk you can make that happen...for someone else. This is a perk of sharing in the best way possible. We will create a scene with you in mind using objects found in the surrounding area. It may be in a forest, a parking lot, a shopping center or a front yard. It might be on the coast or left in a restroom or on the side of the street. Whatever we create we will leave it behind for others to discover and enjoy. We'll take a photo for you and allow you to title the piece either before as an inspiration for us or after as a reflection of the work created. 



Finding 50
Do you love those really interesting photo studies where the photographer catches the most interesting things? So do we! With this perk we will do it 50 times over. With your purchase you can be the instigator. 50 different dogs, 50 different women, 50 different men, 50 different trees, 50 different pubs, 50 different meals, you get the picture (literally). This project will start at the airport in the good old US of A and continue to Norway and England and Wales and perhaps beyond. Each set will be unique to you and your name will be included in the final project. These will be exhibited at SoA Gallery and posted to our facebook page.



Other Ways You Can Help
 We understand if you can't help but certainly thank you for reading this far and giving us the chance. Think back...did any of it make you laugh? Did you wish you could do it? Did you think so-and-so would love that?? If yes then PLEASE share. We want a wide slice of life to be included in our story, the more the merrier and welcome any shares and forwarding you are willing to provide. We hope you'll take a moment to mention us on Facebook, twitter, Tumblr and all the rest. Especially to your friends with dollars burning holes in thier pockets. :)

story:
.

An artist at heart while growing up in the Hudson Valley of New York, Jim Fricker attended a commercial arts college program during the mid-1980's. In the early 1990's Jim practiced as a NYS Licensed Massage Therapist before entering a formal education in music. During his career as a Jazz Guitarist, Jim performed in much of the U.S. as well as India, France, Switzerland and aboard the Carnival Victory Cruise line.

Jim has now launched The CollectiveArtsInk Podcast to discuss and explore the artistic process with Performing Artists, Visual Artists, Literary Artists, as well as Creative Arts Therapists. This audio podcast is available for internet streaming at The CollectiveArtsInk Podcast Website, as well as through the iTunes Store. The free iTunes download also contains a unique slideshow for each episode, viewable via iTunes or your mobile device.

The CollectiveArtsInk Podcast is a single person operation. Maintaining a low overhead, every dollar raised will be used to develop educational and entertaining content.

This Fundraising Campaign is necessary to raise capital for Grant Eligibility, Transportation Costs, Promotional Material, Internet Bandwidth/Storage, as well as Artist Fees.

Guests include: Orchestral Conductor, Literary Novelist, Jazz Composer, Dance Choreographer, Acting Coach, Art Therapist, Photographer, D.J., Musician, Poet, Storyteller.

Goals Include: One Hundred Episodes, Live Promotional Events, Regional Sponsorship, Radio Syndication.

With a donation, not only will you get a permanent listing on The CollectiveArtsInk Podcast Website, but you can also receive such perks as The Official Podcast Mug, BumperSticker, T-Shirt with The CollectiveArtsInk Podcast Logo, A choice of Original Prints with Archival Framing. As you can see, not only will you be helping to build a stronger community for The Arts, but you will also receive a great gift.

Recent Guests Included:

Lisa Gakyo Schaewe          Art Lande               William Stoehr

story:
Project: I am currently compiling a zine (self published chap book) all about the wonderful city of Kitchener Waterloo (and the surrounding area).   I have been absolutely blown away by the incredible submissions I have received and the talent that exists in and have been fostered by this community.

Plea: I would like this zine to be free or very cheap as I want as many people to enjoy this content as possible. I hate to ask my friends and loved ones for money, as I know times are tough for so many of us, but if you would be generous enough to contribute any amount of money (however small) to the cost of printing I would be extremely grateful.  

Recognition: Each person who contributes money will receive a complimentary copy of the zine (mailed to you) and acknowledgement as a patron in print in the zine.

Other ways you can help: if you are unable to contribute financially, I would live if you could help by getting the word out! Please pass this request along to anyone who loves art & our strange, beautiful, complex community. 

Thanks so much for your consideration and for all of your support!

Xoxo Ellie Anglin

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST:

Fine artist Ethan Holland was invited to share his talents abroad with Artists 2 Africa, participating as an apprentice on this tour representing his discipline of painting. He is one of several artists throughout the U.S. invited to teach other creative mediums including: Carren Clarke-Mcadoo (VA), Shurvon Haynes (WA), Jolyn E. Gardner (WA), Karen Y. Buster (MD), Tommy Roberts (MD), and Larry Poncho Brown (MD), to name a few. A noteworthy group of American artists exchanging creative education with African artists!

ABOUT A2A:

ARTISTS 2 AFRICA was birthed from decades of artists discussing the prospect of organizing a group journey to Africa tailored specifically for artists and focused on art education. On October 19-30, 2013 we will embark on our second official journey to Ghana West Africa!

The artists will journey into the art villages on the outskirts of Ghana. Various artisans including painters, sculptors, and weavers will be gathered in their workshops to create and collaborate. We will fellowship with the artists and students, visit their workshops to share technique, and explore the creative process, while exchanging our creative ideas with the artisans in the region. An exhibition will be organized featuring the works of each artist. Our focus is to educate and connect through ART.

HOW WILL YOUR FUNDS BE UTILIZED?

With your support we hope you will assist us with this unified effort. As you can see on the right...the artist has graciously donated his art for pledge rewards. The campaign is to assist us with acquiring art materials for other artists to use on our visit as we fellowship by creating art. We will be visiting 4 locations where ceramic, wood carving, fabric making and other artforms are taught and produced. We will introduce various art projects and will instruct several groups of artisans and other participants. Funds will assist with art supplies and materials, and small tools. We also plan to document this experience with photography and video as a future educational medium. We hope you will take advantage of this unique opportunity to assist with this project....thank you. Share.Teach.Create!
